loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a second central refrigerator to increase his business.

loans.name: Turpa

texts.en:
Turpa is a 46-year-old woman. She lives with her son Zakaria, who works as a security guard and gets a small monthly income. Turpa has a small plot of agricultural land, where she grows peaches. She sells the harvest locally. 

She wants to start a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL to purchase calves. She will raise them and will expand the livestock in future. Turpa awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Zulpia

texts.en: Zulpia is 40 years old. She lives in Gardabani district. She is unemployed and wants to start a trading business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1000 to purchase clothes. She will purchase clothes from the wholesalers and then will resell them at higher prices among her villagers. Zulpia is very motivated to be involved in her own business and generate income. She plans to expand the business gradually.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: 09 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huyền has a medical clinic to do health services. She is requesting a loan to purchase more equipment for her health service. Huyền is 34 years old, and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 09 Đông Hải Solidarity Group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Huyền has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Huyền faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her child to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment to do health services.

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Женщина с прекрасной душой и добрым сердцем занимается агробизнесом более 20 лет. Барно замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 несовершеннолетнего сына. Ее муж работает в ИМОНе.  Барно выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу и картофель. Она также постепенно развевает бизнес скотоводством. Барно в основном откармливает крупно-рогатого скота. Она сама выращивает корм для скота и поэтому получает хороший прибыль. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развевать бизнес. С полученного бизнеса она хочет улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This woman with a wonderful spirit and kind heart has been in the agricultural business for more than 20 years. Barno is married and is raising one young son. Her husband works at IMON. Barno grows wheat, corn and potatoes. She is also gradually developing a cattle breeding business. Barno primarily fattens up bulls and cows. She grows feed for the cattle herself which is why she makes a good profit. She plans to increase her working capital and thus develop her business. With the received earnings, she wants to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital.

loans.name: Marco Edsson

texts.es: Marco es un hombre de 42 años de edad soltero y padre de 2 niños de 10 y 13 años, ambos  niños ayudan a su padre en los quehaceres del hogar y también en el trabajo. Los 3 juntos se encargan de la venta de pollos dentro del mercado de Sacaba. El hijo menor se despierta a las 5 am y se encarga de recoger agua para hervirla y así tomar desayuno, mientras su padre y su hermano mayor se encuentran recibiendo y/o descargando los pollos para el comercio diario. Los 3 son felices aunque extrañan a su madre. El señor Marco recuerda que nunca tuvo agua potable en su casa y por eso tampoco baño, “cuando era niño nunca tuve agua ni baño, pero me las ingeniaba y luego me acostumbré..”. Marco sueña con darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, le gustaría que continúen en la escuela que estudien y que sean hombres de bien. Marco sabe lo difícil de su  trabajo y piensa que sus hijos deben tomar otro camino, es por ese motivo que marco solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua para el baño y lavandería a fin de mejorar la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marco is a single 42 year old man who is the father of two children aged 10 and 13 years old. Both of them help their father with the house-chores and help him with his work. The three together take care of selling chickens at the Sacaba market. The younger son gets up at 5 am and gets water to boil and has breakfast while his father and brother are found receiving or unloading the chickens for the days' commerce. The three are happy but they miss the mother

Marco recalls that they never had running water and therefore no bathroom. "When I was a child we had no water nor a bathroom but I was inventive and we got used to it". Marco dreams of providing his sons with a better future. He would like them to stay in school and become good men. Marco understands how difficult his work is and thinks his sons should take another route. For this reason Marco is requesting a loan to install water or the bathroom and a wash stand to improve the lives of the family.

loans.use: to install water, a bathroom and wash stand.

loans.name: 01 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Tâm is 51 years old and she is married with one child. She lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook soup to sell.

In 2004, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the group leader of the 01 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of four members.

In the future, Tâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to cook soup to sell

loans.name: 021301030003 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Luận is 49 years old and she is married with two children. She lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She works in agriculture raising pigs, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Luận faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Luận is the group leader of the 021301030003 Thôn 3 - Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of four members.  This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  With her business profit, she hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jonathan Edgardo

texts.es: Jonathan tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre, hermana y 4 hermanos. Él es un joven muy trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de pollos de forma ambulante. Tiene dos años de contar con dicho negocio por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Con el deseo de brindar mejores condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor dado que cuando llueve el agua se filtra. Además, desea encementar el piso del interior de la vivienda.
texts.en: Jonathan is 21 years old and lives in his own house with his mother, sister and 4 brothers. He is a hard-working youth who sells chickens in the street. He has been in this business for two years and has a lot of clients who prefer him more and more. With the desire to provide better living conditions he has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to invest in building a corridor given that when it rains water enters the house. Also he wants to cement over the floors inside the house.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, galvanized laminate and wood.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 66-year-old, married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He deals in farming as well as retail. He faces challenges of changes in weather, especially drought.  He hopes to set up a milking machine since he has great interest in dairy farming. Joseph needs a loan to improve on his farm by putting in fertilizers and pruning the tea.

loans.use: to improve his tea farm by putting in fertilizers and pruning the tea.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina appreciates the previous loan that helped her school in buying furniture and stationery for the school.

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy books and pens for her staff and books for the children to use.She is glad for the support from Yehu and Kiva at large

loans.use: to buy books and pens for her staff and books for the children to use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new ice-cream refrigerator to keep the ice-cream and some drinks in a cold condition.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda lives with her family in Mrganush village, in the Ararat region. She and her family have been involved in agribusiness for 15 years. They run a farm which includes a cow, two calves and a big orchard where a large variety of fruit trees are grown (peach, cherry, plum, nut, apple and pear). Seda's father and brother sell the gathered harvest at local markets to earn an income for the family's living. Agriculture is the only source of their income so it is very important for this hardworking family to run their farm in a sustainable way. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is important for Seda to pay for renovations to the barn and to purchase 2 oxen. As this is Seda's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for renovating the barn and to purchase 2 oxen

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a married woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and water.  For the past three years, she has operated an agricultural selling business, selling produce from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak leading to losses. She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income. With the loan that she is requesting of KES 15,000 she wants to purchase more seedlings and pesticides. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and pesticides.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a 20-year-old single mother of one. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe where she sells groceries such as sweets, flour, beans, salt, peanut butter, biscuits, and cooking oil out of her home to help serve and feed her community.  Prisca is also volunteering as a Learner Guide, teaching students life skills and assisting children with homework. 

With a Kiva loan, she wants to buy more stock in bulk so that she increases her sales volume and profit margins in order to support her child. She also hopes to hire someone to help operate her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries in bulk to reduce costs and increase profits.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and four go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a restaurant from home. She has been in this business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rearing cattle. She has requested a loan of 2,200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy serving utensils, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and soda. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business to a five star hotel. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy serving utensils, rice, flour, soap, cassava, green bananas,and soda.

loans.name: 07-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Oanh is 46 years old, and she is married with one child. Oanh is the group leader of the 07-Quảng Hưng Solidarity Group, which consists of eight members.  She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Oanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.ru:
Тожинисо добрая отзывчивая женщина, проживающая в предгорном селении района Хуросон, где основным видом деятельности являются животноводство и растениеводство. В числе жителей этого района Тожинисо тоже занимается животноводством. Она в течение 6 лет разводит молодых телят с целью дальнейшей продажи. Тожинисо в этом деле помогает ее единственный сын. Она имеет еще одну дочь. Муж работает в чужой стране и Тожинисо сама занимается воспитанием детей. 
В данный момент Тожинисо просит кредит, чтобы купить еще пару телят и корма для них. Она надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Tojiniso is a kind and compassionate woman. She lives in a village at the foot of a mountain in the Khuroson District. In the Khuroson District, the main types of businesses are livestock breeding and crop farming. Like the other residents of this District, Tojiniso also practices livestock breeding. For the past 6 years, she has been raising young calves in order to sell them in the future. Tojiniso's only son helps her with this business. She also has one daughter. Her husband works in a different country so Tojiniso is raising her children by herself. Tojiniso is currently requesting a loan to buy a pair of calves and feed for them. She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves and feed for them.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate is a forty-two-year-old married female with six children that all attend school. She has been a food vendor located in the market in Kasese-Uganda for five years and she farms for additional income. Immaculate hopes to expand her business, however, a lack of capital is challenge. She is requesting a loan to buy bananas and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nzingo

texts.en: Nzingo would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 20,000, to buy four more sacks of coconuts to sell for better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy four more sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Romulo Antonio

texts.es:
Rómulo es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo. Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para poder cualquier cultivo a producir.
El tiene un cultivo bastante grande de plátano y yuca el cual trabaja todos los días para vender sus cosechas.
Gracias a sus 30 años de experiencia tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas.
El solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y de esta manera inyectar capital a su actividad. 
Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias.
texts.en:
Rómulo is a veteran with a lot of farming experience.    He is humble and sincere and has a great gift with people.  He has enough energy to  produce any crop.  He has a large plantation of banana and yuca which he works every day in order to sell his harvest. 

Thanks to his 30 years of experience he is easily able to work and thrive in this business.  He requests a loan to buy agricultural materials to inject capital into his business.  He has a lot of faith in his business and great hopes for people to be supportive.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to increase his sales. Since he will have a greater number of animals to offer, the essential ones will remain so that he is never in a position where 0 animals remain.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is from Taperakan village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband and 24-year-old son. Hasmik and her husband are farmers and their son is employed in a local wine factory. Near the house where they live, Hasmik and her husband own arable land. They cultivate tomatoes, onions and grow peach, apple and pear trees. The gathered harvest is realized in local markets and that is the main income of the family. As this is Hasmik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and watering costs.

loans.name: Fabio Jesus

texts.es:
Fabio es un hombre emprendedor y diligente, vive en el municipio de Sincelejo con su esposa y su hijo. Trabaja todos los días en la venta de jugos de fruta que el mismo prepara y posteriormente comercializa de manera ambulante en un carro adecuado para la actividad.
Inicio con el negocio al ver que era una actividad muy rentable y nadie la ejercía, teniendo la profunda necesidad de obtener ingresos para su familia fue como empezó a introducirse en este medio y hasta hoy manifiesta que la ido muy bien ya que tiene varios clientes y buenas ventas.
El solicita un préstamo para comprar otro carrito de jugos para darle empleo a otra persona y así poder duplicar sus ingresos. Tiene una esperanza inmensa en este nuevo proyecto y dice estar muy satisfecho con todo lo que ha podido lograr.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de impactar mucho mejor su economía al poder cubrir una mayor parte del mercado.
texts.en:
Fabio is an enterprising and diligent man who lives with his wife and son in the town of Sincelejo.  He works every day selling fruit juices that he prepares himself and sells from a specially set up cart.

He started the business because it was very profitable and no one else was doing it.  He needed to obtain an income for his family, so he started doing this and he says that to date things have gone well for him and he has various customers and makes good sales.

He is asking for a loan to buy another juice cart so he can give a job to another person and be able to increase his income.  He has a great hope in this new project and says that he is very satisfied with all he has managed to achieve. 

This loan will provide the opportunity to improve his finances and cover a large part of the market.

loans.use: to buy a second juice cart.

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
Gouri, the lady standing with a raised hand in the photo, is a hardworking, active and confident woman of the village of Goimundi in Nuapada district in Odisha, India. Her age is 28, and she is residing with her husband and son of one year’s age.
 
Gouri has a vegetable cultivation farm being managed by her husband. He produces different types of vegetables, such as brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, cabbage, chilies, ladies finger (okra), etc., on her farm. Apart from that, Gouri herself manages a sweet and salty dry food items making and supply business in her house. She supplies the retailers of nearby villages. 

From the above two businesses, Gouri earns a monthly income of 5,000 INR. With this income, Gouri maintains her family, purchases dough, oil, sugar, etc. for her dry food-making business, and seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation. She says, “I want to expand my business and cultivation, but finance is a problem for me.” 

After Mahashakti started intervention in her village, Gouri, along with twelve other women of her village, formed a Self-Help Group named “Mahalaxmi” and took a loan of 16,000 INR. With this loan, Gouri will purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farming, and dough, sugar, oil, etc. for her dry food business. 

Gouri dreams to construct a house and educate her children to lead a respectable life. 

The other members of this group are also involved in microenterprises of their own.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farming, and dough, sugar, oil, etc. for her dry food business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre soltero de 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos en la localidad de Sacaba en la ciudad de Cochabamba, es el menor de 6 hermanos, cuando nació su primer hijo (hace 20 años) tuvo la suerte de encontrar un trabajo en una imprenta cercana a su domicilio. Al pasar del tiempo su familia fue creciendo y los gastos fueron aumentando; “al principio a mi hijo mayor todo le daba luego llegó su hermanito y compartían, ahora mi cuarto hijo usa toda la ropa de su hermanos …”.
La labor de José es constante, con su esfuerzo logró conseguir el capital monetario para la construcción de un techo para su familia; “vivíamos de prestado a veces nos corrían y no teníamos a donde ir…” cuenta José.
En este momento se encuentra terminando la construcción de 2 habitaciones en el lugar donde vivirá, es por esta situación que José necesita el préstamo de kiva y así utilizarlo para comprar material de construcción y finalizar la construcción de la instalación de agua para un baño y lavandería.
texts.en:
Jose is a single man who is 43 years old. He lives with his 4 children in the town of Sacaba in the city of Cochabamba. He is the youngest of 6 siblings. When his first son was born (20 years ago), he had the fortune of finding a job at a printing office near his house. As time passed, his family grew and his expenses increased: "At first, I gave everything to my oldest son. Then his little brother arrived, and they shared. Now my fourth son uses all of his brothers' clothing."

Jose's work is constant. With his efforts, he succeeded in obtaining the monetary capital to build a roof for his family. "We lived in borrowed housing. Sometimes they moved us, and we did not have anywhere to go," says Jose.

Currently, he is finishing the construction of two bedrooms in the place where he will live. It is for this reason that Jose needs a loan from Kiva. He will use it to buy construction materials and finish the construction of the installation of water in a bathroom and the laundry.

loans.use: to install water in a bathroom and the laundry.

loans.name: Kamengo United Group

texts.en:
Olive, who is also a member of Kamengo United Group, is 50 years with six children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She has a retail business, in addition to farming. She is facing challenges of bad debtors and high rent expenses. She has a vision of buying more cows to expand her farm. 

Olive needs a loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Viktoriya

texts.ru:
Виктория веселая, добрая и трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 34 года. Замужем, имеет одного сыночка. У Виктории очень дружная понимающая семья. Она со своей семьей живут отдельно от родителей, но их бизнес семейный. Они все дружной семьей открыли столовую на центральном рынке района. Там Виктория готовит, вкусные национальные блюда кроме этого её муж Сергей производит узбекскую самбусу.Дело пошли в лучшую сторону. У Виктории  много клиентов, ей в этом помогает её общительность и дружелюбие и, конечно же, вкусные блюдо. Так как число посетителей растет нужно теперь умножить количество посуды и кухонных принадлежности, чтобы соответствовала санитарии.
 Но Виктории для покупки посуды немножко не хватает денежных средств, поэтому она подала заявку на кредит. Виктория надеется на поддержку организации и заранее выражает свои благодарности МДО Арванд.
texts.en: Viktoriya is a happy, kind and hardworking young woman. She is 34 years old. She is married and has one little son. Viktoriya has a very close-knit, understanding family. She and her family live separately from her parents, but her business is a family one. Her entire close-knit family opened a cafe in the district's central market. At the cafe, Viktoriya cooks delicious ethnic cuisine while her husband Sergey makes Uzbek sambusas (Central Asian meat- and vegetable-filled pastries). The business has been going very well. Viktoriya has many customers because of her gregariousness, her friendliness, and of course, her delicious food. As the amount of customers is growing, she now needs to increase her amount of dishware and cooking utensils to keep up with sanitary standards. However, Viktoriya does not have quite enough money to buy these dishes, which is why she applied for a loan. Viktoriya relies on this organization's support and thanks MDO Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy dishes and cooking utensils for her successful cafe.

loans.name: 020703010003 Thôn 5- Hoằng Thịnh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bắc is 38 years old and married, with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Bắc works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

In 2010, Bắc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bắc has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Bắc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Bắc is the group leader of the 020703010003 Thôn 5- Hoằng Thịnh solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Bắc hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Tý is 54 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

Tý operates a food stall/restaurant selling sticky rice. She has been involved in this business for five years; one of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Tý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tý is the group leader of the 04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sticky rice to cook and then to sell. 

With her business profit, Tý hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more sticky rice to cook and then to sell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has two children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over four years, she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing a tailoring college in the near future

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase cloth material and thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and thread for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy animals to increase his production and economy, establishing himself in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Abagambakamu Women Gp Kabata Kisomoro Group

texts.en:
Doreen is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is in retail and farming. She is facing a challenge of less capital, however, she hopes to have a well-stocked retail shop that can attract more customers. 

Doreen needs a loan to buy maize, soap, and cassava flour to sell. 

She is a member of Abagambakamu Women Gp Kabata Kisomoro, where members guarantee each other to get a loan as they don't have to have security.

loans.use: to buy maize, soap and cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She operates a grocery in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last year; she works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses. 

Alaisha has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and snacks. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to the university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, flour and snacks

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 33-year-old divorced woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a food stall in the market and she sells vegetables to get daily income for living.  She has been in the business for seven years. 

She is affected by sickness and harsh weather, which makes her vegetables go bad quickly. She dreams of having a big stock of vegetables, to sell in large quantities to other vendors, and to have freezers to keep her vegetables fresh. 

She needs a loan to buy tomatoes, eggplants, and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, eggplants, and onions  to sell.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Silibaziso

texts.en:
Silibaziso is a 27-year-old businesswoman who is married with three children. She lives in Nkayi district, Zimbabwe. 

She has been successfully running a grocery business for the past six months, selling flour, sugar, soup thickeners, cooking oil and different types of drinks. Silibaziso also volunteers as a Learner Guide in her community, where she teaches students well-being and life skills. 

With the Kiva loan, she will buy more stock and increase her sales and profits. 

With the profits she wants to educate her children and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more food items for her stock

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a 21-year-old married mother of one living in the Mwenezi district of Zimbabwe. She rents a shop at her local business center where she sells groceries such as sweets, flour, canned beans, peanut butter, salt and biscuits. 

Patience is also volunteering as a Learner Guide, teaching students life skills and assisting children with group work. 

With a Kiva loan, she wants to increase her inventory to grow her sales volume and boost her profit margins. Patience also wants to employ someone to assist her in the business.  

Her income will help support her family and provide for her child.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of groceries and hire assistance.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. She is a 24-year-old businesswoman who is currently renting a flea market stand to sell a variety of clothing. When she is not at the business, she serves as the district chairperson for Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. Through this network she assists young people in school with sessions on life skills and well-being. 

With the requested Kiva loan she will improve her business by ordering a variety of clothing. This will help her to attract more customers and increase her sales and profits. One day, she hopes to expand her business into a boutique and further her education so that she can become a professional teacher in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing.

loans.name: Luisa Dolores

texts.es: Luisa tiene 62 años de edad y habita junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. Luisa se gana la vida mediante la venta de tamales de forma ambulante. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Luisa solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared en la vivienda para dividir la cocina de un cuarto dormitorio. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro,e tc.
texts.en: Luisa is 62 years old and lives with her 8-year-old son who is in school. Luisa earns a living as a street vendor selling tamales. This is how she makes a living and covers household expenses. Luisa is asking for this loan from FUSAI (Kiva Field Partner) to invest in the construction of a wall in her home to separate the kitchen from a bedroom. With the amount requested she will buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, bricks, iron, etc. to build a dividing wall in her home.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
Nomatter is a 20-year-old businesswoman who lives with her parents in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. 

Nomatter runs a shop in her local business center to sell rice, chili, sugar, beans and bread to help feed her community. 

When Nomatter is not at her grocery shop, she volunteers as a Learner Guide teaching local students life skills education. 

With a Kiva loan, she wants to buy bulk quantities of groceries  to increase her profit margins. Increasing her income will help to support her family and become financially self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of groceries.

loans.name: 10 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hội raises  poultry and requests a loan to purchase  chicks to raise and sell in future.  Hội has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 
This is Hội first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Hội faces in her business are illness.

Hội is 57 years old and  married with 4 children.  She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 10 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

In the future, Hội hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
la señora Cándida tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos en etapa escolar, ella recuerda haber tenido 2 labores en toda su vida, comenzó lavando ropa para ayudarle a su mamá, a quién recuerda con nostalgia.
Cuando Cándida tenía 17 años de edad una vecina del barrio la contrato para que le ayude a cocinar, “cocinábamos variedad de cómidas dependiendo del día y la estación, nos iba muy bien…”, con el paso de los años la señora Cándida tuvo familia y así fue que se independizó y familiares y amigos le ayudaron, también 2 niños que corrían frente a su puesto de comida que fueron y son la luz de  su vida.
la señora Cándida pudo acceder a la compra de un lote de tierra en su amada Sacaba, con los años logró la construcción de 2 cuartos, donde reparten las dependencias como; Dormitorios, comedor, cocina y a veces; ‘salón de fiesta’ comenta con risas en el rostro.
la señora Cándida está feliz porque va a venir un nuevo integrante a su familia; su nieto. Es por este nuevo familiar que necesita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable para su hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cándida is 53 years old, single, and has two school-aged children.  She recalls having had two jobs all her life.  She started washing clothes to help her mother, who she remembers with nostalgia.

When Cándida was 17 years old, one of her neighbors hired her to help her cook.  “We used to cook a variety of foods, depending on the day and the season.  Things went well for us.”  Over time Cándida had a family and she went out on her own and her friends and family would help her.  She also had two children who would run and play in front of her stall and who were the light of her life.  Cándida was able to buy a lot in her beloved Sacaba and over the years was able to build two rooms that she uses as bedrooms, dining rooms, a kitchen, at times “party rooms,” she says with a smile on her face.

Cándida is happy because a new member of the family will arrive soon, a grandson.  It’s for this reason that she needs a loan so she can install running water in her home to improve the quality of life.

loans.use: to install running water.

loans.name: Shogherik

texts.en:
Shogherik lives in the village of Verishen with her husband and 4 children. 

She and her husband work at a local milk factory and run a farm. They raise cows, calves, sheep, a mother pig and 13 piglets. They also cultivate grass for the livestock. The requested loan of 3,000 USD is very important for Shogherik's farm so that they can purchase 2 cows and pay previous credit payments.  

Shogherik has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to repay on time. Now, by ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments, Shogherik has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase 2 cows and pay previous credit payments.

loans.name: Nomatter

texts.en:
Nomatter is a 32-year-old entrepreneur. She is married with two children and lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. 

For the past seven months, she and her husband have successfully raised broiler chicks.  They produce these broilers in batches of 100 birds every six weeks. 

On Saturdays, she joins other members of Cama, a network of graduate alumnae who were supported by Camfed. Together, they participate in cleaning campaigns, help the elderly, and garden to supply vulnerable girls at local boarding schools with food.
 
Nomatter will increase the number of broiler chicks from one hundred to two hundred and fifty with the Kiva loan. This will boost the sales and hopefully employ other people in her community since unemployment rates are high in her rural village.

loans.use: to buy more chicks.

loans.name: Talent

texts.en:
Talent is a 21-year-old young woman living in the Mwenezi District Masvingo of Zimbabwe. She operates a business buying and selling jeans, jackets, sandals, shirts, pants and skirts. 

She  volunteers as a Learner Guide at a local school to teach students about life skills and assisting them with homework. 

With a Kiva loan, Talent will purchase bulk quantities of clothing to help boost sales and profits.  With her profits, she hopes to become self-sufficient and provide for the needy children in her community.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of clothing.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 22-year-old young woman who is an active member of Camfed’s alumnae network, Cama. As a Cama member, she volunteers in her community helping the elderly and disabled. She joins other Cama members in clean-up campaigns to keep their community clean. 

She is also a business woman who sells sugar, cooking oil, tea, drinks, salt, snacks, and sweets from a rented stand at the local market. By charging a fair price, Abigail is able to attract many customers and still earn a reasonable profit. She is married with one child. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she will purchase more sugar, salt, tea, sweets, and snacks from wholesalers where the costs are lower. This will enable Abigail to sell at competitive prices and increase sales and profits. 

With the additional profits she looks forward to expanding into a larger shop and creating employment in the community. She also wants to provide for her child and other family members who look to her for support. Abigail also wants to further her education and be employed in the formal sector.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her stall.

loans.name: Sagrada Familia. Group

texts.es: Victoria de 51 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos, 02 de ellos aún dependientes. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está conformado por 06 socias entusiastas que cada día se esfuerzan por salir adelante. Victoria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace más de 16 años. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a sus hijos con su educación y ha mejorado su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de harina, aceite, arroz y azúcar. El deseo de Victoria es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente, es por ello que se esfuerza. El grupo “Sagrada Familia” está agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Victoria es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca plomo.
texts.en: Victoria is 51-years old, married and has four children, two of whom are still dependent.  The “Sagrada Familia” (Sacred Family) communal bank is made up of 6 enthusiastic members who work hard each day to get ahead.  Victoria has made her living selling groceries for more than 16 years.  She feels proud, as thanks to her hard work she can continue supporting her children in their education, and she has improved her quality of life.  This last loan is meant to be used to purchase flour, cooking oil, rice and sugar. Victoria's hope is to see her children fulfilled professionally, which is why she works so hard.  The “Sagrada Familia” communal bank is grateful for the Kiva lenders and the help they give.  In the above photograph, Victoria is second from the left and wearing a gray jacket.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cooking oil, rice and sugar.

loans.name: 01 Phú Xuân Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Bình raises poultry . She requests a loan to purchase chicks to raise and sell in the future.  Bình has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is illness.

Bình is 51 years old and she is married with 3 children.  In 2013, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bình has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 01 Phú Xuân Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

In the future, Bình hopes for her children to find good jobs, her business to do well, and to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anifa

texts.en:
Anifa is a 25-year-old divorced woman with two children who lives in Bundibugyo Uganda. 

She sells used clothes and grows cocoa. She started the business to generate income to meet her family's daily expenses, including school fees for her child. 

She dreams of increasing her business to become a big boutique which deals in children's wear in the region.  She faces problems related to competition and the lack of storage space for her clothes.

Anifa requests a loan to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of them go to school. She has no additional members in her family. She operates a hardware shop in the retail market. She has been in this business for the last eight years, and she works seven days a week. She requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of cement and nails. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting her merchandise. Hanifa lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy cement, nails and iron sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an assortment of supplies for her store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother and has children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household expenses.

For over two years, she has operated an open air home-based food selling business, to sell to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of changing seasons. 

She will use 20,000 KES  to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: sto purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Davidzo

texts.en:
Davidzo is a 35-year-old married mother of two and lives with her family in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. 

For three years, she has run a poultry operation producing 200 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local boarding schools.  She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and saw that poultry was profitable in her community. Davidzo would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. 

When she is not working, Davidzo is giving back to her community as a volunteer Learner Guide at schools and provides assistance to students with their homework and teaches life skills that will improve their well-being. 

She hopes to increase revenue to provide for her two children and become more financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Chester

texts.en:
Chester is married and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is very enthusiastic about increasing her grocery business where she sells soap, cooking oil, flour and sugar to her community. She loves her business and is proud that it has succeeded so far. 

Chester is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase products in large quantities and increase her profitability. This will help elevate her quality of life and provide employment to others within her community. 

In her spare time, she volunteers as a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve young people’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase products in large quantities to increase her profitability.

loans.name: Cintia Marisela

texts.es: Cintia es madre soltera,  a sus 20 años tiene un hijo de 1 año, ella comenta vive con su madre, su padrastro y con su hijo, Cintia se dedica a la crianza de terneros y  al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Cintia es una madre  amorosa que trabaja para tener los ingresos suficientes para salud y alimentación de su hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para tener un ingreso mas y aspira seguir incrementando su negocio.
texts.en: Cintia is a single mother who at age 20 has a one-year-old son. She lives with her mother, stepfather, and son. Cintia works raising calves and as a day laborer in the fields. Cintia is a loving mother who works in order to have enough income to keep her son healthy and well fed. She will use this loan to buy calves in order to have more income, and she hopes to continue growing her business.

loans.use: buy calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Tanyaradzwa

texts.en: Tanyaradzwa is married with one child and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. By selling clothing at the local market, she is able to be financially independent and support herself. She takes great pride in her business where she sells skirts, baby blankets, and shoes in bulk to meet the high demand of her customers. She will use the Kiva loan to buy more items of clothing in bulk for her shop. By being able to buy the items in bulk, she will reduce costs and be able to sell the items for a profit. With her additional profits, she intends to create employment and improve her standard of living. Tanyaradzwa is also a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve young people’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy more items of clothing in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Luis Mariano

texts.es: Luis tiene 53 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo quien ya es mayor de edad. Luis trabaja en una empresa de seguridad desde hace mucho tiempo lo cual le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Luis solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo del corredor de la vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado. Comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Luis is 53 years of age and lives in his own home, alongside his life partner and adult son. Luis has worked for a security company for a long time; this has permitted him to bring his earnings home and to maintain his family's economic life. Luis is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of the roof in the corridor of his home, as it has deteriorated. He will purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: To buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to fix the the roof of the corridor of his home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 4 children that all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rental houses.She has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour. Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van to transport her merchandise. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, flour and soap

loans.name: Flor Arely

texts.es: Flor tiene 24 años de edad y habita junto  a sus padres y tres hermanos. Flor trabaja como auxiliar de cocinera desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma colabora con la economía de su querida familia. Flor es una joven visionaria quien desea dar inicio a la construcción de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, etc.
texts.en: Flor is 24 years old and lives with her parents and three siblings. She has worked as a kitchen assistant for quite a while, which is how she helps her dear family with money. Flor is a young visionary who wants to start construction on her home. For this, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in the purchase of the necessary materials, such as bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc. to start construction on her home.

loans.name: Wilfredo Antonio

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 11 años, 10 años y 9 años de edad. Wilfredo trabaja como operario en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Wilfredo solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda el cual se encuentra deteriorado y el agua se filtra cuan llueve. Con el monto comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 31 years old and lives at home with his life partner and their three children aged 11, 10 years and 9 years old.

Wilfredo works as a laborer at a company near his home allowing him to bring money home.

Wilfredo has requested this loan from FUSAI because he wants to repair the roof of the house which is run down and water leaks through it when it rains. 

With the loan he will buy galvanized steel, wood and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel, wood and nails to repair the roof of the house.

loans.name: Evelyn De Jesus

texts.es: Evelyn tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 14 años y 7 años de edad. Evelyn se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Evelyn solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para su vivienda y así poder darle mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Evelyn is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children who are 15, 14, and seven years old. Evelyn works as a housekeeper, which allows her to support her household and give her family all that they need. Evelyn is requesting this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in the purchase of doors and windows for her home and give her family better security.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows for her house.

loans.name: Dolice

texts.en:
Dolice is a sixty year old married female living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She is a farmer who mainly grows cocoa, along with a retail shop that helps her to meet her family's basic needs. She has been in business since 2006. She dreams of expanding her business into new markets, though high transport costs are a problem.
Dolice is going to use the loan to buy plastic jugs,cups,basins and balls to sell.

loans.use: To buy plastic jugs,cups,basins and balls to sell

loans.name: Nieves Azucena

texts.es:
Nieves esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva, ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá solventar los gastos de sus estudios, como pao de mensualidad, compra de materiales, entre otros; así podrá seguir estudiando y podrá hacer realidad su gran sueño de “Ser una gran profesional terminar su carrera profesional y ser un orgullo para su familia”

Nieves trabaja como cajera en un restaurante de su ciudad, en el cual labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y por las noches acude a sus clases, este humilde empleo le permite a nieves solventar los gastos de sus estudios y apoyar con algunos gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Nieves is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to all their help, she will be able to pay for her schooling expenses, such as monthly fees, costs of materials, etc. Paying for these will allow her to continue studying, and she will be able to realize her greatest dream: to be a great professional, to finish her education, and to be her family's pride.

Nieves works as a cashier at a restaurant in her city. There, she works around eight hours a day, and at night she goes to class. This humble employment allows Nieves to pay for her school expenses and help out with some of the household expenses.

loans.use: pay for school expenses and materials.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married mother. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business to sell household consumables. She also operates a motorcycle transportation business which earns additional income. She faces challenges such as the changing seasons and the high cost of transportation.

She will use 30,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and paraffin. 

She joined Yehu because of their favorable loan policies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and paraffin.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow so she can milk it and sell the by-products.

loans.name: Shylet

texts.en: Shylet is a 24-year-old businesswoman living in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe.  Over the last year, she started selling groceries to feed her community and become more self-sufficient. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at schools in her community by helping students with their homework and teaching them life skills. With a Kiva loan, Shylet will buy more sweets, flour, canned beans, peanut butter, salt, snacks and cornmeal. She wants to purchase more goods to expand her inventory and boost her profits in order for Shylet to become financially independent.

loans.use: To buy more groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en: Privilege is a 20-year-old young woman living in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. She is selling clothing including men’s slacks, socks, shirts, and other articles at the local flea market. She is also a volunteer Learner Guide at her local school, where she supports students with their studies. With a Kiva loan, Privilege will purchase more products in bulk to expand her inventory and increase her profits. Her aspiration is to build her own shop and create employment for other community members.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en: Portia is a 19-year-old single businesswoman living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. In her free time she is a Learner Guide working with schools to improve young people’s well being. Portia runs a shop that provides essential groceries to members of her community. She is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase sugar, flour, rice, matemba (sardines) and other goods in large quantities to meet the high demand of her community and increase her profitability. She looks forward to the day when her higher income will enable her to be financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, matemba (sardines) and other goods in large quantities to meet the high demand of her community and increase her profitability.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal and fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy \ broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife and three sons and three daughters. He has a small stall in the city where he sells toys and home appliances. It is a very good business but Mohammad would like to improve it and rent a small store. 

Mohammad took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more toys and gifts for his stall to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to increase his sales and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo beside his stall.

loans.use: to buy more toys and gifts for his stall.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria tiene 48 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos y dos nietos. Gloria es una mujer luchadora quien se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Desde hace siete años cuenta con un negocio de venta de gallinas en el mercado central de su localidad. Este negocio le ha permitido llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia lo necesario. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea encementar el piso de la vivienda y reparar el techo del corredor de la vivienda. Comprará materiales como: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en: Gloria is 48 years old and lives in a home of her own with her children and two grandchildren.  Gloria is a striving woman who makes an effort to support her household.  Since she was seven years old she has been selling cookies at the local central market.  This business has allowed her to support her family and provide them with what they need.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI because she wants to install a cement floor in her home and repair the roof.  She will use the money to buy building materials such as cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal, and lumber.

loans.use: to install a cement floor and repair her roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tin sheeting and metal beams.

loans.name: Felisabel

texts.es:
La señora Felisabel es una mujer de pollera(cholita), muy arraigada a los usos y costumbres de sus ancestros. Ella es independiente y con su labor sostiene a su bebé de 3 meses de nacido.
La señora Felisabel tiene 19 años de edad y piensa que a su edad ya ha cumplido muchos de sus sueños, pero aún le faltan; como el de ver crecer su labor en la confección de tejidos, el cual lo viene realizando desde que tiene uso de razón.
Cuando era niña seleccionaba tejidos de sus familiares, los desataba y confeccionaba otras prendas con un nuevo diseño, “me divertía mucho tejer y como no tenía material para tejer descocía prendas de mis abuelos y tíos y los volvía a tejer de otra manera…”
La señora Felisabel teje a mano; tal y como le enseño su abuelita cuando era niña, cuenta con un puesto de venta sobre la calle donde expone sus tejidos al mismo tiempo que los vende. Ella está segura que su hija de 3 meses seguirá su mismo camino y juntas tejerán más prendas para vender y así ambas sostenerse.
El nacimiento de su bebé acarreo muchos gastos y es por ese  motivo que La señora Felisabel solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana, para así continuar con su labor de tejedora.
texts.en:
Felisabel is an indigenous woman, well-versed in the ways and customs of her ancestors.  She is independent and with her work she sustains her three-month-old baby.

Felisabel is 19 years old and thinks that at her age she has achieved many of her dreams, though she still lacks some, like seeing her textile production work grow, something she has been doing for as long as she can remember.

When she was a girl, she used to pick out knitted articles belonging to her family members, take them apart and make other articles of clothing with new designs.  She says,"I used to entertain myself greatly knitting and, since I lacked material to knit, I used to take apart articles of clothing belonging to my grandparents and uncles and knit them again in another way...."

Felisabel knits by hand in the way she was taught by her grandmother when she was a child.  She has a sales stall on the street where she displays her work as well as selling it.  She is sure that her three-year-old daughter will follow in her footsteps and that together they will knit more clothing for sale and thus support themselves.

The birth of her baby entailed lots of expenses and, for this reason, Felisabel is requesting a loan to buy wool so that she can continue her knitting work.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Carmen Nieves

texts.es:
Carmen esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de artesanías, especialmente comprar adornos, materiales para confección como masilla, arcilla, tarjetas, entre otros; así podrá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y seguir trabajando en su negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Carmen trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y lo hace con mucho esmero y empeño, ya que ella desea hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande y tener una empresa distribuidora”.
texts.en:
Carmen is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business selling artisan goods; specifically, decorations, modeling clay, clay, scissors and other things. This way she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers, improve her sales and keep working on her business which is her only source of income to cover the household expenses.

Carmen works around 9 hours a day and puts a lot of care and dedication into her work. She wants to achieve her dream of "having a bigger store and a distribution business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise like decorations, modeling clay, clay, scissors and other things.

loans.name: Gelly

texts.en:
Gelly is a single young lady who lives in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. She is a 21-year-old, business-minded young woman who values using the resources available to earn a living. She has been successfully running a grocery business for the past six months. She has one shop assistant who happens to also be a member of Cama, which is Camfed’s alumni network. Gelly started the businesss to help her mother support her siblings.  
With the requested Kiva loan, Gelly will increase her store’s merchandise by buying sugar, cooking oil, flour, and rice from wholesalers, and she will sell these at competitive prices. Gelly’s dream is to have a big shop that will create employment in her community and improve her quality of life. She also wants to further her education in order to become an educated businesswoman who will be a role model for the young people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more food products.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 23-year-old married mother of one child living in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. Vivian has been providing food for her community since November of 2013 when she began her poultry business. To give back, Vivian also volunteers as a Learner Guide at her local school, teaching students valuable life skills.

With a Kiva loan, Vivian will increase her purchase from 100 broiler chicks to 200 chicks. She also wants to create employment for her community by hiring someone to help with the project. Her profits will help her provide for her family and also assist needy students with school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, por ejemplo calaminas, clavos, entre otros; de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia, sobre todo porque tiene un pequeño hijo de 5 años.

Alexander trabaja como obrero en una empresa de su ciudad , este empleo es su fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener un terreno”.
texts.en:
Alexander is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given, he will be able to purchase materials to make home improvements, such as iron, nails, etc. This way, he will be able to improve his family's quality of life, most of all because he has a small son who is five years old.

Alexander works as a laborer at a business in his city. This job is his source of income for getting ahead and being able to realize his big dream: to have land.

loans.use: with home improvements.

loans.name: Lenny Marisol

texts.es:
Lenny esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá materiales y enseres para realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde vive, como por ejemplo compra de pintura, estantes, entre otros; así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.

Lenny trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 1 año y con el fruto de su humilde empleo puede salir adelante y sobre todo luchar para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Lenny is grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase materials and essentials to improve the dwelling she lives in.  For example, she will buy paint, shelving and other items.  In this way, she will be able to improve her quality of life. 

Lenny has worked as a domestic worker for one year.  With the fruit of her humble employment, she can get ahead and above all, work toward making her greatest dream a reality: "to study a profession at the university."

loans.use: to purchase materials and essentials to improve her housing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her home (repairs to the walls, floor, windows and other things)

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos: De los cuales 2 son adolescentes que cursan su secundaria y un menor de edad. Cuenta con una experiencia aproximada de 5 años de desempeñarse como secretaria. Solicita su segundo financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto, comprar materiales de construcción: Cemento, hierro, zinc, clavos, madera y bloques.  Desde hace 13 años ha vivido en una cada de tambo de madera. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura que le brinde las mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: She is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 33 years old, married with three children. Of her children, two are teenagers in secondary school, and one is younger. She has approximately five years of experience as a secretary. She is requesting her second loan to build her cement home, little by little. The loan is to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, zinc, nails, wood, and bricks. For 13 years, she has lived in a house on wood stilts. Her dream is to have a safe home that will give her family better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, iron, zinc, nails, wood, and bricks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make home improvements (renovation of windows, walls, etc.).

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El señor Nicolas es un transportista que vive del transporte de pasajeros, tiene 49 años y toda su vida la paso frente al volante. A la edad de 30 años se casó y formó una familia , ahora tiene 1 hijo(18) y se encuentra en la construcción de su hogar y el de sus hijo.
El señor Nicolas cuenta que el trabajo del transporte es bastante duro; “ a veces estamos a merced del estado del tiempo, constantes lluvias hacen que los caminos se derrumben… pero no lo cambiaría por nada” sus hijo estudia en una escuela a la cual se dirige en bicicleta, su casa actual goza de agua alimentada por camiones cisterna que en ocasiones seguidas no llegan hasta el lugar o se le acaba el agua, quedando toda su familia desprovista de este líquido elemento.
Con la ayuda de su familia y de sus hermanos El señor Nicolas logró la construcción de su hogar y ahora necesita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable para la cocina, el baño y la lavandería.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 49 years old and provides passenger transportation.  He has spent his whole life behind the wheel.  He married at age 30 and formed a family.  Now he has a son (18) and he is building his and his son’s home.

Nicolas says that transportation is very hard.  “Sometimes we are at the mercy of the weather; constant rains make roads crumble… but I wouldn’t trade this for anything.  His son attends school and travels there by bicycle.  His current home relies on water delivery trucks, that sometimes don’t come or they run out of water, leaving his family unsupplied with this elemental liquid.

With the help of his family and his brothers, Nicolas was able to build his home and now needs a loan to install running water for the kitchen, bathroom, and laundry room.

loans.use: to install running water in his home.

loans.name: Santos Benjamin

texts.es:
Santos de 36 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos; 1 niño de un año y 2 niñas de 6 y 4 años.  Él  estudio hasta tercer grado, por la situación económica que pasaba su familia no logro seguir estudiando, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su hogar, actualmente en su vivienda viven 5 personas sus 3 hijos y su esposa, la pequeña de 6 años ya está estudiando la preparatoria.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz, frijol) desde que él estaba pequeño sus padres le enseñaron a aprender este trabajo como era la única alternativa de trabajo y de ingresos en aquellos tiempos por eso se dedicaba a la agricultura. 

Aparte de dedicarse a la agricultura también se dedica a la ganadería,  él tiene unas vaquitas que le proporcionan leche y sus derivados para la alimentación de su familia y que es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos y alimento para su familia, él para poder llegar a su lugar de trabajo tiene que caminar 1 hora a pie a 3  kilómetros de su vivienda que le toca caminar y también  recibe el apoyo de su esposa para realizar los trabajos agrícolas.


   El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para la preparación de la tierra para sembrar sus cultivos para el invierno que está presente, él cultiva granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo) con la ayuda del préstamo le permitirá tener la preparada la tierra para sembrar los cultivos más adecuadamente y eficientemente en el tiempo específico sin mayores complicaciones de perdida.

Santos desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia, y obtener  mayor  producción de granos básicos y vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para sus hijos y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para que en el futuro sean  personas profesionales y logren terminar su estudios y sacar  una carrera universitaria todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su  esposa y mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Santos, 36, is the father of three children: a one year old son, and two daughters, ages 4 and 6. He went to school until third grade, but wasn't able to continue because of his family's financial situation. He is married and his wife is a stay-at-home mom. The family lives together at home and the 6 year old is in elementary school.

Santos has worked since he was very young as a farmer of basic grains (corn, beans). His parents taught him the trade because it was the only work option and the only way to make money then. Aside from farming, he also has cattle. He has some cows that give him milk and milk products to feed his family, as well as to generate income. In order to get to work, he walks one hour on foot, 3km from his home, to his land. His wife also helps him with the farm work.

This loan from CREDICAMPO will be used to prepare the land for planting the winter crops like corn, beans and sorghum. With the help of the loan, he will have everything efficiently and adequately prepared without suffering any losses or complications. In the future, Santos wants a better quality of life for his family, to have better production of his crops, and to live more comfortably in a solid home, and for his children to stay in school through college and become professionals. All of this he will achieve, along with his wife, through a lot of hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting winter crops (corn, beans and sorghum).

loans.name: 020402080003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Thành operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase nets to catch fish.

Thành is 43 years old and she is married with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 020402080003 Liên Minh _ Hoằng Trường solidarity group, which consists of three members. Thành lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, which she has been involved in for more than ten years. Thành has successfully repaid eight loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Thành faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thành hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase nets to catch fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Elmer Edgardo

texts.es:
El señor   Elmer   de 40 años de edad  es casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación donde se dedica desde hace varios años al  enderezado y pintado de vehículos, su taller lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitación donde le visitan todos los amigos y conocido y que lo prefieren por la buena atención y el servicio que les brinda.
Don Elmer está solicitando crédito de 10,000.00 lempiras para compra de una maquina soldadora, electrodos y una careta para soldar, su negocio esta ubicado en aldea pavana al sur de honduras. 
Don Elmer su sueño es  seguir creciendo más en su negocio a él le gustaría tener una taller mas grande y ampliarlo a para tener mejores ingresos y generar más empleos en la zona ya que la falta de empleo es un problema, en la fotografía el muestra como es la preparación de un vehículo para hacer el proceso de pintura.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Elmer is a 40-year-old, is married and lives with his wife in his home.  He has devoted several years to straightening and painting vehicles.  His shop is installed in his house where his friends visit and it is known for the good care and service provided to them.

Elmer is asking for a 10,000.00 Lempiras loan to buying a welding machine, electrodes and welding helmet. His business is located in Pavana village in the south of Honduras.

Elmer's dream is to grow his business more.  He would like to have a larger workshop and to extend it to have better income and generate employment in the area because the lack of jobs is a problem.  The picture shows how he is preparing a vehicle for painting process.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, electrodes and welding helmet for his workshop

loans.name: Jaime Noe

texts.es: Jaime tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Jaime tiene un pequeño negocio en el cual vende fruta picada y golosinas. De esta forma se gana el sustento y mantiene la economía del hogar. Jaime desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reconstruir las paredes de la vivienda dado que se encuentran deterioradas.
texts.en:
Jaime is 35 years old and resides in his own home along with his life companion and their children. He has a small business where he sells sliced fruit and snack foods. This is how he earns a living and maintains the household finances.

Jaime wants to improve the conditions at home, so he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood so that he can rebuild the walls of his house which have deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets and wood so that he can rebuild the walls of his house.

loans.name: Omega

texts.en: Omega is a 25-year-old widow with one child living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. As a single parent, she works hard to support her child and dreams of improving their quality of life in the rural village. To provide financial support, Omega operates a small grocery store selling sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil. She loves her business and dreams of seeing it grow. Omega is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can make bulk purchases of soap, rice, cooking oil, flour and other products.
