With the profits, she intends to improve the quality of life for herself and her child. On top of running her business, Omega spends her free time volunteering as a Learner Guide, working with schools to improve young people’s well-being by teaching them life skills.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of soap, rice, cooking oil, flour and other products.

loans.name: Amira Matilde

texts.es:
La señora Amira anteriormente trabajaba como técnica en un laboratorio, pero decidió renunciar para dedicarse a cuidar sus hijos y estar pendiente de ellos, fue así como su esposo le propuso trabajar independiente en la comercialización de gas domestico.
Con unos cuantos ahorros que tenía compro sus primeras pipetas de gas para venderlas den el municipio de Sincelejo. Hoy en día ha podido recoger muy buenos frutos de su esfuerzo y dedicación, tanto así que tiene gran demanda de pipetas y no ha podido cubrir estos pedidos.
Por esta razón es que solicita un préstamo, para comprar un gran inventario de pipetas y poder aliviar la demanda tan grande.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de capitalizar su negocio y ofrecer a las personas de la región su producto de manera oportuna ya que sus clientes viven principalmente en zonas veredales y deben recorrer grandes trayectos para comprar el gas.
texts.en:
Amiria used to work as a lab technician, but decided to resign so she could care for her children, so her husband recommended that she work on her own selling gas.

She bought her first cylinders with the few savings she had, so she could sell them in the town of Sincelejo.  Today she has garnered the fruits of her effort and dedication and she has a large demand for her cylinders.  She has not been able to cover all the orders, so she is asking for a loan to buy a larger inventory so she can cover the demand.

This loan will allow her to capitalize her business and offer her product to the people in her area in a more opportune way.  Most of her customers live in the surrounding areas and must travel a long way to buy gas.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 32 años de edad es madre soltera sus hijos tienen la edad de 16, 10 y 2 años, en casa de María también vive su madre. El grupo familiar de María es de 5 personas. María desde hace 10 años para sacar adelante a sus hijo puso una tortillería y es así que hasta hoy a logrado su objetivo. La vivienda de María necesita cambiar las láminas del techo ya que están muy deterioradas; por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, clavos y madera para repara el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria, 32, is a single mother with three children, ages 16, 10 and 2.  Her mother also lives in Maria's home, so the family group is comprised of five members.  For ten years Maria has been able to raise her children thanks to her tortilla business.

The roof of Maria's house is in need of repair because several areas are very damaged; so she has requested a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, nails and wood to repair the roof.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, nails and wood to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy educational materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and install metal doors.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn Trung Sơn Xã Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kiểu works in the agriculture business raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Kiểu is 46 years old and married with four children. Kiểu is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn Trung Sơn xã Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Kiểu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Kiểu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Kiểu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Trầu Công Liêm Group

texts.en:
Hương works in the agriculture business raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

Hương is 60 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Trầu Công Liêm solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pipes and cables for the household electrical network and to pay for connection to a utility provider.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement to build on her plot

loans.name: 03 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fast food. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

Thúy is 34 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 03 Thắng Hùng Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardships that she faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe where she runs a business selling chickens to local customers. She enjoys her business as it provides her with enough income to support her family and feed the local community. In her spare time, Ophelia is a Camfed Learner Guide working with students to improve their study skills and increase their level of well-being. 

Ophelia is seeking a Kiva loan to buy more broiler chicks along with the necessary feed and chemicals in large quantities so that she can meet the demands of her community. She will use the profits from her business to improve her standard of living and become financially self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks, feed and chemicals in large quantities

loans.name: Farisai

texts.en: Farisai is married with three children and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She takes great pride in running a small, local grocery shop where she sells sugar, soap, flour and other commodities needed in her community. She is also a volunteer Learner Guide working with schools to improve the young people’s well-being. Farisai is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in bulk to elevate her profitability and better serve her customers. A higher income will help her support her family and better provide for her three children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, garlic, oil, pepper, and other food items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a wall, lay a cement floor in the hall and drywall her house.

loans.name: Ds Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DS  est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,  friperies de meilleures qualités, mèches et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des habits (friperies) de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie en gros aux  marchés de Bamako. La revente se faiten détails à Minkoungo et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The DS group consists of married women living with their husbands and children in traditional families. They are on average 33 years old with four children. They all live in Minkoungo, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through kinship, neighborhood ties and friendship.

Members of the group are small retail merchants of quality second-hand clothing, hair extensions and charcoal. To increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Lady Awa (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) has acquired a reputation at selling quality second-hand clothes. She intends to use her loan to buy two bales of second-hand clothing at wholesale prices from the markets of Bamako. Retail sales are conducted in Minkoungo and as an itinerant vendor, to a mixed clientele.

Lady Awa hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs, to be fed back into the business and used to meet the children's small needs.

loans.use: buy quality second-hand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a horse and farm equipment in preparation for winter

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq (05) membres du groupe  Kototala ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à N’tomikorobougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de N’tomikorobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, savon, habits et charbon du bois. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fily (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de, savon. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 cartons de savons au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails à N’tomikorobougou en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fily compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Predominantly married in polygamous households, the five members of the Kototala group are on average 38 years old with four children. They all live in N'tomikorobougou, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the N'tomikorobougou market. 

Group members are small retail merchants of soap, clothing and charcoal. Wanting to increase their stock-in-trade, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fily (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is a great vendor of soap. She intends to use her loan to buy 15 boxes of soap at the general market. Retail sales are conducted as an itinerant vendor in N'tomikorobougou, to a clientele composed mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Fily hopes to attain average monthly profits of 80,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet small household needs.

loans.use: buy soap

loans.name: Diamra Group

texts.fr: DIAMRA est un groupement d’intérêt économique qui est composé de 5 personnes (02 hommes et 03 femmes). Ils habitent dans la même maison et font la même activité. Leur présidente Madame Aïssa est leur présidente, elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 58 ans elle gère les charges des dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille malgré son age. Son activité consiste à acheter des sacs de  foin (herbe sèche) en quantité pour les stocker et les revendre en gros ou en détail. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10 ans et démarre sa journée à 19h. Elle demande ce montant pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et diversifier son activité. Elle voudrait aussi augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent à cote. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diamra is a business group with five members - two men and two women.  They all live in the same house and operate the same type of business.

Aïssa is the president of the group, she is married and has children.  Despite her age (58 years old) she still controls the expenses of the family.  Her business is buying sacks of hay (dried grass) in large quantities, stocking it and then reselling it on a wholesale or retail basis.  She has more than ten years' experience in her business.

Aïssa has requested this loan to increase her stock holding levels and to enable her to diversify her business.  She would like to increase her income and also the level of her savings.  In this way, she would be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of hay for holding as stock and then selling on as retail.

loans.name: Batoura

texts.fr:
Batoura est une demoiselle âgée de 28 ans, qui a fait une formation en hôtellerie et qui présentement fait du commerce depuis maintenant 4 ans. Elle a ouvert une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques, mèches et greffages. Elle gère sa propre boutique et ouvre de 7h 30mn à 15h de l’après-midi. Batoura encaisse minimum en moyenne une somme de 2500f par jour pour la vente de ses produits car dès fois elle vend plus de cette somme, dès fois aussi, elle ne vend pas. 
Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique de cosmétiques (lait, crème, parfum …)  et pouvoir améliorer ses ventes.
Elle est mère célibataire et c’est elle qui s’occupe de son enfant, mais aussi de ses parents parce qu’elle loge toujours dans la maison familiale. Grâce aux revenus de son commerce et aux prestations de services dans certains hôtels, elle arrive tout de même à joindre les deux bouts
Elle souhaite seulement un jour construire une maison avec un grand complexe de vente de produits de beauté
texts.en:
Batoura is a 28-year-old lady, who has had training in the hotel industry and and has now been a merchant for the past four years. She opened a shop selling cosmetics, hair extensions and hair weaves. She runs her own shop and opens from 7:30 am to 3 pm.

Batoura collects minimum 2,500 francs a day on average from selling her products, because although she may sell more than this amount, she may also not make any sales at all. She is requesting this loan to bolster her cosmetics shop (body milks, creams, perfumes, ...) and improve her sales.

She is a single mother and is taking care of her child, but also of her parents as she is still living in the family home. With revenues from her business and the provision of services in some hotels, she manages to make ends meet.

Some day she would like to build a house with a large retail complex selling beauty products.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to display in her shop for resale

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Khanyounis. He lives with his wife in a small house. He has agricultural land where he and his wife work. They plant seasonal fruits and vegetables and resell them in the local market. This is a very good business, but Mohammad would like to improve it. Mohammad took out a USD 1,325 Murabaha (Shariah-compliant) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm. By taking out this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve the farm and the quality of the crops. Mohammad appears in the photo at his farm

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes du groupe Lumière sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako ; elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Minkoungo. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre,  ustensiles, mèches, condiments et savons. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèbou (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pommes de terre ; elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre à Bamako en gros ; la revente se fait  au comptant et à crédits à Minkoungo et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djénèbou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de mes enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The ten members of Lumière Group are married women. Most of them live in polygamous households. They average 31 years of age and 3 children each.

They all live in Minkoungo, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and got to know each other through bonds of community and their money-earning activities at the Minkoungo market.

The members of the group retails potatoes, utensils, hair extensions, condiments, and soaps. In order to increase their working capital, they decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their first loan.

Mrs. Djénèbou is the woman sitting on the right in the photograph. She's very renowned as a potatoes seller. She intends to user her loan to buy 4 sacks of potatoes wholesale in Bamako.

She retails for cash and on credit, in Minkoungo and as a traveling saleswoman, to a clientele comprising mostly women. With this loan, she hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 45'000. Part of it will be reinvested in her business, the other part will be used to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Madame Maimouna, une dame de la quarantaine, travaille comme infirmière dans une structure sanitaire dans le village où elle loge. Elle fait parallèlement, du commerce afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Un commerce qu’elle a débuté il y a 5 ans de cela avec ses propres moyens. C’est dans le cadre d’améliorer ce dernier, qu’elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter de la marchandise (sacs, chaussures et divers) pour revendre à ses collègues et dans les environs.
Maimouna est une femme mariée et mère de famille. Elle appuie ses parents dans les besoins quotidiens et participe aussi à la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Le plus grand projet de Maimouna serait de construire sa propre maison et d’y habiter avec sa famille pour leur confort.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maimouna is in her forties. She works as a nurse in a healthcare setting in the village where she lives. In parallel, she's a reseller in order to improve the standard of living of her family. She started this business five years ago with her own funds.

In order to improve her business, she's seeking this loan to buy supplies (bags, shoes, other products) to resell to her colleagues and in the surroundings.

Maimouna is married and the mother of a family. She supports her parents in their daily needs, and also helps cover her household's daily expenses. Her biggest project would be to build her own house and to live in it with her family, to improve their comfort.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes

loans.name: Thempele

texts.en: Thempele is a 20-year-old mother of one from Nkayi, Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, where she volunteers as a community health trainer and participates in clean-up campaigns. She has been in the clothing business for ten months. She sells shoes, handbags and clothes at the local market to customers at fair prices. Thempele is applying for a Kiva loan to obtain funds to buy uniforms, shoes and clothing for men and children. With the profits, she wants to improve her quality of life, supplement her education and improve her business, so that one day she will own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: 13 Minh Thanh Minh Lộc Group

texts.en: Mrs. Tâm operates a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables. She is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Tâm is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. She is the leader of a 6-member group, the 13 Minh Thanh Minh Lộc solidarity group. In 2010, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tâm has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm has been involved in this business for eight years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Tâm hopes for her children to graduate from college, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to resell.

loans.name: Sedrack

texts.en: Sedrack is a 24-year-old single male living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He sells secondhand clothes and engages in cocoa farming. He has been in business for three years. He is a very hardworking man who dreams of growing his business to a very big boutique in his area, though accidents, thieves and limited space to store his clothes adversely affect him. He applied for a loan to buy second-hand jeans trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy second-hand jeans trousers to sell.

loans.name: 59 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc Group

texts.en: Mrs. Phúc operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and shrimp. She is applying for a loan to buy more fish and shrimp to resell. Phúc is 36 years old. She is married and has three 3 children. She is the leader of an 8-member group, the 59 Minh Thắng Minh Lộc solidarity group.  In 2010, Phúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Phúc has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phúc has been involved in this business for four years. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business is a lack of capital. In the future, Phúc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, shrimp to resell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama. She is married, and has two children who are 10 and 8 years old. In 1992, Mariama established her oil, salt, onion, etc., business. She began this business because she wanted to help her husband and family. Her business is located on the outskirts and her main customers are women, children and men. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase oil, salt, onions, etc., for resale. In the future, Mariama plans to educate her children up to the university level and build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase oil, salt, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Árbol De Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas y lo coordina la señora Yesenia de 44 años de edad, soltera y madre de tres hijos, teniendo a cargo a uno de la edad de 15 años, es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace tres años y cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo para la compra de los productos, con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar el inventario con productos que antes no ofrecía, con el objetivo de seguir aumentando los productos que ofrece solicita el crédito para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, pan, caramelos, galletas, plátano verde, plátano maduro, huevos, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Yasmina de 45 años de edad comerciante de sandalias desde cinco años, las comercializa principalmente en Costa Rica, y Guadalupe de 33 años de edad, propietaria de una ferretería y comerciante de ropa en Tipitapa.
texts.en: This communal banking group is made up of three hard-working women and is coordinated by Yesenia who is 44 years old, single, and mother of three children, one of whom is 15 years old and still lives with her.  She is the owner of a grocery store in her home and has owned it for the past three years.  She notes that she gets help from her son to buy products, and with her previous loans she has been able to increase her inventory to offer products she didn't have before.  With the goal of increasing her products, she is asking for a loan for the purchase of basic grains and other staples like rice, beans, oil, sugar, bread, candies, cookies, green plantains, ripe plantains, eggs, etc.  The other members of the group are Yasmina, who is 45 years old and has been selling sandals for five years which she sells in Costa Rica, and Guadalupe who is 33 years old and owner of a hardware store and who also sells clothing in Tipitapa.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks, feed and the supplies she needs to raise them.

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Cụm 24 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mậu has a stall selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Mậu is 41 years old and married with three children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Cụm 24 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Mậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mậu has been involved in this business for six years and the main hardship that Mậu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mậu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 26-year-old single mother of two living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Violet works to improve the well-being of students in the local community by teaching them valuable life skills.
 
She recently started her business of poultry production. Violet is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can buy broiler chicks and feed in bulk. This will increase her stock and help grow her business. With the profits, she intends to improve her standard of living and hopes to create employment for others in her community.

loans.use: To buy broiler chicks and feed in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a 29-year-old female who is married with two children. She and her family live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothing and she farms cocoa. She has been in this business for five years, generating an income that meets her family's basic needs.

Ester dreams of expanding her business into new market areas in spite of the seasonality changes that affect her business since she operates in an open space.

Ester needs a loan to buy second-hand clothing for sale.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Arbol De Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socios exitosos en su vida laboral, y coordinado por la señora Reina de 39 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 20, 13 y 10 años respectivamente, se dedica a la venta de comida (fritanga), cuenta con la ayuda de su nuera para la elaboración y venta de la comida, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, repollo, vinagre, crema, salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, etc. Otra de las socias es la señora Maricela de 37 años de edad comerciante de ropa y refresco desde hace 5 años en su domicilio, la señora Elena comerciante de ropa desde hace 2 años a los pobladores de su comunidad, y el señor Róger de 24 años quien elabora y vende cajetas en Masaya, Granada y su comunidad. Cada uno de los socios presenta una manera diferente de laborar para que a su familia no le haga falta el alimento diario.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of four members that are successful in their professional life. It is coordinated by Reina, who is 39 years old, married and has three children aged 20, 13 and 10. She sells food (fritanga, a mix of fried food). Her daughter in law helps her to cook and sell the food.

She will use this loan to buy vegetable oil, ripe and unripe plantains, cabbage, vinegar, cream, ketchup, rice, beans, etc.

The remaining members are Maricela, 37, who has been selling clothes and beverages at home for five years; Elena, who has been selling clothes to her neighbors for two years; and Roger, 24, who makes and sells cajeta [milk caramel] in Masaya, Granada and to his neighbors. Each member has a different activity so that their families can always have food on their table.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Rayito De Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios exitosos y lo coordina la señora Shujeylin de 26 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 5 años, se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en los mercados de Masaya y Managua, este negocio lo impulso desde hace tres años, para ayudar a los gastos del hogar y ayudarle a sus hijos para la compra de artículos personales, la socia requiere el crédito para la compra de aguacate, mango y yuca, estos son los productos que más demanda la población en estos mercados. Los otros socios son el señor Miguel de 31 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva a los trabajadores de zona franca desde hace dos años, y la señora Elizabeth de 27 años de edad comerciante de perecederos en el mercado de Masaya. Estos socios aseguran que con el crédito anterior lograron aumentar sus ventas a través de la inversión en sus negocios.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three successful members and coordinated by Shujeylin, who is 26 years old, married and has two children aged 10 and 5. She sells fruits and vegetables at the markets of Masaya and Managua. She started this business three years ago in order to help with the home expenses and be able to buy things that her children need.

Shujeylin is requesting a loan to buy avocado, mango and cassava. These products are highly demanded by customers at the marketplaces.

The remaining members are Miguel, 31, who has been selling clothes to the Free-Trade Zone workers for two years; and Elizabeth, 27, who sells perishable goods at Masaya’s market. They say that they were able to increase their sales and invest on their businesses thanks to the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy avocado, mango and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 12 Cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Thúy is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and she has 2 dependents.

She has a retail business selling fish, and she is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell. Thúy has been involved in this business for 7 years. The main harship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

In 2009, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 3 loans from them. Now she is the group leader of the Nhóm 12 Cụm 03 Thôn Thắng Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias laboriosas, y lo coordina la señora Martha de 29 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 10, 5 y 1 año quienes son el motivo de su superación, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos AVON y Zermat, de manera ambulante en su comunidad, la socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cremas corporales, cremas para manos, body corporales, perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, también blusas, camisetas, pantalones para damas, etc., con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado aumentar la clientela porque ofrece mayor variedad de productos. Las otras socias son las señoras Karla de 33 años de edad comerciante de cosméticos y ropa de segunda de manera ambulante a los pobladores de su comunidad, y Lea quien ofrece bisutería, venta de ropa y cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The group consists of three hard working members, coordinated by Martha, who is 29 years old. She has a partner and is mother to three children aged 10, 5 and 1 who are the motivation for her personal improvement.

She sells clothing and AVON and Zermat cosmetics around her community. She is asking for a loan to buy body creams, hand creams, perfumes for women, fragrances for men, and also blouses, t-shirts, women’s trousers etc. With previous loans Martha has increased her clientele as she offers a greater variety of products. 

The other members of the group are Karla, who is 33 years old and sells cosmetics and second hand clothing to local people, and Lea who sells costume jewellery, clothes and cosmetics to people in her local community.

loans.use: to buy body creams, hand creams, underwear, perfumes for women, fragrances for men, and also blouses, t-shirts, women’s trousers etc.

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume is a 33-year-old married female with four children, three of whom go to school. She has been a food vendor for 13 years, working seven days a week and eleven hours a day in the rural area plus farms for additional income. Naume started her business to have a source of income and wants money to buy mangoes, onions and fish to sell. 

Naume hopes to expand her business even though debts and competition are challenges she faces.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, onions and fish to sell.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 38-year-old married female with four children, who all go to school. She has been a food vendor in the market for five year plus farms for additional income. 

Zubeda needs a loan to buy bananas and Irish potatoes. She is a hardworking woman, even if a lack of capital is a challenge faced.

loans.use: to buy bananas and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: El Buen Triunfo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo forman tres socias, lo coordina la señora Erlinda una mujer exitosa de 66 años de edad, soltera y madre de cuatro hijos de lo cual solamente uno depende de ella, es propietaria de un pulpería desde hace seis años, el crédito lo invertirá principalmente en la compra de granos básicos como el arroz, frijol, aceite, sopas marucham, sopas maggui, papel higiénico, pan, leche, chocolita, queso, etc., la socia con el crédito anterior logró aumentar las ventas porque invirtió en productos que antes no ofrecía a la población, esto la ha motivado a seguir prestando en la institución. Las otras socias son las señoras Johana de 22 años de edad comerciante de pan desde hace 4 años, y Josefa de 35 años quien ofrece nacatamales y pan en su domicilio
texts.en: This communal banking group is made up of three members and coordinated by Erlinda, a successful woman 66 years of age.  She is single and the mother of four children of whom only one still depends on her. She owns her own grocery store and has worked in this business for the past six years.  She will invest her loan principally in the purchase of basic grains and other products such as rice, beans, oil, soups, toilet paper, bread, milk, chocolate, cheese, etc.  She received an earlier loan and with it was able to increase her sales because she invested in products she did not offer to her customers previously.  This has motivated her to continue with loans from Kiva's partner.  The other group members are Johana who is 22 years old and has been selling bread for the past four years, and Josefa who is 35 years old and offers tamales and bread on sale from her home.

loans.use: To purchase basic grains and other products such as rice, beans, oil, soups, toilet paper, bread, milk, chocolate, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, and two go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She gets additional income from food vending. She works seven days a week. 

Margaret has requested a loan of 1,200,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges includes seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations are to build more rental houses and buy a van for transporting green bananas from village to the market for sale. She lives in her own house, and the family has no access to piped water but has access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks, stock feed, chemicals and feeding troughs to meet the high demand in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 46-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Mtskheta district with her husband, mother-in-law, son and daughter-in-law. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Irma has a cow whose milk is used in cheese products. Irma sells produced cheese locally and has stable clients. The family has decided to purchase a tractor. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan for purchasing a tractor and renting it out among her fellow villagers. This tractor is the only way to cultivate their lands, so Irma thinks that the business will be profitable. Irma awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor and rent it out.

loans.name: Misericordia Del Señor Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está formado por tres socios, lo coordina la señora Gloria de 44 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, siendo ellos por quienes ha trabajo, para poder darle una mejor educación y sobre todo que no les haga falta el pan de cada día, la socia se dedica a comercializar ropa nueva y de segunda mano a los pobladores de su comunidad desde hace ocho años, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, ella comercializa parte de la mercadería a sus compañeros de trabajo en la zona franca; el grupo solidario tiene 24 ciclos de estar trabajando con esta institución y la socia ha logrado mejor a su vivienda y aumento en su ventas  porque ha invertido en productos que antes no ofrecía, la socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como es talladores, licras, blusas, pacas de shorts, faldas y camisetas, con el fin de aumentar sus ganancias y reinvertirlas con productos que el mercado ofrece a diario y que la población demanda. Los otros socios son la señora Ruth de 46 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio recarga movistar y claro en su domicilio hace más de un año, y el señor Pedro de 64 años de edad dedicado a comercializar leche a los pobladores de su comunidad  en su domicilio y de manera ambulante desde hace ocho años. Estos socios presentan diversas maneras para ganarse el pan de cada día para su familia.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is formed by three members and coordinated by señora Gloria, who is 44 years old, with a partner and two children. It is them that she has worked for, in order to be able to give them a better education and above all so that they are able to survive day to day. 

She has worked selling new and second-hand clothes to the people in her community for eight years. She relies on the help of her oldest daughter, who sells part of the merchandise to her work colleagues in the free trade zone. The solidarity group has been working with this organisation for 24 loan cycles, and Gloria has managed to improve her home and increase her sales, because she has invested in products that she previously didn't offer.

She is applying for the loan to buy merchandise such as washboards, Lycra, blouses, packs of shorts, skirts and t-shirts, with a view to increasing her income and re-investing it in products that the market offers daily and that people ask for. 

The other members are señora Ruth, 46 years old, who has offered a phone credit service in her home for more than one year, and señor Pedro, 64 years old, who has sold milk to the people in his community from his home and on the street for eight years. These members show different ways to earn a living for their families.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as washboards, Lycra, shirts, and women's and men's trousers.

loans.name: El Manguito Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias laboriosas, lo coordina la señora Lillieth de 28 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 9 años y 6 meses, quienes son su motivación de su superación, se dedica a la venta de cereales en uno de los mercados capitalino, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra del quintal de maíz, cacao, canela, clavo de olor, bolsas, todo esto al por mayor. Otra de las socias es la señora Maryory de 35 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 2 años en su domicilio, la señora Sofía de 27 años dedicada a la comercialización frutas, y la señora Erica de 39 años de edad quien ofrece el servicio de venta de productos varios como gaseosas, galletas, golicinas, etc., en la bahía de los buses de granada. Con este crédito las socias invertirán en sus negocios para alcanzar un nivel de vida más acorde a la realidad.
texts.en:
The group consists of four hardworking women coordinated by Lillieth. She is 28 years old, married and mother of two children, a 9 year old and a 6 month old, who are her motivation for her personal improvement.

She sells cereals in one of the markets of the capital. She will invest the loan in buying wholesale quintals (about 100lbs) of corn, cocoa beans, cinnamon, cloves and bags.

Another of the members is Maryory who is 35 years old and for the past 2 years has run a small grocery store from her home. Sofia is 27 years old and sells fruit, Erica is 39 years old and sells various products such as soft drinks, biscuits, sweets etc. on the buses to Granada. 

With this loan the members will invest in their businesses to reach a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn, cocoa beans, cinammon, firewood etc.

loans.name: Victoria Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios exitosos y lo coordina la señora María Auxiliadora de 64 años de edad y casada, se dedica a la venta de comida en su domicilio desde hace 22 años por lo que la mayor parte de su clientela es fija, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, plátano verde, plátano maduro, carne de res, cerdo, pollo, repollo, lechugas, etc., la socia con los créditos anteriores ha logrado implementar el negocio de la venta de queso en su domicilio, siendo esto lo que la ha motivado para seguir prestando en esta institución y así mejorar su nivel de vida. Otro de los socios es el señor Roberto de 40 años de edad, comerciante de productos varios como es radio de baterías, focos, auriculares, baterías, etc., estos productos lo comercializa en el mercado de Masaya, y la señora Lylliam de 59 años de edad comerciante de perfumes a los pobladores de su comunidad con una experiencia de doce años.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three successful members and coordinated by María Auxiliadora, who is 64 years old and married. She has had a food delivery business for twenty-two years, which is why she has a fixed customer base.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as rice, beans, vegetable oil, unripe and ripe plantains, beef, pork, chicken, cabbage and lettuce. With the previous loans, María was able to start selling cheese at home. This has helped her to improve her living conditions and motivated her to continue requesting loans at this institution.

The remaining members are Roberto, 40, who sells devices such as radios, batteries, light bulbs and headphones at Masaya’s marketplace; and Lylliam, 59, who has been selling perfumes to her neighbors for twelve years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, beans, vegetable oil, plantains, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es una mujer muy luchadora de 61 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura, y el comercio, desde hace 31 años ella llevaba la comida hasta el lugar donde trabajaba su papá y fue de esa manera que aprendió a trabajar viendo como era el manejo que se le daba al cultivo, además se dedica a comercializar productos como reliquias y venta de verduras en el mercado. 

Anteriormente se dedicaba a comprar animales y engordarlos para luego venderlos, Felicitas desde muy pequeña ha sido una persona muy activa y trabajadora que se propone sus metas hasta lograrlas y es así como ha podido salir adelante con mucho optimismo enseñando  a sus hijos a trabajar, Doña Felicitas se levanta muy temprano desde las 4:00 AM para ir a vender al mercado mientras que su esposo y sus hijos se van a la milpa,

Con el crédito se le estará apoyando para que pueda comprar los insumos que va a necesitar para cultivar una hectárea de maíz y así poder tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones Pues es de la agricultura de donde obtienen los alimentos que a diario se consumen en el hogar, ademas podrá invertir en su negocio comprando algunos productos para venderlos en el mercado. 


Sus sueños en un futuro son re-modelar su casa y poder establecer un negocio en la misma, para así poder mejorar su condiciones de vida y poder dejarles a sus hijos una fuente de ingresos y una bonita casa en donde puedan vivir tranquilamente.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a woman who is a fighter. She is 61 years old and with a lot of hard work has been able to get her 6 children ahead. Right now, she works in agriculture. She has done this for 31 years. She would take food to where her father was working and that is how she learned to work, watching how he manages the crops. She also sells products such as antiques and vegetables in the market. 

Previously, she would buy animals and fatten them up to sell them. Since Felicitas was very young, she has been a very active and hardworking person who sets her goals and meets them. That is how she has been able to get ahead with a lot of optimism, teaching her children to work. Felicitas gets up very early at 4:00 AM to go to the market while her husband and children go to the fields.   

With the loan, she will be helped so she can buy materials that she is going to need to plant a hectare of corn and keep her crop in good condition. Farming is where she obtains food for daily consumption in her home. She will also be able to invest in her business, buying some products to sell in the market.   

Her dream for the future are to re-model her house and be able to establish her business there so that she can improve her living conditions and be able to leave her children a a source of income and a nice house where they can live in peace.

loans.use: to buy materials she is going to need to plant a hectare of corn.

loans.name: Julia Estebana

texts.es:
Julia tiene 37 años, es ama de casa, estudio hasta séptimo grado debido a la situación económica que vivia junto a sus  padres le fue imposible terminar sus estudios, actualmente esta acompañada y su compañero de vida es agricultor, tiene cuatro hijos, el primero está casado y los otros tres estudian, noveno, cuarto y primer grado.

Ella utilizara el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: 4 sacos de sulfato, un saco de formula, herbicidas para la plaga, una bolsa de semilla, para la preparación de la tierra, entre otros.

Su sueño es que en el  futuro él cultivo le dé  buenos resultados, por ende ganancias para cancelar su crédito y tener las puertas abiertas para otros. Así mismo, ayudar a sus hijos para que siga estudiando y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Julia is 37 years old and is a housewife. She studied until the seventh grade. Because of the economic situation that she and her parents lived in, it was impossible for her to finish her studies. Currently she is accompanied by her life partner, who is a farmer. She has four children - the eldest is married and the other three are studying in ninth, fourth and first grade.

She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as 4 sacks of sulfate, one sack of formula, herbicides for the pests, a bag of seed, to prepare the land, among other things.

Her dream is that in the future the crops will give her good results, and finally profits to pay off her credit and have the door open for other loans. That way, she can help her children so they keep studying and can have better employment opportunities.

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of sulfate, one of formula, herbicides for the pests and a bag of seed, among other things.

loans.name: José León

texts.es:
José es agricultor se dedica a la siembra de granos basicos desde muy pequeño, antes trabajaba de auxiliar de topografo, pero hoy en dia se dedica de lleno a la agricultura, se levanta muy temprano para ir a la milpa mientras que su esposa hace el oficio en la casa y cuida de sus hijos quienes por la mañana asisten a la escuela.

José quiere el préstamo para comprar insumos agricolas como herbicidas, abono, entre otros materiales que son necesarios. A  José le gusta aprovechar la tierra y cuidar de su milpa despues de la siembra del maiz, tambien siembra frijoles, maicillo y cuando esta la temporada lluviosa hace una pequeña siembra de ayotes los que saca a la venta en el mes de octubre.

El sueño de  José es seguir produciendo granos basicos y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who has grown basic grains since he was very young. Previously, he worked as an assistant topographer, but now he is a full time farmer.  He gets up very early to go to the fields while his wife works in the home and cares for the children who go to school in the morning. 

José wants the loan to buy agricultural materials such as herbicides, fertilizer, and others that he needs. José likes to work the land and care for his crop after he plants the corn. He also plants beans and sorghum and when its rainy season, he has small squash crop that he sells in October.  

José's dream is to keep producing basic grains so he children can finish their education.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, fertilizer and other needed materials.

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos, lo coordina la señora Rosa de 69 años de edad y casada, es abuela de dos nietos quienes son su motivación para seguir trabajando, es propietaria de una mini pulpería desde hace cinco años, este negocio lo impulso cuando su esposo trabajaba como jardinero y de los ahorros comenzó a invertir en su propio negocio, es de ahí que la socia reconoce la importancia del ahorro, pues el crédito lo solicita para la compra de dos cerdo en pie y mayor variedad de productos como es arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, caramelos, chiverías, pan, jugo eskimo, etc.; el grupo solidario tiene 22 ciclos de estar trabajando con esta institución y ésta socia por medio de los créditos ha aumentado las ganancias lo que le ha permitido invertir en  electrodomésticos que le son de utilidad para su negocio como es la compra de una mantenedora y una cocina, esto la ha motivado a seguir invirtiendo para lograr ampliar su negocio. Los otros socios son la señora María del Rosario de 35 años de edad dedicada a la hecha y venta de tortilla en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, y el señor Néster de 47 años de edad, propietario de un taller de refrigeración en su domicilio, también ofrece el servicio de soldador y electricista a domicilio, con una experiencia de doce años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of three hard-working members, and coordinated by señora Rosa, who is 69 years old and married. She is a grandmother to two grandchildren who are her motivation to continue working. She has owned a mini grocery store for five years, a business which she launched when her husband was working as a gardener and she started investing their savings in her own business. It is from this that she recognises the importance of saving. 

She is applying for the loan for the purchase of two live pigs and a bigger variety of products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sweets, snacks, bread, Eskimo juice etc. 

The solidarity group has been working with this organisation for 22 loan cycles and this member has increased her earnings through the loans. This has allowed her to invest in electrical appliances that are useful for her business, such as a food storage unit and a stove. This has motivated her to continue investing in order to expand her business.

The other members are señora María del Rosario, 35 years old, who has made and sold tortilla in her home for five years, and señor Néster, 47 years old, who owns a refrigerator repair shop in his home. He also offers a home welding and electrician service, in which he has twelve years of experience.

loans.use: to buy two live pigs and basic staple foods.

loans.name: Modesto Alberto

texts.es: Don modesto de 45 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijas; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas , el terreno de cultivo está ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, Don modesto tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Modesto, 45, lives with his life partner and his daughter.  He makes a living in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  He has many years of experience in this field and has valuable experience that allows him to get the best harvests.

Modesto's land is located in an agricultural area.  He sells in all the nearby areas and has a lot of steady customers who always prefer his product because of the quality, affordable prices, and incomparable service.

He wants to buy agricultural inputs but he needs capital.  He's asking Integral for a loan to buy seeds, soil amendments, insecticide, fertilizer, pest control, tools, etc., and to improve the plot of land shown in the photograph.

Modesto has a good payment record and is sure he'll be able to pay back the debt on time.  He also trusts he'll be able to give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to improve his land

loans.name: Milagro De La Paz

texts.es: Milagro de 49 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia desde hace varios años se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maiz, frijoles, hárinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocida por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que la prefieren por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cuchillas, discos y demás herramientas para darle mantenimiento a su molino. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en: Milagro is 49 years old. She is a single mother and has lived in her own home for several years. She works in her mill, processing all types of food, such as corn, beans, flours, sauces and more. She has had this business for some time and has a lot of experience and is very well known to the people in her community. She has gained a lot of customers who prefer her because of her accessible prices an the unequaled service, always at her customers orders. In the last few weeks, demand has increased for the service and that is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy blades, discs, and other tools to do maintenance on her mill. She has good payment references and is responsible. She is committed to paying off the loan and has faith that it will bring financial and emotional security to her family.

loans.use: to buy blades, discs and other tools.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Jose de 57 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, Jose vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, insecticidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía y poder continuar consus cultivos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, 57, has worked in agriculture for several years.  His main crop is corn.  He sells his crops in the various markets near his home.

José lives in his own home with his life partner and his son.

He's requesting a loan to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, insecticide, etc., as shown in the photograph, so he can keep on growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, herbicide, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Jose vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona y posee mucha clientela por la calidad de los productos y los buenos precios, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografía y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his life partner and his son.

He has worked for several years in agriculture growing corn.  He sells his crops on the outskirts of the area.  He has a lot of customers because of the quality of his products and his good prices.

José's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest controls, herbicide, etc., as shown in the photograph.  That way he'll be able to keep on growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, soil amendments, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a forty-seven-year-old married male living in Kasese-Uganda with five children who all go to school. He has been a salt miner for two years, working six days a week and ten hours a day at the lake. He began a business to sustain his family and needs money to buy salt to sell. Wilson hopes to educate his children. However, bad weather and high license fees are the difficulties he faces.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell

loans.name: Hudoydod

texts.ru:
Худодйдод трудолюбивый парень в возрасте 28 лет. Он женат и пока еще не имеет детей. Он обратился в Арванд, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Худойдод живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Худойдода также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой. Он очень любит свою семью и делает всё возможное  чтобы они всегда находились в достатке.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Худойдод занимается своим бизнесом. У него имеется продуктовый ларек на местном базаре, где он продает сельхозпродукты. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Худойдоду в его деле.  Сейчас Худойдод хочет увеличить количество товара и расширить ассортимент. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку овощей для продажи. Худойдод очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hudoydod is a hard-working, 28-year-old guy. He is married but does not have any children yet. He applied for a loan with Arvand when he found out that it was possible to receive financial support. Hudoydod lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a higher education and it was not possible for him to study at university due to his family's financial difficulties. His wife does not have a higher education either and is a homemaker. Hudoydod loves his family and does everything he can to ensure their well-being. 

Hudoydod has a business so that he can earn income to feed his family. He has a grocery stall at the local market and sells agricultural products. He earns a good income from his business and his wife helps him with the work. Now Hudoydod wants to sell a larger volume and wider assortment of goods. This is why he applied for a loan with Arvand to purchase vegetables to sell. Hudoydod hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Esperanza Dinora

texts.es: Esperanza de 41 años de edad se dedica a la venta y elabora antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, pastelitos de carne, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. Esperanza pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los pastelitos, platanos, verduras, carnes  y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 41, earns a living making and selling snacks: fried potatoes, fried yuca, empanadas, meat pies, etc.  Her business is located near her home.  Thanks to her sales and her husband's help, they have managed to pay their household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and children.

Esperanza's requesting a loan to buy products for making her snacks, such as oil, potatoes, corn for the pies, plantains, vegetables, meat, and all the necessary ingredients.  That way she'll be able to keep on supporting her household and be able to cover any expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn, plantains, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Erlis Antonio

texts.es: Erlis de 37 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y continuar con sus cultivos y asi poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Erlis is 37 years old. For many years, he has worked in farming. His main crop is corn. What he earns from his sales lets him resolve some household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life partner and children. He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc. He can continue with his crops and give his family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane, est agriculteur depuis plus de cinq ans, il cultive du mil et de l’arachide. Il possède un champ qu’il exploite presque toute l’année mais il met le paquet surtout pendant l’hivernage. C’est pourquoi il sollicite ce crédit afin de préparer la période, en achetant des semences et de l’engrais. 
Souleymane est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son épouse et de ses enfants. Il vit en grande famille, avec ses frères, ce qui allège un peu ses charges car les revenus sont minces. 
Souleymane voudrait diversifier ses activités en faisant de l’élevage de moutons, chèvres et même de bœufs et avoir une grande ferme agricole ; cela il pense pouvoir le réaliser grâce à l’appui de l’IMCEC.
texts.en:
Souleymane has been a farmer for more than five years.  He grows millet and peanuts.  He owns a field which he works all year round, particularly in the winter months.  This is why he has requested this loan.   He would like to prepare for this period by buying seed and fertilizer.

Souleymane is married and has children.  He is responsible for providing for the day-to-day expenses of his wife and their children.  As he lives in a large family with his brothers, his costs are reduced.  This helps as revenues are small.

Souleymane would like to expand his business and start raising sheep, goats and even beef cattle.  He would like to run a large agricultural farm.  He believes that this will be possible thanks to the support that he receives from the field partner, UIMCEC.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to prepare for the winter months.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Hope Group is the first one that Namaste has formed in the town of El Tejar, in the municipality of Chimaltenango, Guatemala. These seven women, with an average age of 38, have a wide range of business.  They sell chickens, clothing, shoes, firewood and cosmetics.  With the summer season approaching there is more business in the market and they are eager to work with Namaste to increase their sales. Namaste will provide them with basic financial training, a business advisor to help them develop and follow a business plan, and a small loan.  They are very hopeful that these tools will make a difference in their business and their profits.
Ciria (first from right) is the leader of the group, always gathering the women and organizing them for meetings.  She is a widow, is 55 years old and has a primary school education.  She has four adult sons who help her with some of her living expenses. Her business is selling firewood, flowerpots, grains, eggs and sausages.  Her house is situated on the main highway, which is always crowded, so any time of the day is a good time to sell her products. She will use her loan to buy more products to sell. Her dream is to sustain herself with her business so she no longer needs support from her sons.
She is currently working 224 hours a month and has sales of 5320 Guatemalan Quetzales.  She is projecting an increase in sales of 15% over the nine-month term of her loan.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Enia

texts.en:
Enia is married and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers her time as a Learner Guide, working with schools to improve young people’s lives through teaching them valuable study and life skills. 

To support herself, Enia runs a poultry project in her community, selling broiler chickens. She wants to grow her poultry business to meet the rising demand for poultry in her community, but a lack of capital has hindered her ability to expand. Enia is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can buy more chicks, chemicals and feed to increase her stock of broiler chicks and generate more revenue. 

An increase in profits will help her to improve her standard of living and contribute positively to her community.

loans.use: To buy more chicks, chemicals and feed to increase her stock of broiler chicks and generate revenue.

loans.name: Elena Dinora

texts.es: Elena de 44 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas  entre otras cosas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar vive en casa propia con su hijas, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario como: perfumes, esmaltes para uñas, desodorantes, cremas,perfumes, etc. y ropa ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Elena is 44 years old and works selling all kinds of products for personal use such as lotions, deodorants, cremes and other items.  Her business is located in her home and with the income that she earns she is able to meet household expenses for herself and her daughters.  She is hoping to grow her business and for this reason is asking for a loan which will allow her to buy necessary items such as perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, cremes, etc., as well as clothing since she has many customers for her products, and she sells at reasonable prices.  With the loan requested she will be able to obtain better income and thus continue providing for her family without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, nail polish, deodorants, cremes, etc., as well as clothing

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es: El señor Rufino de 52 años de edad casado con la señora Epifanía, tiene 1 hijo dependiente que está estudiando, la familia vive hacia el norte de Colomi. Se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, papaliza y oca, cultivando en terreno de herencia de parte de sus padres con rotación de cultivos, de esta forma mantiene a su familia, ahora se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas aprovechando que los precios están bajos por la época, con ello tendrá listo insumos agrícolas para la siembra de la siguiente campaña agrícola y podrá ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios para que tenga un futuro mejor, asimismo al contar con mejores ingresos económicos lograra proporcionar a su familia mayor bienestar.
texts.en: Rufino is 53 years old. He is married to Epifanía and they have one dependent child who is in school. The family lives north of Colomi. He earns his living in agriculture, producing potato, oca, and papaliza [Andean tuber vegetables] cultivating a field that he inherited from his parents where he rotates his crops. Through this, he is able to support his family. He is now in need of a loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs for planting the next year's crop. It may help his son in his studies so that he can have a better future and also so Rufino can have a better income to provide his family to achieve greater well-being.

loans.use: to plant next season's harvest

loans.name: Djitoumou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Djitoumou sont mariés majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à N’tomikorobougou un quartier de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de N’tomikorobougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes sortes, habits, charbon du bois, condiments et mèches. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Dadié (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une vendeuse de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs  de chaussures (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détails au marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Dadié compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the Djitoumou Group live mostly in polygamous households.  They are, on average, 40 years old and have four children.  The women live in N'tomikorobougou,  a district of Bamako, and know one another through local connections, or work together selling at the N'tomikorobougou market.  They sell various types of plastic shoes (for men and women), clothing, charcoal, food ingredients and hair extensions.

As the women would like to increase their working capital, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Dadié (sitting on the far right of the photo) sells various types of plastic shoes (for men and women).  She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of shoes (for men and women), of different sizes.  She will buy them wholesale from the main market.  She will then sell the shoes at the market and on foot to a range of customers.

Dadié expects this loan to generate a monthly average profit of 95,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ravshanbek

texts.ru:
Равшанбек добрый общительный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Женат. Равшанбек многодетный отец, он имеет пятерых детей. Он очень заботливый отец.  У Равшанбека дружная семья. Его жена Хикоят занимается воспитанием детей и дополнительно помогает мужу в торговле. Равшанбек в протяжение многих лет занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Он продает продуктов на местном рынке района. Продукты на продажу Равшанбек привозит с города. Равшанбек когда то все начинал с нуля, а на сегодняшней день он имеет уже свою точку на рынке. Равшанбек целеустремленный человек и эти черты его характера помогает ему стремиться вперед. Равшанбек собирается расширить свой товарооборот и умножить разновидности ассортимента. 
Но ему для расширения своего дело немного не хватает денег. Равшанбек с такой финансовой проблемой обратился в МДО Арванд и подал заявку на кредит. Равшанбек  благодарен МДО Арванд за содействия и за поддержку. Равшанбек как клиент обещает  быть честным и добросовестным.
texts.en:
Ravshanbek is a kind, friendly man, aged 47. He is married and the father of many children. He is a very caring father to his five children and has a close-knit family. His wife, Hikoyat, raises the children and helps him with his business. For many years he has sold groceries at the local market. He started the business from nothing and today he has his own stall at the market. He brings all of the grocery products with him to the city. He is very driven and this character trait helps him to always move forward. He is planning to expand his inventory and offer a wider variety of products. 

However, Ravshanbek does not have quite enough money to expand his business. He applied for a loan with MDO Arvand to help with his financial difficulty. He is grateful to MDO Arvand for their assistance and support. He promises to be an honest and conscientious borrower.

loans.use: to buy grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more milk, oil, rice and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make bulk purchases to meet the demands of her customers and increase her profitability.

loans.name: Sijabuliso

texts.en:
Sijabuliso is a single woman aged 24 who lives in the Nkayi District in Zimbabwe. 

She has been running a business for the past year selling sugar, salt, matches, soya mince, flour and cooking oil. She runs the business on her own, but would like to expand it and hire an employee in the future. In her spare time, Sijabuliso volunteers with other Cama members, holding wellbeing and life skills sessions for students in schools in order to create a better world. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Sijabuliso will purchase groceries in bulk from the wholesalers. This will boost her business and increase her sales and profits. She wants to provide her community with the best products so that they don't have to travel long distances for groceries. 

With the profits, she wants to provide for her family and further her education by studying as a policewoman.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra is a 25-year-old married mother of two who lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothes, shoes and blankets at a small shop in her community. 

Babra is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase large quantities of skirts, shoes, pants and tops. With the profits she will expand her business, meet her basic needs and improve her family’s standard of living.

In her free time, Babra is a Learner Guide who works with students in local schools to improve young people’s well-being through life education sessions.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy painting tools and paints.

loans.name: Aganze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Aganze », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des pagnes. Elle étale ses marchandises à domicile dans une avenue  animée de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle débuta avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un infirmier. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 20 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une  maison pour sa famille, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Furaha is a merchant and a member of the business group Aganze. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 40 years old, married to a nurse, and a mother of four children, who all go to school.

Furaha has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] for eight years. She displays her goods from home and along a busy town road. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband. Later she benefited from a Hekima loan.

This new loan will serve to buy 20 lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric].

Furaha wishes to build a house for her family, and feed and education her children.
