To finish, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs, who lack access to banking services, become independent; especially during this time of post conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy 20 lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy welding materials, metal brackets and strips, squared metal, safety curtains, and laminated metal sheeting for doors.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en:
Eseza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and buy a van for transporting green bananas from the village to the market for sale. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mirimo est une commerçante  depuis 12 ans et membré de la banque communautaire «Tujikaze», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 2 étudient et 4 autres qui n’étudient plus. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 100 poissons. Son conjoint est sans emploi. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son père. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en: The borrower, Mirimo, has been working in retail for 12 years and she is a member of the "Tujikaze" communal bank.  She is a 52-year-old dynamic entrepreneur, married and the mother of six children, two of whom are in school while four others no longer study.  Mirimo sells salted fish.  She displays her merchandise at the town's central market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima in order to increase her business.  She will use her loan to buy 100 fish.  Her husband is unemployed.  She started in this business with some money received from her father.  In the future, she would like to build a house, feed and educate her children.  She thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs who are excluded from the banking system.

loans.use: to buy 100 fish.

loans.name: Jesus Mi Amigo Fiel Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario lo integran cinco socias laboriosa, lo coordina la señora Yessenia de 23 años de edad y soltera se dedica a la comercialización de frutas en uno de los mercados de la capital, se dedicó a este negocio hace más de cinco años, anteriormente trabajó como doméstica y con los fondos que ahorró decidió impulsar el negocio de la venta de frutas con cantidades mínimas y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosecha de aguacate, pues este es un producto que está demandando la población, la invertir en este producto la socia logrará ampliará su negocio. Otra de las socias es la señora Miurel de 19 años de edad dedicada a la compra-venta de cosechas y las comercializa principalmente en el mercado de Estelí, la señora Yessenia del Carmen de 29 años de edad comerciante de ropa y cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad, la señora Leonor de 42 años de edad comerciante de frutas y verduras en la capital, y la señora Martha de 36 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio. Las socias solicitan el crédito por primera vez en esta institución con el fin de mejorar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
There are five hardworking members in the communal bank.  The coordinator is Yessenia, 23.  She's single and makes a living selling fruit in one of the markets in the capital city.  She has worked in this business for more than five years; previously she worked as a housekeeper.  With the money she saved she decided to start a business selling fruit retail.

Yessenia's requesting the loan to buy a crop of avocados because people are asking for the fruit.  With the investment she'll be able to expand her business.

Another member is Miurel, 19, who buys and sells harvests, selling mainly in the market in Estelí.  Yessenia del Carmen, 29, sells clothing and cosmetics to the residents of her community.  Leonor, 42, sells fruits and vegetables in the capital, and Martha, 36, owns a grocery store in her home.

The members are requesting a loan for the first time with this institution so they can improve in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy avocados

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sinandugu  est une commerçante et présidente  de la banque villageoise «Alliance», entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 9 enfants dont 4  étudient et 5 autres déjà grands. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile tout au long de la rue dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec  de fonds reçu de son père. Son conjoint est un technicien maçon. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus 1 an qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 sacs de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Sinandugu is a merchant and the president of the banque villageoise Alliance. She is a dynamic, experienced entrepreneur, 40 years old, and a mother of nine children. Four of the children go to school while the other five are already grown up. She is married to a mason.

Sinandugu has been selling basic food products for one year. She displays her goods from her home and along a road in a busy part of town. 

She started this business with funds received from her father. Later she benefited from a loan from Hekima. This new loan will serve to buy two sacs of manioc flour.

Sinandugu would like to build a house and feed, clothe, and educate her children.

Finally, Sinandugu strongly thanks Hekima for helping to make women without access to financial services independent; especially during this critical time of war in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of manioc flour

loans.name: Zephanus

texts.en:
Zephanus is aged 49 with seven children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. He is a hardworking man who has been in the tailoring business for awhile, but also has rentals, coffee, and pig businesses for additional income. He still faces problems of customers not paying on time and the high cost of raw materials. 

Zephanus needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: María Elía

texts.es:
María de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en la escuela y que debido a que tenía que trabajar para sobrevivir,  porque la situación económica en su hogar era muy difícil tuvo que dejar sus estudios y dedicarse a trabajar, está  acompañada su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de albañilería. Es madre de 5 hijos de los cuales solo dos hijas viven en su casa, una de 17 años y la otra de 14, las cuales estudian.

María se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su madre le enseño este oficio y que gracias a ello ahora ella puede sobrevivir con este trabajo. Ella se dedica a esta labor desde que era pequeña, comenta que sus hijas y su esposo le ayudan en su tiempos libres, ella no tiene un horario debido a que los quehaceres del hogar tiene que comenzarlos desde muy temprano para poder atender a su esposo antes de que salga a su trabajo.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la preparación de la tierra, compra de insecticidas y abono. Para invertirlo en la agricultura en la  siembra de maíz y frijol, tener ingresos y poderle dar una mejor alimentación a su familia.

Ella desea para un futuro poder  ayudar económicamente a sus dos hijas en sus estudios,  que logren alcanzar ser profesionales siempre con la ayuda de su esposo,  también desea poder remodelar su casa para vivir más cómodamente con su familia y tener mejores cosechas que le generen mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old. She studied until the sixth grade since she had to work in order to survive. Her household economic situation was very difficult and she had to leave her studies and start working. Her husband works in construction. She is the mother of five children. Only two daughters live at home. One is 17 years old and the other is 14 years old. They are both in school. 

María works as a housekeeper. Her mother taught her this trade. Thanks to her, now she can survive with this work. She has been dedicated to this work since she was young. She mentions that her daughters and husband help her in their free time. She does not have a set schedule, so the household chores have to be started very early so that  she can help her husband before leaving for work. 

The loan she is requesting is for preparing land and buying insecticides and fertilizer in order to invest in farming corn and beans, earn income and give better food to her family.

She wants to be able to help her two daughters economically with their studies in the future, so that they can become professionals. With the help of her husband, she wants to be able to remodel her home in order to live more comfortably with her family. She wants better harvests that generate greater profits for her family.

loans.use: prepare land and buy insecticide and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more groceries at lower costs from wholesalers to sell at favorable prices to attract more customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with two children and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a Learner Guide working with schools to improve young people’s well-being. When she is not volunteering in her community, Mary is busy running a poultry project, selling broiler chickens in her community. She loves her business and is excited to see it grow. 

Mary is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase chick feed, chemicals and more chicks to generate higher profits. This will help raise her standard of living and allow her to better provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with one child and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve young people’s wellbeing by teaching them life skills. Beatrice also serves her community as an entrepreneur who sells groceries such as cooking oil and sugar as well as clothing. 
Beatrice is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase clothing such as skirts, tops, children’s dresses, jackets and shoes in bulk. She also would like to purchase groceries such as soap, sugar, rice and flour in larger quantities to maximize profits. A higher income will allow Beatrice to elevate her family’s quality of life and hopefully someday provide employment for others in her community.

loans.use: To purchase clothing such as skirts, tops, children’s dresses, jackets and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is married and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is running a poultry business selling broiler chickens to help feed her community. Precious is very proud of the progress she has made so far in her business and would like to see it grow. When she is not busy with her chickens, Precious is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide. As a Learner Guide, Precious works with students in local schools by teaching them life skills education and encouraging them to stay in school. 
Precious enjoys operating her poultry business and needs a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks as well as the chemicals and feed in bulk to increase her profit margin.  Precious’s profits will help to raise the quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Promise Group

texts.en:
This group consists of three members who work by selling water poly-tanks, maize, groceries, bags, enamel bowls, slip-ons and cloth. They have been group mates, repaying loans and maintaining savings, for six years. The request for the group's ninth loan will be used to expand their businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities, and together, they have a solid foundation to guarantee the loan. The members are clear on how to track their income, collective loan guarantees and savings.

The group members are residents of Teshie, Accra, Ghana. Salomey is the featured borrower. She is 48 years old, married and has three dependable children. Salomey sells wax prints, slip-ons and enamel bowls, and this loan will enable her to invest into her business. Her family helps her take care of the home, while she handles the selling aspect of the business. Her 10 years of working experience have strengthened her to strategically keep her in business. She has received training on problems such as drugs and crime, and also provision of health subsidies. 

They are empowered, hard-working and determined women. They will hold each other accountable for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy wax prints, slip-ons and enamel bowls to sell to customers

loans.name: Lucero De Querarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCERO DE QURARANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Luisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal se basa en la producción de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Luisa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio familiar, ya que ella desde niña ayudaba en la lechería de sus padres, cuando se casó decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo criará en su estancia para poder comercializar la leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen se observa un hombre de sombrero café al lado de un pilar, él es el esposo de una de las clientas que acompaña al grupo en la imagen.
texts.en:
The “LUCERO DE QURARANI” communal bank is starting their 1st cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office. It is made up of nine members with Luisa as President. The businesses of the the members of the communal bank are based on the production of milk.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of whom Luisa is one. She says that the first time she joined Pro Mujer it was at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her in her in house.

She currently has a business producing milk. She told us that this was a family business. She helped her parents in their dairy from a young age. When she got married she decided to do this independently.

The loan she will get will be used to increase her working capital (buying cattle) which she will purchase from sellers in the city of El Alto and later raise it on her farm to sell the milk. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has 3 children. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the life insurance that they offer.

In the photo you see a man in a coffee colored hat. He is the husband of one of the members that joined the group for the photo.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.en:
Orzugul was born in 1981. She is a careful mother of six children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Orzugul is a higher educated person. She works in a local school as a teacher of lower grades. Orzugul has worked there more than 10 years. She is one of the successful teachers. 

Orzugul always works for the well-being of her children. She must pay for the education of her children in a school but she has not money. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to pay for the education of her children in a school. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her children in a school.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children who all go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail and wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for transporting charcoal from the village to the market for sale.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 34-year-old married woman. She has five children.  

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Currently she is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more doughnut ingredients for her business, including flour, sugar, and oil.

loans.name: Tatenda

texts.en: Tatenda is a 23-year-old, single mother of one. She lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Learner Guide, working with schools in her community to improve young people’s well-being. To earn her living, Tatenda works in poultry production, selling broiler chickens to her community. She is committed to her business and would like to increase her sales. She is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase feed, broiler chicks, containers and chemicals in large quantities, to increase her profits.  A higher income will help her better the standard of living for her family and help her to better provide for her child.

loans.use: to feed and raise more broiler chicks

loans.name: Venencia

texts.en:
Venencia is a 28-year-old single mother of one living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve students’ life and study skills. She also sells groceries such as cooking oil, sugar, flour and rice, but she would like to expand her small business into a larger retail shop. 

Venencia is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in large quantities. This will enable her to sell more merchandise and increase her profits. She will use her increase in profits to live a better life and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Tryphine

texts.en:
Tryphine is a young mother of two children, living in the Nkayi District of Zimbabwe. To give back to her community, she serves as a volunteer Learner Guide, teaching students valuable life skills at the nearby secondary school.

Tryphine is also an active young woman who loves to be economically independent. She is successfully operating a flea market stand, where she sells a variety of clothes. With the requested Kiva loan, she will expand her business by increasing her stock, and profits. With the profits she is going to be able to provide for her family and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married, has one child, and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a Learner Guide, working with schools in her community to improve young people’s well-being by teaching them life skills. In addition, Faith runs a poultry project, selling broiler chickens to local residents. She enjoys managing her business and would love to see it grow.

Faith is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase bulk amounts of broiler chicks, chemicals and feed, in order to increase her sales margin. Higher profits will enable her to better provide for her child, increase the standard of living for her entire family, and assist needy families in the community.

loans.use: To purchase bulk amounts of broiler chicks, chemicals and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani has successfully built her business manufacturing jewelery boxes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has attained a good number of customers and makes good income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality hardboard, cardboard and packs of glue. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase good quality hard board, cardboard and packs of glue.

loans.name: Salomad

texts.en:
Salomad was born in 1969. She is widowed, and bringing up 2 children. She had been busy with growing agricultural products for 15 years. Now, she is going to organize a new business with sewing. Agricultural activity is heavy and she got a small income. She studied the course "To Get Ahead" at a women's organization. 

Salomad is going to sew national women's dresses in her house. Furthermore she will open a workshop. She is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your help.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to start a new business

loans.name: Nuevas Primaveras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVAS PRIMAVERAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Erika es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces, venta de ropas, venta de CD´s, venta de frutas, venta de zapatillas deportivas, venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Erika es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de zapatillas deportivas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento por iniciativa propia al observar el amplio comercio de este producto. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de zapatillas deportivas por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y necesita para sus estudios.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “NUEVAS PRIMAVERAS” communal bank is starting their 3rd cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of eight members, led by a board of directors, with Erika as President. The businesses of the the members of the communal bank are varied: the sale of sweets, selling clothing, selling CD's, the sale of fruit, the sale of sports shoes and selling furniture.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of whom Erika is one. She says that she joined the institution on the invitation of a neighbor who is a member of the institute. She currently owns a business selling sports shoes. She tells us that she started this business on her own initiative observing the size of this market.

The loan that she will access is to increase her capital (buying sports shoes wholesale) which she will get at the markets of the city of El Alto and later sell on request to her clients. This method of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is single and needs the money for her studies. When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer she replies that she liked the health services offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Israël Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Aziza est une brave commerçante d’une expérience de 14 ans, présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires «Israël» âgée de 35 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle étale ses marchandises au marché de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 2 sacs de farine maïs,1 sac de braises, huile et épices. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, c’est un chauffeur. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les  mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de  microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Aziza is an energetic vendor with 14 years of experience. She is the  leader of the Israel business Association she belongs to. She is 35 years old and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She sells staple foods. She displays her wares at the city market. She is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to grow her business. She will buy two bags of corn flour, one bag of charcoal, vegetable oil and spices. She launched her business with the funds received from her husband, a driver. She would like to grow her capital and provide for the education and a better quality of life for her children. She thanks Hekima for supporting female entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking by giving them access to microloans without collateral, especially during this time following armed conflicts in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn flour, one bag of charcoal, vegetable oil and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toothpaste, biscuits and sodas to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
At the age of 35, Farzana is a married woman. She has two children. She has been running a school for many years to pay for her household expenditures. She has gained a good number of students and is respected in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts. 

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Mumtaz has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs, as well as a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her school becomes well-known in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs, as well as a new blackboard.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra has expertise in embroidery and is using her skill to provide for her family for over five years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.
 
To help her to continue her operations, Bushra requested her eighth loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for its embellishment. With the loan, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to see an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to purchase reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 20 years old and married. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. She runs a poultry operation, selling broiler chickens at the local market. Janet produces about 100 birds every six weeks. She uses the profits she earns from her business to support herself and her family. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide, giving counseling to students to remain in school.

With a Kiva loan, she will build a larger fowl run and produce more broiler chicks – increasing production to over 250 per month. She hopes to turn her project into a retail outlet, and supply broilers chicks to big supermarkets. Janet also wants to continue with her education and positively contribute to her community.

loans.use: To build a bigger fowl run, and buy more broiler chicks and feed.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for three years and has become famous for providing high quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, Munawar has gradually improved her business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her eighth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coal, rice and oil, for cooking

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been doing business selling milk for many years. She has five calves and two cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has six children, and she is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Bashiran's third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through the support of the organization. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow and feed for the calves that she already has. She expects a boost in her earnings through higher sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for her calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen is a young single entrepreneur, who lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. To give back to the community, Ellen is a volunteer Learner Guide, working in schools to improve young people‘s well-being. She also runs a poultry project, supplying broiler chickens to her community. She would like to increase the quantity of birds she is raising and selling, by buying more chicks and the necessary supplies and equipment, including feed and containers. A Kiva loan will allow her to make those essential purchases to grow her business. Ellen will use the profits to improve her quality of life and become more financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chick feed and other supplies

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN LORENZO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elvera es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, venta de papa, venta de verduras, tienda de cotillones, venta de chatarras, venta de detergentes, tejido y venta de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elvera es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de verduras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al apoyar a su madre y a su tía cuando ella era niña, posteriormente decide iniciar su negocio independientemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta ausente una de las socias, ya que se encontraba en consultorio médico y por ello se ausentó de la imagen.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Lorenzo" will begin its seventh loan cycle with Pro Mujer. It is part of the focal center of Senkata in La Paz, Bolivia, and it is made up of eight group members and directed by a board led by Elvera, who is President. The businesses run by group members are varied, including the following: transportation services, selling potatoes, selling vegetables, running a holiday store, selling costume jewelry, selling detergent, knitting and selling blankets. 

The credit requested will be used to benefit small micro businesses such as the one that Elvera runs. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago based on the invitation of a neighbor who is a group member.  Currently Elvera has a small business that sells vegetables.  She notes that she learned the business through the help of her mother and her aunt when she was a child.  Later she decided to begin her own independent business. 

The loan that she is requesting will be used to increase capital (to buy vegetables in bulk) which she will accomplish in the city market of El Alto and then later sell on demand to her customers.  This form of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family, since she is married and has four children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings that the institution offers. 

In the foto one of the group members is absent since she was at a medical appointment and for that reason could not be in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Siempre Alegres Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMPRE ALEGRES” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dominga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, venta de ganado porcino, venta de ganado ovino, venta de ganado vacuno, venta de comida.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dominga es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar la necesidad de los vecinos de contar con un espacio de consumo de comida.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank group "Siempre Alegres" [Always Cheerful] begins their fifth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Patacamaya. It is composed of 12 members, headed by a board of which Dominga is President. Business that the members of the community association carry out are varied and include selling potatoes and potato flour, selling pigs, selling sheep, selling cattle, and food sales.
A loan is a great benefit for small microentrepreneurs like Dominga. She entered Pro Mujer two years ago on the invitation of a promoter of the institution who makes home visits. Today, she has a business selling food. She says that she began this business on her own initiative upon observing her neighbors' needs to have a space for the the consumption of food.
The loan will now bring her a capital increase to buy vegetables wholesale. She will buy wholesale in the city of El Alto and then take it to market in her retail space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as she is married and has 4 children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Dominga replies that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale vegetables for her food stall

loans.name: 27 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “27 DE MAYO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maribel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, venta de dulces, venta de chuño, venta de chompas, servicio de transporte, repostería, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maribel es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de dulces; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años al observar que este producto era ampliamente comercializado en los mercados paceños. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, los ahorros y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

Una de las clientes no esta presente, ya que tuvo que ir a su negocio con premura.
texts.en:
The “27 DE MAYO” communal bank is starting their 1st cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of eight members, led by a board of directors, with Maribel as President. The businesses of the the members of the communal bank are varied: sewing ponchos, selling sweets, the sale of dried potatoes, selling sweaters, transportation services, pastries and selling potatoes.

The loan will benefit all these micro-entrepreneurs of whom Maribel is one. She says that she joined the institution on the invitation of a companion who is a member of the institute. She currently has a business selling sweets. She tells us that she started her business several years ago observing that this product sold well in the markets of La Paz.

The loan she will receive is to increase her capital (buying sweets wholesale) which she will purchases in the markets of the city of El Alto and later sell on request to her clients. This form of working allows her to generate income to support her family as she is single. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she liked the health services, the savings and the training that the institute offers.

One of the members was not present for the picture as she had to return to her business urgently.

loans.use: to buy candies wholesale.

loans.name: Charima Rosalinda

texts.es:
Charima está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá algunos electrodomésticos para su hogar como una cocina, entre otros , con ello podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Charima es una joven de 20 años de edad, cada día en la mañana trabaja en un pequeño negocio de venta de celulares, con el cual apoya a sus padres con los gastos de la familia y por las noches estudia una carrera técnica en un instituto de su ciudad. Charima se esfuerza mucho ya que su más grande sueño es:” Ser una gran profesional y el orgullo de su familia”.
texts.en:
Charima is very grateful to Kiva lenders because it is the second time that they are supporting her. This time, she wants some appliances for her home such as a stove, among others, to improve the quality of life for her family.
Charima is 20 years old. Every day in the morning she works in a small business selling cell phones which helps support her parents in paying family expenses. In the evening, she is studying for a degree at a technical institute in her city. 
Charima tries hard since her biggest dream is to "be a great professional and the pride of her family."

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.ru: Мукаррам в первую очередь хотела бы поблагодарить МДО Арванд и конечно же кредиторам Кива за поддержку. В очередной раз Мукаррам берет кредит для расширения и улучшения своего бизнеса. В летнее время потребность к овощам и фруктам у местности растут, так как летом все занимаются заготовкой к зиме. Мукаррам конечно в сезон хотела бы получить немного дохода от продажи и на эти деньги хотела бы отремонтировать дом. Она оптом закупает овощи у деканов и на местном рынке продает их в розницу. Мукаррам имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Она больше десяти лет торгует на рынке. За эти длительные годы она завоевала множество постоянных клиентов. Мукаррам Благодаря своему небольшому бизнесу улучшила семейную жизнь и дает образованию своему сыну. Мукаррам ведь сама воспитывает своих детей одна без мужа и не хочет, чтобы ее дети чувствовали отсутствие отца, поэтому она со всеми силами старается не в чем не отказывать им. Мечта и цель Мукаррама её семья, а точнее благополучие ее детей и их успех в будущем. Ради этого Мукаррам не хочет остановиться на достигнутом, а наоборот год за годом расширяет свой бизнес.
texts.en: Mukarram would first like to thank MDO Arvand and, of course, Kiva lenders for their support. Once again Mukarram is taking out a loan to expand and improve her business. In the summer, the demand for fruit and vegetables grows because during the summer people work to prepare for the coming winter. During this season, Mukarram would like to make some extra money from sales so she can put some aside to renovate her house. She buys wholesale from farms and resells vegetables at the local market. Mukarram has extensive experience doing this.  She has been selling at the market for more than ten years. During these years, she has established many loyal customers. Because of this business, Mukarram has been able to improve her family's living conditions and even provide her son with an education. Mukarram is a single mother who does not want her children to suffer from their father's absence, so she works with all of her might to provide for them. Mukarram's dreams and goals are to ensure her children's welfare and their future success. To do this, Mukarram does not want to stop here but, on the contrary, keep expanding her business year after year.

loans.use: buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad (in the photo) is a 27-year-old single man from the city of Khanyounis. He lives with his family in a small house in the city.

He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Murad would like to improve his family's living conditions so he has decided to work in transporting goods using a rickshaw. He has taken out a USD loan from FATEN in order to help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. By taking out this loan, Murad will be able to work extra hours transporting goods in the local market, which will increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
This group is Greda group, and it is comprised of two ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan, in the total amount of GHS 4,300, to invest into the sale of groceries, cloth and charcoal.

Naomi is a hardworking woman. She is a 42-year-old, married woman, with two dependable children. She lives with her family, in Tehsie. She is the featured borrower of this group. Naomi studied till Elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Naomi started her business, selling groceries and charcoal at her residence, more than 11 years ago. She started her business with a small amount of working capital, thanks to the assistance of her husband, who supported her financially.

Year by year her business has improved, but most of what she earns in profits goes to the expenses of the family and savings. She has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to enlarge her business, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of GHS 1,800 from ID-Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries and charcoal, and sell them to her customers. Naomi looks forward to expanding her business more, in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en:
Akhter is a 40-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making artificial jewelry and has been for many years. The man shown in the photo is Akhter’s husband. The business has great potential for growth, and Akhter is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. She has six children; three of them are going to school. 

In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Akhter requested for a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend it on providing high quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 42-year-old widow. She has been doing business selling vegetables for the past seven years. She is very enthusiastic in her vegetable sales business to earn reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children. She is responsible for their food, health and education and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase sacks of onions, ginger, potatoes and cabbages. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, ginger, potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Jose Isamel

texts.es: José de 25 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos (una niña de 5 años y un varón de 5 meses). José se dedica a comprar y vender todo tipo de metal como, hierro, cobre, aluminio, batería de vehículos etc. Con ésta actividad ha podido salir adelante y llevar el sustento a su familia. José está dispuesto a esforzarse aun más para que sus hijos puedan recibir la educación, salud y bienestar. Además de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda; por lo que ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI y con el dinero comprar el cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de toda su vivienda ya que como se aprecia en la fotografía actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en: José is 25 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and two small children (a 5 year old daughter an a 5 month old son). José works selling all kinds of metal like steel, copper aluminum, vehicle batteries, etc. This activity allows him to progress and support his family. José is prepared to work even more so that his children can receive their education, health and well being. He also wants to improve the condition of their house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement in the floor of all his house. His house is seem in the photo and currently has dirt floors.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, to cement in the floor of his house.

loans.name: Gris Meris Del Carmen

texts.es: Gris de 28 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad a quien estudiando en una escuela pública. De sus vecinos y amistades se ha ganado todo el respeto y admiración ya que ella sola está sacando adelante a su hijo y ha podido establecer un pequeño negocio de granos básicos que comercializa fuera del municipio en donde vive. La vivienda de Gris es muy humilde, las paredes son de lámina y la estructura y cubierta del techo es de madera y lámina ya deteriorada. Gris ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para cambiar todo el material de la cubierta del techo de su vivienda. Con el dinero comprará lámina galvanizad y polines. Gris, dice que cumplirá con todas las cuotas de este crédito así más adelante solicitar otros para seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Gris is a single mother to her ten-year-old son, who is currently in school. Gris has earned respect and admiration from her friends and neighbours as she is helping her to son to prosper, and because she has set up her own little business selling basic grains outside her local municipality. 

Gris' home is very humble: the walls are made of corrugated metal sheeting, while the frame of the house and the roof are made with wood and metal sheeting that has now deteriorated. Gris has applied for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to change the roof of her house. This loan will be used to buy corrugated metal sheeting and purlins. Gris tells us that she will keep up repayments on this loan so that, in the future, she may apply for further loans to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheeting and purlins to replace the roof on her home as the current one is deteriorated.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes and shoes for her boutique.

loans.name: Astajona

texts.en: Astajona is a sixty-year-old woman, widowed with three grandchildren going to school, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Being the only breadwinner, she has to provide for their well-being, including education. She grows mainly cocoa which she sells to satisfy her desires. She dreams of building a permanent house for her children. To supplement what she harvests from her plantation, Astajona is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. 

Fatmeh has been working in the agriculture sector for the past three years in order to earn extra income and be able to support her family financially.

Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase items for her business such as seeds and seedlings in order to improve productivity.

loans.use: to purchase items for her business such as seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a forty-two-year-old female married with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in business for five years. She is a very hard-working mother who also grows cocoa to supplement her income. She dreams of buying land to grow more cocoa on a large scale. She wants a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is forty-two-year-old woman, divorced with three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells  cloth used for clothing and has been in business for four years. She is a very hard-working mother who also grows cocoa to supplement her income and educate her children, being a single parent. She dreams of buying land to grow more cocoa on a large scale. She wants a loan to buy more cloth to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap and materials for babies to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, juice, luncheon meat, sardines, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and flagstones in order to complete the renovation of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Bunhor

texts.en:
Bunhor is 40 years old. He is a widower who has two children at Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and earns approximately $13 per day. 

Now, he would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 to buy timber and zinc roofing sheets to build a kitchen. 

In the future, he hopes that he can run a business of selling motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy timber and zinc roofing sheets to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng is 55 years old. He is a widower who has three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver and all of his children are employed. All of them can earn approximately $19 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to pay for building a house for his children. In the future, he hopes he can buy a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle with trailer) to provide transportation service to clients.

loans.use: To pay for building a house for his children

loans.name: Senghuoy

texts.en: Senghuoy is 57 years old. He is a married man who has six children in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He and his wife are farmers and his three children are factory laborers. All of them can earn approximately $19 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to pay for his child’s wedding party. In the future, he hopes that he can purchase more farmland to grow rice.

loans.use: To pay for his child's wedding party

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, a resident of Kampala, Uganda, is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. They have access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

Veronica has operated a rented retail shop for the last five years, working seven days a week. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. She has requested a loan of 2,300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, baking flour and crates of soda. 

Veronica's goal is to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, rice, soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Flor De Amapola Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE AMAPOLA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Josefina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, servicio de ritos tradicionales, venta de medicina natural, tejido de mantas, venta de conservas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Josefina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace veinte años, al observar que en su zona n o existía un comercio con estas características. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal association "Flor de amapola" will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Cascada Focal Center. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors where Sra. Josefina is the president. There are many businesses that the members of the communal association bring forward, among them include: corner store, traditional ritual service, natural medicine sales, knitted blankets, and canned food sales. 
 
The loan that they take out will benefit the small microbusinesses where Sra. Josefina is a member. She indicates that one year ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining by the invitation of a neighbour who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a corner store business; she says that she began this business 20 years ago upon observing that there was no shop with these characteristics. 

The loan that she will now take out is for the augmentation of capital (purchase of bulk items) that she will acquire from the markets in the city of El Alto and later she will sell it in her place of sale. This manner of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has five children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a hardworking woman from a rural area. She is the married parent of four children. She has higher education and is a teacher in a school. 

Mukaddas has been busy with growing agriculture products such as maize, wheat and watermelon more than 10 years. She has 2 hectares of land. Her husband helps her to grow agricultural products.

Mukaddas has great experience in this field. Her experience and skills help her to develop the business.She is going to make a new sowing but she has not enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy them. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Yavar

texts.en:
Yavar is a 54-year-old widow. She has a son and two daughters. 

Yavar has been working in a market for 34 years. She sells daily products (bread, butter, sweets, cheese, etc.) wash powder and other detergents and cosmetics in a small local market. Her monthly income is 200 AZN and she has good experience in this area.

People have high demand for daily products. They buy fresh bread every morning and use butter and other products to cook or prepare food. Cosmetics and detergents are also in high demand. Local people prefer to attend Yavar’s market because she is very kind and always sells quality products and other things. 

Yavar’s income doesn’t cover her family’s demands. She has to provide for her children. She applied for an 800 AZN loan in order to supply more new products and increase the assortment.  She plans to build her small product market into a big one and increase her income.

loans.use: to supply more new products and increase the assortment.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 37 años es hijo único vive con su pareja y juntos tiene un hijo de años, al niño le gusta le gusta mucho jugar con su padre, David se pasa la mayor tiempo del día en su trabajo pero todos los domingos tiene una cita sin falta con su hijo para entretenerse y dedicarse  a su deporte favorito, David terminó sus estudios secundarios y pudo capacitarse a nivel técnico en el armado y mantenimiento de computadoras, es de esa manera que se hace cargo de su familia, él piensa que el estudio es el éxito de su vida y por eso quiere que su hijo tenga mejores oportunidades para conseguir esto necesita una ampliación de su negocio con eso logrará levantar las ventas de su servicio y llegar  a más gente, El señor David sólo quiere ayudar  a su familia y piensa en un futuro lograra comprar su casa propia, mientras tanto su hijo ya comienza a desarmar computadoras como si fuera un juego ¨mi niño es muy inteligente le paso equipos fuera de uso para que los desarme y luego los vuelva a armar¨. David solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles de trabajo.
texts.en:
David, age 37, is an only child.  He lives with his life partner, and they have one child.  His son really likes playing with his father.  David spends most of the day at his work.  However, every Sunday, without fail, he has a date with his son to train and play his favorite sport.

David completed high school, and he was able to train as a technician in the installation and maintenance of computers.  This is the way he takes care of his family.  He thinks that education is the success of his life.  Therefore, he wants his son to have better opportunities.  In order to do this, he needs to expand his business.  By doing so, he will manage to increase the sale of his services and reach more people.

David only wants to help his family.  He is thinking of buying his own house in the future.  His son has already starting to take apart computers as if it were a game.  “My son is very intelligent.  I give him equipment that is no longer in use, and he takes it apart and then puts it back together”.

David is requesting a loan to buy furniture for his work.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his work.

loans.name: Bibitosh

texts.en:
Bibitosh is a careful mother of three children.

She needs financial support, so she is a borrower of IMON. Bibitosh is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS because she is going to buy cattle for increasing the working capital of her business. 

She began this business 10 years ago. She feeds cows and sheep and sells them in a local market. Her children help her with feeding cattle. She works hard because her business is the main source of income. Her husband has seasonal work, so he has not a strong source of income. 

Bibitosh needs and awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Demis

texts.es:
La señora  Demis  de  29 años de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación, se dedica la venta de abarrotería y  refrescos sus clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad en su negocio, ella  vende refresco y jugos de caja y bote, huevos, café azúcar, y una gran variedad de productos de la canasta básica, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
Doña Demis  solicita el crédito para compra de jugos de caja y bote, huevos, café azúcar y refresco, su negocio está ubicado en la aldea Pavana al sur de Honduras.
Doña Demis su sueño es  seguir creciendo más en su negocio, y mejorar sus ingresos para lograr una calidad de vida mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – MAYO 2014
texts.en:
Demis is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband.  She sells groceries and soft drinks and her customers prefer to buy from her because she is friendly.  She sells soda and juices in boxes and cans.  She also sells eggs, coffee, sugar, and a large variety of basic food products, seven days a week.

Demis is asking for this loan to buy juice boxes and cans, eggs, coffee, sugar and soda.  Her business is located in Pavana, in southern Honduras.


Demis’ dream is to continue growing her business and improving her income to achieve a better quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Elsy Dilenia

texts.es:
La señora Elsy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es el alquiler de apartamentos y venta de cerdos, desde hace 8 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive.
Elsy necesita el préstamo para la compra de materiales como cemento, lamina, clavos, arena, varilla, grava y pintura para  mejorar sus apartamentos y seguir realizando esta actividad; la cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que su establecimiento se vea mejor y sea más grande así podrá tener más inquilinos, de esta forma aumentar sus ingresos, y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. Ella espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su establecimiento y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del  2014
texts.en:
Elsy is very hard-working and responsible. She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. Elsy has a business renting out apartments, and selling pigs. She has had the business for eight years, and runs it out of her home.

Elsy needs this loan in order to buy materials such as cement, metal sheeting, nails, sand, metal rods, gravel and paint in order to make improvements to her apartments and continue with her business. Elsy hopes that this loan will help to make a her business bigger and better, and that she will be able to have more tenants. She can then increase her income and, as a result, improve her family's quality of life. In the short term Elsy hopes to expand her business and to continue supporting her family. She wants her children to have the necessary education so that they may have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, metal sheeting, nails, sand, metal rods, gravel and paint in order to make improvements to her apartments.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, desde hace 10 años, la cual funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y lugares cercanos que ella recorre ofreciendo su producto. Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como lociones, cremas, desodorantes, esmaltes, bases, sombras y lápices de ojos para seguir realizando su trabajo; el cual le ayuda mucho ya que las ganancias son de mucha utilidad en el hogar. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten de forma considerable y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes a diario, y gracias a esto espera poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña Maria espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del  2014
texts.en:
María is very hard-working and responsible. She lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. María has had a business selling cosmetics for ten years. She runs the business out of her home, and sells her products in nearby areas.

María needs this loan in order to buy more products, such as lotions, creams, deodorants, nail polish, eye-shadow, eye liner and more so that she may continue with her work. This loan will be very helpful as profits are very useful in her household. María hopes that this loan will result in a significant increase in sales. She hopes that this loan will help her to buy the necessary items to cover customers' daily orders. María wants that this loan in order to improve her quality of life through the increase in income in her household.

In the short term, María hopes to expand her business and to continue support her family. She wants her children to have the necessary education so that they may have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – May 2014

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, deodorants, nail polish, eye-shadow, eye liner and more for her business.

loans.name: Liliana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, menestras, atún, entre otros; asi podrá atender a sus clientes de mejora manera y podrá mejorar sus ingresos.

Liliana trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace un año, también tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de aves domesticas y venta de huevos, lo cual le permite tener una fuente más de ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus dos hijos”.
texts.en:
Liliana is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, selling groceries such as rice, sugar, legumes, tuna, and other things.  This way she will be able to serve her customers in a better way and improve her income.

Liliana has been selling groceries for a year and also has a small poultry raising business and sells eggs.  This provides her with another source of income with which to support her family and her as she strives toward her greatest dream of providing an education to her two children.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, ella se dedica a realizar los quehaceres del hogar se levanta muy temprano para cocinar el desayuno para que sus esposo e hijos tomen los alimentos y se marchen a trabajar.

María desde muy pequeña se a interesado por la agricultura pues ella junto a sus hermanos le ayudaban a su padre, siempre estaba atenta a que la planta del maiz no le llegara maleza y cuando María tiene la oportunidad acompaña a su esposo e hijos a la milpa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar algunos insumos agricolas, como herbicidas y abono porque las plantas de maíz ya necesitan para que se deasarrolle bien el fruto.

El sueño de María es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que no les falte nada, pues ella espera verlos realizados convertidos en profecionales.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and a housewife. She looks after the household chores, waking up very early in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and children to eat and head out to work.

From a young age María has been very interested in farming as, alongside her brothers, she helped their father in his work. María was always helping to plant the corn and to prevent weeks. Now, when María has the opportunity, she accompanies her husband and children to the cornfields.

María needs this loan in order to buy some farming supplies, including weed-killers and manure and the corn crops need them in order to develop well.

María's dream is for her children to continue studying; she wants them not to need for anything. María hopes that her children will learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy weed-killers and manure as her corn crops need them in order to develop well.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is a 42-year-old farmer. She is married with three children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells cocoa from her cocoa plantation to look after her children like any loving mother. She is a hardworking woman who has been in cocoa growing for five years. 

To add to what she harvests from her own plantation, Vick needs a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil and sugar

loans.name: With God Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who work by selling slippers, rice, groceries, yams and macaroni. They have been group mates, repaying loans and maintaining savings for four years. The group members are residents of the Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group's sixth loan would be used to expand their businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities and together they have a solid foundation to guarantee the loan. The members are clear on  collective loan guarantees, how to track their income, and savings. They are empowered, hardworking, and determined women.They will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.
 
Beatrice is the featured borrower. She is 72 years old, a widow, and has one dependent child. All her other children are grown up. Beatrice sells groceries and this loan will enable her to invest in her business. Her 25-year work experience has strengthened her to strategically keep her in business. She is standing on the far left in the photograph. She has received training on problems such as drugs and crime, and also provision of health subsidies.

loans.use: To buy groceries and sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Moises Antonio

texts.es: Moisés de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia desde hace 15 años, junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos (de 15,10, 9 años de edad y el último de 2 meses de edad). Moisés tiene 11 años de dedicarse a la fontanería, albañilería y en algunas circunstancia ha tenido que trabajar de motorista en unidades de transporte público. Moisés ha mostrado ser un padre responsable y hombre trabajador, tres hijos están estudiando en una escuela pública. La compañera de vida de Moisés tiene algunos años de haber instalado un puesto de venta en un mercado cercano a su vivienda. La vivienda de Moisés y su familia es de bahareque, él sabe que tiene muchas mejoras que realizarse, pero en este momento Moisés necesita introducir el agua potable en su vivienda. Por lo anterior Moisés ha solicitado un crédito a FUSAI para comprar toda la tubería para agua potable, construir una pila para almacenar el agua y además comprará el cemento, la arena para comenzar a repellar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en: Moisés is 31 years old and has lived in his own house for 15 years together with his life companion and his four children (a two month old and 9, 10 and 15 years old). Moisés has been working for 11 years as a plumber, a bricklayer and on occasion has had to work as a driver for public transportation units. Moisés has proved himself to be a responsible father and a hard-worker. Three of his children are studying in public schools. His life companion has had a stall at the market close to their house for a number of years. The house of Moisés and his family is made of mud and wattle. He realizes that he has many improvements to make. But for the moment Moisés wants to install running water in his house. For this reason Moisés has requested a loan from FUSAI to buy all the tubing he needs for running water, to build a water stand to store the water and to buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.use: to buy tubing for running water, build a water stand and buy cement and sand to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to attend to her coffee crops in this new season.

loans.name: Grisel Rocio

texts.es:
Grisel es una comerciante de venta de zapatillas tiene 41 años de edad, 2 hijos y vive con su pareja desde hace 20 años, nunca se casó porque dice: ¨con el trabajo y los hijos no hay tiempo para nada¨ ama a su familia y siempre está pendiente de que nunca les falte nada. Su jornada comienza a las 5:30am se levanta prepara la comida el almuerzo para toda la familia también deja todo listo para el desayuno, y a las 7:30 am se dirige a su lugar de trabajo acompañada de su bebe de un año de edad. Grisel sueña con tener una casa propia y piensa que dentro de un par de años lo logrará, ella busca un futuro mejor para su familia y entiende que ampliando su negocio logrará mejorar sus ingresos ¨quiero comprar más y nueva mercadería porque la competencia es grande¨.
Es por ayudar a su familia que Grisel solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatillas por mayor.
texts.en:
Grisel is a businesswoman in shoe sales. She is 41 years old with two children and lives with her partner of 20 years. She says she never married because "with work and children there is no time for anything." She loves her family and is always attentive that no one ever is lacking anything.

 Her day begins at 5:30 am; she gets up and prepares lunch for the entire family and also leaves everything ready for breakfast. At 7:30 am she is directed to her place of work, accompanied by her one year old baby. 

Grisel dreams of having her own house and thinks that within a couple of years she will accomplish it. She is looking for a better future for her family and understands that expanding her business will accomplish improving her income. She says that she wants to buy more and new merchandise because the competition is high.

It is to help her family that Grisel is requesting the loan to buy bulk shoes.

loans.use: to buy bulk footwear.

loans.name: Carla Selena

texts.es: Carla es una estudiante universitaria tiene 18 años de edad y es soltera, es la mayor de 6 hermanos, siempre desde muy niña se encargó de cuidar a sus hermanos, los lavaba les daba de comer y les ayudaba con las tareas del colegio;¨soy como la segunda madre de mis hermanos, yo siempre me encargaba de ellos¨  junto a sus hermano ayuda a su madre en la elaboración de comida para la venta diaria, al principio Carla ayudaba en la cocina y cuidaba a sus hermanos, a media que sus hermanos crecieron estos fueron ayudando a su madre y así Carla tuvo tiempo para estudiar, Carla no tiene libros y estudia mucho en la biblioteca porque no tiene dinero para comprarlos pero  eso no afecta su interés por sus estudios, ella sueña con salir de la cocina y tener su negocio propio, en este momento se encuentra finalizando sus estudios y necesita un préstamo para pagar sus cuotas mensuales .
texts.en:
Carla, age 18, is a university student.  She is single, and she is the oldest of six siblings.  Starting when she was very young, she always took charge of her siblings.  She bathed them and fed them, and she helped them with their homework.  “I am the second mother to my siblings.  I always took care of them”.  Together with her siblings, she helps her mother make the food to sell every day.

In the beginning, Carla helped in the kitchen and took care of her siblings.  As her siblings got older, they were the ones who helped her mother.  This way Carla had time to go to school.  Carla does not have books.  She studies a lot at the library because she does not have money to buy them.  However, this does not affect her interest in her education.  She dreams of getting out of the kitchen and having her own business.  She is now completing her studies, and she needs a loan in order to make the monthly payments.
.

loans.use: to make the monthly payments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
