Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sayda es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frazadas, venta de comida, venta de cerveza, venta de medias, venta de ropa de bebe, elaboración de viguetas, venta de bayetas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sayda es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de útiles escolares; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio hace tres años al observa el amplio comercio que tiene los mismos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuadernos y hojas por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión de grupo y los ahorros que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "Focal de Villa Adela" communal bank is made up of eight members and overseen by a board of directors, of which señora Sayda is the secretary.  The members' businesses are varied and include: selling blankets, food sales, beer sales, selling stockings, selling babies' clothing, joist fabrication and selling cleaning cloths.  

The loan they are taking out will benefits small, micro-entrepreneurs, of which señora Sayda is one.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago at the invitation of a friend, who is a member of the institution.  Señora Sayda currently has a business selling school supplies.  She says that she started selling these products three years ago after noticing the wide sales that they generate. 
 
The loan señora Sayda is taking out is for increasing her capital (purchasing wholesale notebooks and paper).  She will acquire the items in the markets in La Paz and later sell them from her sales stall.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has four children.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, señora Sayda responds that she likes the group meetings and the savings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en:
Soeung is 59 years old. She is a married woman with four children, living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a homemaker, her husband is a former government officer, and her three children are employed. All of them can earn approximately USD 27.50 per day. 

Now, Soeung would like to apply for loan of USD 1,500 to buy roofing tiles to renovate her house. 

In the future, Soeung hopes that she can open a tailor shop for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy roofing tiles to renovate her house.

loans.name: Flor De Papitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE PAPITAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Inés es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pizza, venta de humintas, venta de salchipapas, venta de videos, venta de café y jugos, venta de ropa, imprenta, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Inés es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de anticuchos (comida tradicional boliviana); da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio hace varios años, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, donde ella apoyaba, con el pasar del tiempo decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la Ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el crédito sin ahorro inicial que le ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The group "Flor de Papitas" will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela focal center.   The group has nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Ines is president.  The members run various businesses including pizza sales, humintas sales, salchipapas sales, video sales, coffee and juice sales, clothing sales, printing, and sale of cosmetics.  

The loan they will receive will help small businesses of this group Ines has joined.  Ines joined Pro Mujer a year ago, having been invited to join by a friend who is a member.  Now she has a business selling anticuchos (traditional Bolivian food).  Ines says she began selling this product several years ago.  Because she knew how to do this, having assisted in a family business, after a while she decided to begin her own business.

The loan Ines will receive now is to increase her stock (purchase of potatoes in bulk) at the fairs in the city of La Paz.  After preparing them she will sell them in her business place.    

Asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Ines answers that she is happy that the institution offers this loan without a person having to save money in advance.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in bulk

loans.name: 6 De Junio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE JUNIO” iniciará el trigésimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olimpia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de cosméticos, venta de pan, venta de ropa, servicio de cafetería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olimpia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  servicio de cafetería; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años al observar que en mercado donde vendía no existía una persona que diera este servicio y existía amplio requerimiento. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de azúcar por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “6 DE JUNIO” communal bank is beginning its thirty third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Senkata. It is made up of nine members and is directed by a board of directors where señora Olimpia is President. The businesses which the communal bank's members are taking forward are various, including: food sales, cosmetics sales, bread sales, clothing sales, and cafeteria services.

The loan which they are applying for will benefit small micro businesses, where Olimpia is a member. She explains that she has been part of Pro Mujer for five years, joining after the invitation of a neighbour who is a member of the organisation. She currently has a cafeteria service business, which she implemented several years ago when she observed that there was a gap in the market for this service, and that a large demand existed. 
 
The loan which she is applying for is for increasing capital (wholesale purchase of sugar) that she will acquire from the El Alto city fairs and later sell through client orders. This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the healthcare and training that the organisation offers.

loans.use: to buy sugar wholesale.

loans.name: El Shaman Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias, coordinado por la señora Rosa, mujer laboriosa de 43 años de edad y acompañada, se dedica a comercializar cosméticos AVON y Zermat y ropa de segunda a los pobladores de su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace tres años cuando su compañero de vida le dio parte de sus ingresos para que ella impulsara su negocio, en la actualidad solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como paca de calidad de jeans, vestidos, blusas, así mismo invertirá en cremas corporales, creas para manos, perfumes de damas y caballeros, etc. Las otras socias son las señoras Eveling de 26 años propietaria de una mini pulpería y venta de ropa de segunda en su domicilio y de manera ambulante, Pastorade 51 años es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace más de un año, y Miriam de 59 años es comerciante y vende ropa de segunda a los pobladores de su comunidad.
texts.en: This solidarity group has four members. It is coordinated by Rosa, an industrious woman of 43 years of age and married. She sells AVON cosmetics and second-hand clothing to the residents of her community. What prompted her to begin this business was her life partner giving her part of his income three years ago so that she could start her business. Now she is requesting a loan to buy bales of merchandise like quality jeans, dresses, blouses, and also to invest in body creams, hand creams, perfumes for men and women, and more. The other members are Eveling of 26 years of age, owner of a mini store and seller of second-hand clothing in her home and as a street vendor, Pastora of 51 years of age who owns a grocery store in her home for more than a year, and Miriam of 59 years of age, is dealer of used clothing to the people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Irenge Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamandwa est une brave commerçante et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires «Irenge», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants, dont 5 étudient et sont encore gosses. La cliente est vendeuse divers articles de friperie. Elle installe sa marchandise au marché de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un infirmier. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 1 an qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 40 chemises, 5 pantalons. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: The client, Kamandwa, is a courageous vendor and a member of the Irenge business platform. A dynamic entrepreneur, this 39-year-old woman is a married mother to seven children, five of which are still children currently receiving an education. She works as a vendor of second-hand clothing, which she sells at the town market. She started this business with some initial capital given to her by her husband, who works as a nurse. Later on, she benefited from a loan from IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for one year. This new loan will allow her to purchase 40 shirts and five pairs of trousers. With this loan, she hopes to be able to grow her capital and feed and clothe her children, as well as send them to school. She would like to thank Hekima for the work they do to liberate women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase 40 shirts and five pairs of trousers

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Sokhoeun is 54 years old. She is a married woman of three children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she sells dried freshwater clams and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $5.50 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to buy bean sprouts to sell for profit. In the future, she hopes that she can plant the bean sprouts and expand her business selling bean sprouts.

loans.use: To buy bean sprouts to sell for profit

loans.name: Chamraeun

texts.en: Chamraeun is 40 years old. She is a widow who has three children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker and her two children are garment factory workers. They earn approximately $8 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of 1,000 USD to purchase timber and pillars to build a house. In the future, she hopes that she can buy a sewing machine to open a small tailoring shop at home.

loans.use: To purchase timber and pillars to build a house

loans.name: Geison Andony

texts.es:
Gesison esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de bebidas, ya que comprara cervezas, gaseosas al por mayor, tambien podrá mejorar el pequeño local, como refacción de paredes, mejora de fachada, entre otros; con lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y la atención a sus clientes.

Geison viene trabajando en su negocio desde hace 2 años, el cual inicio con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, ya que su gran sueño es :” Tener un video pub, estudiar una carrera universitaria y apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Gesison is very thankful to the lenders at Kiva because thanks to their help he will be able to purchase more merchandise for his business where he sells refreshments like beer and soda. He will also be able to make improvements to his locale like re-finishing the walls, improving the facade, etc. This will help him to improve his earnings and attract the attention of potential customers. 

Geison has been working in his business for 2 years, which required hard work and determination. His biggest dream is: "To have a pub with televisions, go to university and support his family."

loans.use: purchase sodas and beer.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo esta agradecido con los prestamisats kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá comprar materiales para poder terminar de construir su vivienda como calaminas, cemento, ventanas de fierro, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá un mejor lugar donde vivir para su familia.

Guillermo trabaja como cuidador en una parcela, el se encarga del cuidado, el sembrio y la cosecha del cultivo, con lo cual puede obtener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder seguir luchando en hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener un negocio propio en su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Guillermo is thankful to the lenders at Kiva because it is thanks to their help that he will be able to purchase materials in order to finish building his home like corrugated iron, cement, window bars etc. This will help him to have a better place to live with his family. 

Guillermo works as an overseer and is in charge of the care, planting, and harvesting of the crops. This will help him to earn more income and to keep up with household costs and will be able to continue fighting to realize his biggest dream: "Have a his own business run out of his home."

loans.use: purchase materials like iron, cement etc.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es:
Día a día, con ánimo rebosante y alegre, trabaja Jairo. Es un hombre dinámico y luchador, quién se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, también vende productos de aluminio y tiene una pequeña pulpería. Sobresale en cada uno de sus negocios, anhela mantener a su clientela contenta para incrementar sus ganancias. Tiene 36 años de edad,  está casado y tiene tres hijos. Hace 13 años inicio su negocio, asegura que fue todo un  reto pues contaba con poco capital, pero ha logrado su objetivo, mantener varios trabajos para brindarle a su familia salud y educación de calidad.  
Jairo solicita otro crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, quiere invertir tanto en la pulpería como en la siembra de maíz, necesita comprar granos básicos, pan, refrescos, productos de limpieza, asimismo, abono, fertilizantes y la semilla. Él está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento de KIVA  a través de MiCrédito, con el que logro crecer su negocio, expresa que sin el apoyo de su familia no hubiese  sido posible y son ellos por los que a diario lucha, anhela brindarles un futuro próspero. Su meta es mejorar las condiciones se su local y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Jairo works every day brimming with good spirits and joy.  He is a dynamic and determined man who works planting corn and beans.  He also sells aluminum products and has a small store.  He excels in each one of his businesses.  He aspires to keep his customers happy in order to increase his earnings.  He is 36 years old, married and he has three children.  He started his business 13 years ago.  He says that it was a challenge as he had little capital but he has achieved his objective, maintaining multiple jobs in order to provide his family with good health and quality education.  

Jairo is requesting another loan in order to increase the production of his capital.  He wants to invest as much in the store as in planting corn.  He needs to buy basic grains, bread, soft drinks and cleaning products, as well as manure, fertilizers and seeds.  He is very grateful for the first financing from Kiva through MiCrédito, with which he managed to grow his business.  He says that without the support of his family it wouldn’t have been possible and they are who he fights for on a daily basis.  He wants to provide them a prosperous future.  His goal is to improve the conditions of his store and keep growing.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, bread, soft drinks and cleaning products, as well as manure, fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Yessenia

texts.es:
Yessenia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada pod´ra compra mercadería para su negocio de venta de bebidas, Yessenia comprara paquetes de gaseosas de varios sabores, cervezas, entre otras; así podrá mejorar la atención a sus clientes, mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos; así podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Hacer crecer su negocio y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.

Yessenia trabaja en su negocio de venta de de bebidas desde hace 2 años, para lo cual tuvo que ahorrar mucho, actualmente su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Yessenia is thankful to the lender at Kiva because it is thanks to their support that she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business where she sells refreshments. Yessenia will purchase various sodas, beer and more. This will help her to attract the attention of more potential customers, improve her sales and increase her income. She will be able to continue working and fighting to be able to realize her biggest dream; "To grow her business and give a good education to her children. "

Yessenia opened her business 2 years ago, and she had to save a lot of money to do so. Currently, her business is her only source of income and only way to get her family ahead.

loans.use: purchase sodas and beer.

loans.name: Kuntha

texts.en: Kuntha is 45 years old. She is a married woman of one child in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She is a worker at a drinking water factory, her husband is a construction foreman and her child is a security guard at the factory. Together they earn approximately 12.60 USD per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of 1,000 USD to buy a tuk-tuk (auto rickshaw) to provide transportation service to clients. This loan will help her family make more income.

loans.use: To buy an auto rickshaw to provide transportation service to clients

loans.name: Chanen

texts.en:
Chanen is 36 years old. She is a married woman with two children, living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She runs a grocery retail store and her husband is a farmer and a palm tree-climbing man. Both of them can earn approximately USD 10.5 per day. 

Now, Chanen would like to apply for loan of USD 1,000 to buy timbers to renovate her house. 

In the future, she hopes that her business can be expanded and her children can earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy timbers to renovate her house.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: El señor Eugenio y su esposa Dominga, tienen 41 y 36 años de edad, respectivamente, de estado civil convivientes por más de 10 años, económicamente son independientes, ambos se dedican a la agricultura. Siembra en terreno de 5 Has herencia de sus padres, produce papa, papaliza y haba, con rotación de cultivos con experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 4 de engorde y 3 lecheras. Actualmente requiere el crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno (1 yunta), ya que sus ahorros los invirtió en la compra de ganado vacuno de engorde y lecheras, esta sería una buena oportunidad para incrementar su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Eugenio and his wife, Dominga, are 41 and 36 respectively, and have been living together for over 10 years. They are economically independent and both work in agriculture. Eugenio sows a plot of 5 hectares, land which was passed down from his parents. He has experience of growing potatoes, "papalizas" (a sort of tuber) and beans, which he crop-rotates. In addition, he has some cattle: 4 animals for fattening and 3 dairy cows.

He currently needs a loan to buy cows (1 pair), since he invested his savings into buying fattening animals and dairy cows. This would be good opportunity to increase his assets.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en: Soklim is 31 years old. She is a married woman with three children in Odong, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She and her husband are factory workers. Together they earn approximately 12 USD per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of 1,200 USD to buy timber to build a house. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that her children can earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a house

loans.name: Rosalío

texts.es:
Rosalío es un joven, casado, 27 años de edad, tiene una hermosa familia y fruto de ello tiene 4 hijos (2 varones y dos niñas); vive junto a ellos en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente cultivo de cebolla y zanahoria; este digno trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive. Se dedica a ello porque lo ha aprendido de sus padres y con ello genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 10 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Comenta que tiene una familia muy unida porque su pareja aporta al presupuesto familiar generando ingresos a través de la elaboración y venta de ropa típica.
Rosalío está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,500.00 para la compra de semilla de cebolla y zanahoria.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalío, 27, is married and has 4 beautiful children, 2 girls and 2 boys.  The family lives in Sololá.  
Rosolio has a farming business that he has operated for 10 years in the small rural town where he lives.  He grows onions and carrots.  He learned farming from his parents and his knowledge of this hard, decent work provides a steady income for his own family.  Rosalio says that he and his wife are a team: She has a business making and selling traditional clothing and their combined income covers their expenses.
Rosalia is applying for a Q5,500 loan that he will use to buy supplies for growing onions and carrots.
For the future, he wants to improve his house and provide a better quality of life for his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Sopheavy

texts.en: Sopheavy is 40 years old. She is a married woman with three children in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She is a teacher and her husband is a factory worker. Together they earn approximately 13 USD per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of 1,200 USD to purchase steel, cement and metal net to build a gate. In the future, she hopes that she can buy farmland to grow rice.

loans.use: To purchase steel, cement and metal net to build a gate

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 40 years old, widowed, and has two children. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Ly sells coffee and drinks and earns approximately $11.60 per day. One of her children is employed and earns approximately $4 per day. 

Ly requested a loan for $1,000, which she will use to buy land for building a house for her children. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and her last child can earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase land for building a house for her children

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon is 44 years old, widowed, and has three children, two of whom are employed. She lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery store. She and her children earn approximately $20 per day. 

Thon requested a loan for $1,000, which she will use to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her children arrive at their workplace on time. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her grocery store and her last child can receive a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sengky

texts.en:
Sengky is 41 years old. She is a widow with one child, living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a teacher and earns approximately USD 5 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of USD 500 to purchase dirt to fill her land. This loan will prevent her house from flooding. 

In the future, she hopes that she can build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase dirt to fill her land in order to prevent her house from flooding.

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en:
Israfil was born in 1965; he has been married, and has lovely children and a family. He has a lovely job, which is developing day by day.

 Israfil previously took loans from Kiva three times, and all were paid on time.  In other words he had a positive credit history. 

Today he again needs help to support his business.  Israfil needs 1,200 Azerbaijan New Manat. With this loan he wants to buy more cows instead of selling animals. 

Israfil is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for repeated help.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 58 years old. She is a widow with five children, living in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in selling dried fish since 2000 and earns approximately USD 2 per day. Four of her children are employed and earn approximately USD 9 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of USD 1,500 to purchase a motorbike to provide services to clients. 

In the future, she hopes that her last child can get a high school diploma.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to provide services to clients.

loans.name: Iris Carolina

texts.es:
Iris esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su salón de belleza como pintado, compra de utensilios como tijeras, tintes, cepillos, entre otros de esta manera podrá dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

Iris trabaja en su pequeño negocio de peluquería y salón de belleza, con el cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella se esfuerza mucho para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener un gran spa”.
texts.en:
Iris is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Because of their help she was able to make improvements to her beauty salon, such as painting, buying utensils like scissors, tints, brushes, and other things so she can provide better service to her customers.

Iris works her small hair salon business which provides her an income to cover her household expenses and get her children ahead.  She strives to make her greatest dream a reality, “To provide her children with a profession and to have a grand spa.”

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Emma Asuzena

texts.es:
La señora EMMA de 30  años  de edad vive con conyugue y sus 2 hijos, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en la parte sur del país, se dedica desde hace 5 años al negocio del reciclaje en lo que recolecta en su vehículo de lunes a domingo el bote de plástico que se encuentra en la orilla de las carreteras en los basureros públicos y casas entre otros.
Doña EMMA junto con su conyugue, transportan el producto en su carro, cuenta con maquina prensadora para hacer las pacas para luego venderlas a una fábrica de trasformación de la materia, doña Emma es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante.
Ella está solicitando el préstamo para compra de pintura para pintar un vehículo en el cual transportara el negocio, y comprara 14,000 libras de hierro para venderlas, es un cliente nuevo, que desea trabajar con Prisma y KIVA. 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa ya que actualmente renta donde vive.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Emma, 30, lives with her spouse and her two children at home in the southern part of the country.  For five years she has made a living with a recycling business.  Using her vehicle from Monday to Sunday, she collects plastic bottles that she finds along the side of roads and in public and household trash cans, among other places.  Together with her spouse, Doña Emma transports the product in her car and relies on a cutting press machine to make the bundles so that she can later sell them to a factory that transforms the material.  

Doña Emma is an enterprising woman with a desire to be successful in life.  She is asking for a loan to buy paint so she can paint the vehicle that she uses for the business, and to buy 14,000 pounds of scrap metal to sell.  She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma and Kiva.  Her dream is to have her own house since she rents the one in which she now lives.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014

loans.use: to buy vehicle paint and 14,000 pounds of scrap metal for her business.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo Tania podrá comprar mercadería como artículos de aseo personal como jabones, pasta delntal, maquinas de afeitar, shampoo, entre otros, también comprara insumos para la elaboración de chupetes, gelatina y gaseosas al por mayor, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejora atención y mejorar su ingresos.

Tania traba en este pequeño negocio desde hace 3 años,  su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, ya que es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son menores de edad y están en etapa escolar. Tania se esfuerza mucho cada día porque su gran sueño es:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder Ampliar su negocio para bienestar de su familia”.
texts.en:
Tania says that she is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.  She will use the loan to stock her retail business with soap, toothpaste, shaving supplies, shampoo and other merchandise.  She will also buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks and ingredients for making snacks.  The investment will allow her to stock her business and provide a better service to her customers.

Tania has operated her small business for 3 years.  It is her only source of income and her only way of supporting her family.  She has 3 children, all still in school.  Tania works hard every day to meet her great goal of "giving my children a good education and growing my business for the good of my family".

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Samwel. The father of four is a mixed farmer in Litein where he lives together with his wife and children on a small piece of land. He is a very passionate farmer who has been practicing agriculture for the last five years. He makes money selling milk, eggs, tea and vegetables. Samwel loves feeding his animals. However, his biggest challenge is taking care of sick animals. Samwel is always eager to learn and gain knowledge on how he can improve his dairy farming and animal health. He has always made a point to attend trainings and seminars.

Samwel is seeking your help to purchase a quality grade dairy cow. This cow will produce 15 to 20 litres of milk every day that  would be sold into the local market. Money from milk sales is enough to guarantee timely repayments of the outstanding loan. Additional income from this dairy cow will be channeled to meet his high farming-related expenses and  other family needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa, esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo ella pueda comprar mercadería como gaseosas, abarrotes, cervezas, e implementar mejor su negocio de venta de bebidas y comidas típicas de su ciudad.

Julissas con su humilde negocio puede tener ingresos para poder solventar los gastos de su familia, sobre todo porque tiene 3 hijos de 13,10 y 5 años; Julissa se esfuerzas mucho ya que ella desea hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local más grande y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Julissa says that she is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support and that she will use this loan to buy soft drinks, beer and other merchandise for her grocery business.  The investment will help her grow her sales of beverages and the traditional foods that she makes and sells.

The business supports her family.  She has 3 children:13-, 10-, and 5-years old, respectively.  Julissa is working hard to meet her great goals of "having a larger store and giving my children a good education".

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, a mother of four, has been a mixed farmer for 30 years! She lives together with her family in Kericho, Kenya. Her primary income sources are eggs and tea produced at her farm. She enjoys poultry-keeping above all else. Her biggest challenge is the prohibitive cost of purchasing poultry feed. 

Susan has been to various financial and agricultural training sessions. She came to appreciate loans as stepping stones to success.  Mary looks for loan providers with favourable interest terms such as Juhudi Kilimo that will not strain her: She is already encountering high farm input expenses. 

Susan is seeking a loan from KIVA lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. This will expand the poultry operation she has going and generate more income to repay the loan. The family will enjoy increased income once the loan is fully serviced.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Santos Irma

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 45 años de edad,  es una señora muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación, se dedica a los oficios domésticos ayudando a su madre con los oficios del hogar. 
Actualmente, vive en la casa de su mamá junto con su hijo de 1 año de edad, ya que su compañero de vida la abandono y le toca hacer los gastos de su hijo sola. 

Santos se dedica a los oficios domésticos en la casa de su madre, como: cocinar, lavar y planchar. Además,  lleva el almuerzo a los mosos, al lugar de trabajo para que le ayuden a sembrar la milpa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra para cultivar. 
Su sueño es ver a su hijo que estudie y además obtener una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Santos is 45 years old and is a hardworking woman with a desire to succeed.  She is a housewife and helps her mother with the household chores.

She lives with her mother and one year old son, since her husband left her and not she must support her son on her own.

Santos does housework in her mother’s house, such as cleaning, washing and ironing.  She also takes lunch to the local field hands so that they will help her plant her corn field.

She is asking for this loan to buy corn seed, compost, pesticides, herbicides, and pay for field hand labor.

Her dream is for her son to study and graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es una persona muy entusiasta y responsable, está en unión de hecho, tiene 44 años de edad, actualmente tiene 6 hijos; vive junto a su familia en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente cultivo de cebolla y frijol; este digno trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive. Se dedica a ello porque lo ha aprendido de sus padres y con ello genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 8 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Comenta que tiene una familia muy unida porque su pareja aporta al presupuesto familiar generando ingresos a través de la elaboración y venta de ropa típica.
Esteban está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de fertilizante y semilla.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Esteban is a very enthusiastic and responsible person. He is in a common law marriage, he's 44 years old, has six children, and lives together with his family in Sololá. He works in farming, specifically he grows onions and beans. He carries out this worthy work in the community where he lives. He works in this because he learned it from his parents, and with it, he generates necessary income for the support of his family. He has been farming for 8 years. He says that he has a very united family because his wife contributes to the finances, generating income through the making and selling of typical clothes. Esteban is requesting a loan of Q 3,000.00 for the purchase of fertilizer and seeds. His great dream is to remodel is home and so afford his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José es una persona de 32 años de edad, entusiasta y responsable, soltero, actualmente tiene 2 hijos; vive junto a su familia en Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura específicamente cultivo de papa y zanahoria; este trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive (muy cerca de su casa). Se dedica a ello porque lo ha aprendido de sus padres y con ello genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Tiene 10 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Comenta que tiene una familia muy unida porque su pareja aporta al presupuesto familiar generando ingresos a través de la elaboración y venta de ropa típica.
José está solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para la compra de fertilizante.
Su mayor sueño es remodelar su vivienda y asi brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old, enthusiastic, responsible and unmarried. He currently has two children and he lives with his family in Sololá. He makes a living as a farmer, specifically growing potatoes and carrots. 

He works in the community where he lives (very close to his house). He does this job because he learned from his parents and it allows him to make the money needed to support his family. He has been a farmer for 10 years. He mentions that he has a very close family, because his partner contributes to the household finances by producing and selling traditional clothing. 

José is requesting a loan of 7,000.00 Guatemalan Quetzals to buy fertilizer. 

His biggest dream is to remodel his house in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Enrique

texts.es:
Santos de 27 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues tuvo que luchar desde pequeño trabajando en diferentes labores en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles) y ayudante de albañil, sus padres lo abandonaron desde los tres años de edad a un familiar quien lo creció y no pudo estudiar debido a que desde pequeño tuvo que esforzarse para obtener ingresos económicos. Actualmente,  vive solo en su casa elaborada de madera, lámina y nailon que tiene, con esfuerzo ha comprado un terreno donde tiene su casa, vive solo.
Se dedica a trabajar con madera desde hace nueve años, el anduvo trabajando por mucho tiempo de ayudante en una carpintería, donde aprendió muy bien el oficio. Se dedica al negocio de venta de muebles y maderas, pues es una actividad que conoce muy bien y le es rentable.

Antes se dedicaba mayormente a los trabajos de la agricultura, hoy en día también siembra maíz y frijoles para obtener cosechas y así tener alimento para su vida, alquila un terreno de un conocido en la comunidad donde siembra sus cultivos.

Santos solicita un crédito en credicampo,  para la compra de una pulidora, torno, cepillo, lijas, escuadra, una cinta métrica y  otras herramientas para mejorar su pequeño taller, se quedo sin nada debido a que le robaron en el taller varias herramientas que son muy útiles para elaborar muebles.

Además invertirá $350.00 en la agricultura, ya que tiene 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y otros 3,500 de frijoles que necesita darle mantenimiento. Lo que le permitirá trabajar mejor y a la vez asegurar sus alimentos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Santos sueña con hacer su propia casa en el futuro, tiene previsto que dentro de un año podra contar con sus ahorros para iniciar su vivienda por etapas, ya que su casa es insegura debido a que es de madera.
texts.en:
Santos, 27, never had a chance to go to school because he had to start working when he was very young.  His parents abandoned him when he was only three-years old and he was raised by a relative who couldn't easily support him.  He worked as a farm laborer (growing maize and beans) and construction worker.  He managed to buy a small lot with a tiny house and lives there now.

Santos has worked with wood since he was nine years old.  He worked as a carpenter's assistant and has become a skilled carpenter over the years.  He now has a business selling wood and furniture and says that he likes the business because he knows it and can earn a good living.

He was a farm laborer before, growing maize and beans, both to sell and to feed himself.  He still farms and rents land for his crops from an acquaintance.  

Santos is applying for a CrediCampo loan, part of which he will use to buy tools and supplies for his carpentry business.  He has to replace tools and supplies that he had because he was robbed and left without many of the things he needs to carry on his business.

He will use another part of the loan, $350, for his farming business.  He has 3,500 square meters of maize and another 3,500 square meters of beans to maintain.  The investment will make the work more efficient and ensure that he harvests a good crop.

Santos hopes to earn enough to improve his house.  It's not very secure now and he hopes to rebuild it in stages over the next year.

loans.use: to buy tools for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 59-year-old single woman who works from home. She is a hard-working tailor with 30 years of experience that have provided her with great skills and have made her unique clothing designs well known by friends and neighbors. While she makes a steady income from her business, Khadija hopes to increase her sales to keep up with her growing expenses.

She has acquired a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to settle her recent dental fees. As the summer months are approaching, she looks forward to increasing her sales in what is typically her busiest season of the year.

loans.use: To settle her recent dental fees.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 23-year-old single man who's been working as a municipality officer for the last four years. He's the sole breadwinner of a family of four, and his devotion to his family pushed him to quit school at early age in order to provide them with better living conditions. 

Hussein is a hard working employee and his determination pushes him to seek every opportunity in life. He has acquired a youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a car that will help him manage his work tasks more efficiently. 

His passion for cars inspires him to one day open a car accessories shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy a car that will help him manage his work tasks more efficiently

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy barbed wire, posts, and staples to improve his fences.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions, meat, chicken, fish, rice, beans, potatoes, condiments, propane gas, firewood and pastries, among other items.

loans.name: Ledi

texts.en: Ledi is a 26-year-old married woman from a small village in Akhaltsikhe district. Ledi lives with her large family; her husband and four children. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and haricot. Ledi and her husband work hard to insure a good harvest. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. Ledi decided to start a husbandry business along these agricultural activities. She requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3,000 GEL to purchase a cow. When the cow is purchased, Ledi will milk the cow every day and will produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income she will be able to improve the living conditions for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 51 years old, divorced, and has one son and daughter-in-law, who is a housekeeper. She lives in Tbilisi city. Rusudan and her son work hard for their family's welfare. They are hired employees at a traditional Georgian bakery and earn approximately 300-300 GEL a month. This income is not enough for covering all their daily expenses and Rusudan plans to start a food production business. 

Rusudan requested a loan for $700, which she will use to purchase all needed merchandise to start making meals to sell from her house. She is a good cook and will have her own loyal costumers. This new business will greatly assist Rusudan, as she will be able to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase all needed merchandise to start making meals to sell from her house

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina de 67 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 43 y 35 años de edad quienes ya tienen sus propias familias, en su casa vive con su esposo quien trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de granos básicos), ella está a cargo de dos nietos quienes trabajan de jornaleros en diferentes trabajos en la comunidad. 
No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que sus padres murieron cuando ella apenas tenía trece años y había el conflicto armado en el país.
Marcelina se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales desde cuando ella tenía trece años de edad cuando sus padres murieron, a prendió gracias a una amiga que le enseño el oficio. Desde entonces vende de dos a cuatro veces a la semana. También desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y pollos de engorde. 
Tuvo que aprender debido a que era la mayor de sus cinco hermanos y desde entonces Marcelina trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a sus nieto de quien esta al cuido. Cuando ella sale a vender tamales y pan su esposo le ayuda con el cuido de los cerdos y de los pollos.
Marcelina solicita un crédito en credicampo para la compra de tres cerdos, cien pollos de engorde, harinilla, concentrado, maíz y demás tratamientos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, para obtener ingresos económicos, que le serán de ayuda para sostener a la familia.
Marcelina sueña con comprar un terrenito propio para en el futuro hacer su propia casa donde poder darles a sus nietos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 67, has two grown children, both with families of their own.  Her husband is a farmer and they live with two grandchildren who work as day laborers.  

Marcelina never had a chance to go to school.  Her parents died during the country's civil war when she was barely thirteen years old and she had to go to work to support herself.  A friend helped her start a business selling bread and tamales.  She has operated the business ever since, working two to four days a week.  She also raises pigs, work that she's been doing since she was only five years old.   She was the oldest of six children and her parents needed her help as soon as she was able.  She still raises pigs and her income from the business helps support her grandchildren.  Her husband helps her with the pigs on the days that she goes out to sell bread and tamales.  

Marcelina is applying for a CrediCampo loan that she will use to buy three pigs, 100 chickens and the supplies that she needs to fatten them for market.  When the animals are ready for sale, she will sell them for the money she needs to help support her family.  

Marcelina would like to build a small house in the future and give her grandchildren a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed for her animals-sales business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La señora Esther vive en la población de Entre rios en una casa alquilada, tiene 22 años radico la mayor parte de su vida en el trópico y en especial en ese municipio, estudio hasta el grado de bachiller, es una persona muy responsable y humilde, tiene el sueño de tener su casa propia para poder habitar en ella y dejar de pagar alquiler, por lo cual trabajo mucho sin importar el oficio en el que pudiera desenvolverse, actualmente trabaja en dos instituciones como encargada de limpieza gracias a ese esfuerzo pudo realizar la compra de un lote urbano en su población, ahora solicita un crédito para la construcción de su vivienda, de esta forma podrá vivir más cómoda.
texts.en: Esther lives in a rented house within the Entre Rios settlement.  She is 22 years old and has lived most of her life in the tropics, and especially in this town.  She has a high school education and is a responsible and humble person with a dream of someday having a home of her own where she can reside without having to pay rent.  She does whatever work she can and currently does cleaning for institutions.  Thanks to this effort, she was able to buy a lot and is now asking for a loan so she can build her house and be able to live comfortably.

loans.use: to build her home.

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is 40 years old and has children. He is a fish monger who has been in the business since 2000. Hashim used the previous loan to purchase fish to sell since it is the main food in the area and is always on high demand. He is faced with the problem of people not paying on time and high license fees. 

Hashim requested another loan, which he will to use to buy fish to sell. He wishes to educate his children and complete his residential house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 25-year-old female, married with one child. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden and works for 12 hours a day. She has been practicing this business for five years and sells her cocoa to people around her area. She dreams of expanding her garden by planting more cocoa on a lager scale. This will help her to fetch a higher profit because of high demand in the area. Though faced with a problem of seasonal changes, Harriet needs a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Isayana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Todos los días, a primera hora,  después de haber limpiado y ordenado cada uno de los productos, está lista para abrir su pulpería, es una mujer trabajadora y amable, quién día a día gana más clientela por la excelente atención que ofrece a sus clientes. Tiene 44 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo. 17 años son los que ha trabajado arduamente, inicio cuando su suegra le dejo en sus manos la venta de gas, año con año ha buscado la manera de incrementar los productos,  con el apoyo de su familia lo ha logrado.
Isayana solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar carne, pollo, granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; condimentos, productos de limpieza, entre otros. Una de sus metas es crecer en el negocio, ganar más clientela, incrementar las ventas y mejorar las condiciones de su pulpería, pero la difícil situación económica no se lo permite, es por ello que deposita su confianza en el financiamiento. Asimismo quiere bridarle a su familia salud y educación de calidad, por lo que día a día seguirá luchando.
texts.en:
Everyday, in the early hours, after she has cleaned and organized every one of the products, she is ready to open her store. She is a hard-working and friendly woman, who day after day gains more clients due to the excellent service she gives them. She is 44 years old, married, and has one son. She has worked hard for 17 years. She started when her mother-in-law left the sale of gas in her hands. Year after year she has sought a way to increase her product line. With the help of her family she has achieved it.
Isayana requests a loan to increase her production of capital. She needs to buy meat, chicken, basic grains like rice and beans, condiments, cleaning products, amongst other things. One of her goals is to make her business grow, gain more clients, increase sales and better the conditions of her store. But the difficult economic situation does not allow her to. It is for this reason that she puts her confidence in financing. All the same, she wants to offer her family health and quality education which is what she continues to struggle for day after day.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, basic grains like rice and beans, condiments, cleaning products, amongst other things.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is 57 years old. She lives in a small village in Vani district. She has a small yard, where she grows nut trees and sells harvested nuts locally. In addition to this business, she trades in cheese. She purchases cheese from the villagers and resells it with a higher price in different villages. Liana decided to purchase a cow and start producing cheese products. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2200 GEL to purchase a cow. After the cow is purchased, she will produce cheese and sell it. She will reinvest the income in the business and will purchase a second cow with the profits. Liana is a very motivated and hardworking woman and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a 32-year-old, married female with six children, of whom four go to school. 

She is dealing in a retail business, living in Kasese, Uganda. She began her business to have a source of income. Racheal hopes to educate her children, however, debts and inflation are challenges being faced. 

Racheal is a hard-working woman and appreciates services offered. She needs a loan to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en: Brian is a twenty-four-year-old single male who has been in the retail business for five years. He is  located in a rural area and works six days a week and six hours a day. Brian hopes to expand his business; however, inadequate capital is a challenge being faced. Brian is a hardworking man who is requesting a loan to buy bread and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy bread and soda to sell.

loans.name: Baloon Bay Group

texts.en:
This group is Baloon Bay group, and it consists of five ladies who live in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. They applied for a loan amount of 4,200 GHS to invest in their businesses that include the sale of porridge, second-hand clothing, underwear, cooked rice and stew, fried yam and chicken, groceries, sachet water, and waakye (cooked rice and beans).
 
Regina is a hardworking woman. She is a 49-year-old married woman with three dependent children and lives with her family in Teshie. She is the featured borrower in this group. Regina studied through elementary school, but she couldn't complete her studies. Regina started her business selling groceries, sachet water, and waakye (cooked rice and beans) more than eight years ago. She sells at her residence. She started her business with a small amount of working capital, thanks to the assistance of her husband who supported her financially. Year over year her business has improved, but most of what she earns in profits goes to the expenses of the family and savings. She has good experience in this business. Unfortunately, the income of this business is not enough to expand her business, and she wants to improve it. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 1,200 GHS from ID Ghana in order to purchase more groceries, sachet water, rice, and beans to sell to her customers. Regina looks forward to expanding her business more in order to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, sachet water, rice and beans

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is a 38-year-old divorced woman who takes care of her two children alone. They live in Tbilisi city. Ekaterine works as a private cleaner and has a small income that isn't enough for her children's welfare. They can't satisfy even basic needs. The borrower has a great desire to have financial stability and better living conditions for her family. Ekaterine requested a loan and was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She will use this mentioned loan to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then sell them among her community door-to-door. The work will be hard for Ekaterine, but she is so motivated somehow to improve her children's style of living that she will do everything. Ekaterine awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a trading business in clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spares for car servicing which include battery water, plugs, HT cables, engine oil, petrol pumps, oil filters

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase children's used clothes.

loans.name: Bethel School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Ronald. He is the Head Teacher of Bethel Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 147 students. Bethel Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bethel Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Ronald ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells sweet bananas and sweet potatoes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of sweet bananas and sweet potatoes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build rental houses. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy sweet bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: St.john's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Godfrey. He is the Head Teacher of St. John’s Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 200 students. St. John’s Nursery and Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. John’s Nursery and Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Godfrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy underwear, diapers, cream, powder, soap, etc.

loans.name: St.kizito School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joseph. He is the Head Teacher of St. Kizito Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo in Wakiso with 462 students. St. Kizito Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Kizito Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Joseph ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Nkumba School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Rehema. She is the Head Teacher of Nkumba Junior School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Nkumba in Wakiso with 270 students. Nkumba Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nkumba Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Rehema ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Garden School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Liton. He is the Head Teacher of Garden Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Entebbe in Wakiso with 130 students. Garden Nursery and Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Garden Nursery and Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Liton ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, quarry stone, sand, gravel, and iron for the latrine and two walls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Gildren Maria

texts.es: Gildren es una persona de buenas costumbres, en la actualidad se dedica a la Comercialización de Ropa, Zapatos y otros productos de uso personal. Su familia compuesta por su esposo quien es albañil y sus 4 hijos de los cuales tres son mayores solo el menor depende de ella y estudia.  en conjunto con su esposo y sacrificios propios han venido levantando las paredes de su vivienda aprovechando que tiene el solar que le dio su padre.  A pesar que los dos ganan y trabajan en conjunto no alcanzaron terminar con su proyección de la vivienda por lo que necesita créditos para comprar Zing, Perlines Clavos y pagar mano de obra, es de suma importancia tener el techo en su vivienda antes que caiga el inverno para evitar mojarse y así contar con un local digno de habitar.
texts.en:
Gildren is a good person. She currently works selling clothing, shoes and other personal use items.

Her family is made up of her husband, who works in construction, and her four children, three of whom are adults. Her youngest is a student and is her dependent.

Gildren and her husband have sacrificed to build the walls of their home, taking advantage of the land given to them by her father.

Even though both Gildren and her husband work, they have not been able to finish the plans for their home. That is why Gildren is requesting this loan to buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins and nails, and to pay for the labor. It is extremely important to finish the roof of their home before winter to avoid getting wet and to have a house suited for habitation.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing, purlins and nails, and to pay for the labor to install her roof.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, with five children, and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She operates a stall, selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She gets additional income from rearing cattle. 

Justine has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy pineapples, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cassava, and green bananas. 

Her major challenge includes seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her business to a five-star hotel. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, watermelons, oranges, tomatoes, onions, cassava, and green bananas.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
12 years ago Joshua started farming on a small piece of land in Murang’a, which is in the rural part of Kenya.  Today, the father of three is raising pigs, dairy cows and poultry. He is also growing tea and offering transportation services to members of his community. 

Joshua is a passionate and diligent farmer that sets the pace for other farmers in his community. He enjoys generating income from selling his harvests and produce from his farm. He finds farming very fulfilling. The biggest challenge Joshua faces, however, is low market prices. 

Joshua is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farm implements and a water tank. With the funds, he also plans to construct a piggery. 

With your loan, Joshua is going to have a water tank installed on his farm so that it supplies water to his home and farm. The tank will help harvest rain water, conserve water and store water during dry seasons. 

Construction of a piggery will also help Joshua maintain a hygienic environment for his pigs: he will be washing them daily; The pens will regularly have anti-bacterial spray; the piggery will have proper drainage, a water trough and a clean supply of water. 

Profits generated from the assets financed will satisfy Joshua’s family needs, pay school fees for his children and increase his net income.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements, a water tank, and to construct a piggery

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Meet Pauline, a mother of three who has been practicing agriculture for the last 10 years. She lives together with her children in the Murang’a, an area of Kenya, which is known for coffee plantations which export. Her primary income source is tea. However, she is also involved in other small businesses for extra money for her family.

Generating income by selling the harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. Availability of a market for her produce is a major challenge for Pauline. 

Pauline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase farm implements and horticultural crop seeds. 

Before joining Juhudi, Pauline could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created a group called Jijenge SHG. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. 

With your loan, Pauline will purchase more effective modern tools that will make horticultural activities on her farm much easier.  

Pauline is striving to boost her income so that she can cater to her family’s essential needs and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements and horticultural crops

loans.name: Biona

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Biona from Kericho, the most beautiful countryside in Kenya, covered with expansive level-height tea plantations.  She is married with two children. She sells milk, eggs, tea and bananas produced on her farm. She is also involved in transportation services, using a motorcycle. 
 
With her seven years in farming, dairy and banana farming are what Biona enjoys most. However, the market prices for bananas are low most of the time. This has led her to focus more on dairy farming.

Biona is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter. This machine will enable her to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage and fed to the dairy cow.

With your lending, the chaff cutter will aid Biona’s cow's digestion and prevent the cows from rejecting any part of their food. This in effect will boost animal health and productivity.

Additional income from the chaff cutter will be reinvested back into the business to drive growth and expansion.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Wasafi Group

texts.en:
Catherine, a businesswoman and a mother of two school age kids, is in her late 20's. She is married, and for four years now, she has supported her family by managing a beauty salon and selling shampoo, liquid soap and clothes at the same place. Catherine is at her business from 8 am to 8:30pm daily, and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy salon hair products and clothes for her business.  

She dreams of managing another business of spare parts and motorcycles. 

Catherine will share this loan with her loan group,” Wasafi”, which consist of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products and clothes for her business.

loans.name: Ayda Nora

texts.es: Ayda Nora siendo una persona muy dedicada a su labor como comerciante, diario se levanta muy temprano para atender sus clientes que la visitan en su negocio de venta de ropa, calzados y demás artículos de uso personal. ella. logró establecer su propio negocio con la ayuda de su esposo que también tiene experiencia en el ramo del comercio, viajan a la capital a comprar mercadería para revender en la zona de Nueva Guinea que es donde habitan.  Necesita crédito para terminar de acondicionar un anexo que empezó con esfuerzo y que utilizara para su negocio que actualmente lo tiene en su casa y no brinda las condiciones necesarias a su clientela. De ser beneficiada aprovecharía el crédito para la compra de Cortinas Corredizas, Cemento, arena, Arenilla y pagar mano de obra para repellar las paredes.  Ayda por el momento no cuenta con los recursos necesario para terminar esta inversión ya que las ganancias de sus ventas son pocas y tiene que asumir los gastos del hogar y de sus dos hijos que estudian, el mayor esta en secundaria y el menor en primaria.
texts.en:
Ayda Nora is a very dedicated worker. She gets up very early every day to attend to her customers who come to her shop, which sells clothes, footwear and other personal use items.

Ayda Nora managed to establish her own business with the help of her husband who also has experience in business. They travel to the capital to buy merchandise to resell in the Nueva Guinea area where they live.

She needs a loan to finish setting up an annex, which she began with much effort, and which she will use for her business which she currently runs from the house and does not offer the most suitable conditions for her customers. 

On being granted, she would use the loan to buy sliding divides, cement, sand, stone and pay for labour to plaster the walls. At the moment she does not have the necessary resources to finish this investment as the profits from her sales are small and she has to cover household expenses and those of her two children. Her children are studying, the elder in secondary and the younger one in primary education.

loans.use: to buy sliding divides, cement, stone, sand and pay labour costs to set up an annex for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, and has four children, three of which go to school. She has no additional members to support. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years; she works seven days a week. 

Mariam has requested a loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, cooking oil and serving utensils. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy rice, green bananas, flour, cooking oil and serving utensils

loans.name: Mkono Mkononi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Efrasie est une commerçante depuis 2 ans, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires «Mkono Mkononi», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants dont 5 étudient et 7 autres n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse  des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un maçon. Elle va acheter des cartons de bombons, des biscuits, sucre, riz, huiles, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir,elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en: Efrasie has been a saleswoman for two years and is the president and a member of the Mkono Mkononi business association. She is enterprising, dynamic, and at 45 years old has 12 children of whom five go to school and seven do not. She sells various articles and  is a partner in a boutique. She requests a loan from Hekima to enlarge her business. She started up her business with funds that her husband gave to her. Her spouse is a stonemason. She plans to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oils, soap powder, cosmetic products, one box of exercise books, five boxes of ball pens, matches, iodised salt, etc. In the future, she hopes to increase her capital, feed her children and send them  to school and ensure  medical care for them. She thanks Hekima for their support for businesswomen who are excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, sugar, rice, oils, soap powder, cosmetic products, one box of exercise books, five boxes of ball pens, matches, iodised salt, etc.

loans.name: Turikumwe Ii Group

texts.fr:
Firmin fait partie du groupe Turikumwe II et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 39 ans  et est marié  à Béatrice, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 16  ans dont 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de chèvres  depuis  10 ans.
