Il est à son deuxième   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de chèvres  à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait acheter une parcelle, un  véhicule pour son transport   et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Firmin is a member of the Turikumwe II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 39 years old and is married to a Béatrice, a farmer. Together they have five children, aged from two to 16 years old. Three of the children go to school. 

Firmin has been selling goats for ten years. He is on his second loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy many goats to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a piece of land, a vehicle, and to see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy many goats to resell

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 4 children and all go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She sells second hand clothes at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level and buy a van for transport her merchandise. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Ununio Group

texts.en:
Lameck, who is aged in his thirties, is a father of four schooling children. He is married and supports his family by managing a genge (food stall) selling fruits and vegetables. Lameck has been in this business for five years now and is able to make a good return each month. He sells his stock from 08am to 09pm daily. 

This is his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans (all of which he paid back successfully) to buy genge stock (fruits and vegetables). Lameck earned a profit which he used to cover household expenses and school fees for his kids. He is really doing great and dreams of becoming much better in life. He will use this loan to buy genge stock (fruits, vegetables, rice and cooking oil). 

Lameck will share this loan with his loan group "Ununio" which totals ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy genge stocks (fruits, vegetables, rice and cooking oil).

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Litein is one of the important villages in tea cultivation in Kenya. Farmers in this area mainly practise mixed farming. Crops provide a longer-term source of investment while animals are mostly a source of regular income. The struggle of a progressive mixed farmer finds a place herein. 

Christine is the name of the female farmer who belongs to this rain fed village in Kenya. She keeps a dairy cow and poultry. She also grows tea and food crops. Besides income from other personal businesses, her main income sources are milk, eggs and crops. 

The mother of 4 is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a greenhouse. A greenhouse will provide a controlled environment for her crops to be more productive. Christine owns a small piece of land; she is introducing a greenhouse to ensure space is fully utilized in the most economical, efficient and productive way. 

Christine plans on spending additional profits from the greenhouse to satisfy her family’s needs, pay her children’s school fees and meet the high farm-related expenses.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 2 children and both go to school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling second hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last 9 years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy bales of shoes, bags and dresses. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to build permanent business premises. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Olpha

texts.en:
Olpha, a young lady from a small village in Nyamira area of Kenya, has been growing tea and food crops for 5 years. She also keeps dairy cows and poultry. The mother of three and the rest of her group members were inspired by the progress other farmers made by forming groups and joining Juhudi Kilimo. 

Besides farming, Olpha is also involved in other personal businesses including offering transportation solutions on an Indian motorcycle. 

Olpha is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank. A water tank will enable her to harvest rain water for watering her plants and other domestic chaos such as washing clothes. The tank will also save her a lot of time and energy that she would otherwise burn going the spring. 

Olpha plans to spend any increase in income that will arise from the water tank satisfying her family needs and paying her children’s school fees. The tank will also store water in anticipation of drought thus ensuring the animals and plants have constant supply of water.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, a diligent mother of 4, is 15 years deep in the farming business. Whether it's dairy farming, crop farming or other farming side-businesses, she knows a successful agri-business is about more than just planting crops and selling produce: It is a lifestyle!

Jane, 40, loves to garden. The challenge is that she has to stop gardening once the cold weather blows in.  

Jane is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to put up a greenhouse. With a greenhouse, she will be an active all year!

Supplying fresh produce all year round regardless of the weather guarantees an increase in income for Jane. Income from the greenhouse will help Jane satisfy her family needs and meet the high farming-related costs.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, flour and snacks. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy crates of soda, sugar, rice, beans, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter from a village in Kericho, is an active and progressive farmer of his locality. He has a wife and two children and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, he grows tea, and various horticulture crop varieties. He also keeps a dairy cow that produces milk for sale and consumption. 

Peter is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to put up a greenhouse. A greenhouse provides a controlled environment that will create ideal conditions for Peter’s crop to grow healthily. 

Ready with 8 years’ experience in farming and knowledge he has acquired through training programmes organized by Juhudi Kilimo, all Peter needs is financing to push him closer to his dream. 

The profits will go towards fulfilling his family’s needs and meeting other farming-related costs.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old and married, with four children. She lives in the Murang’a area of Kenya, famous for pineapple production. 

Ruth holds a job that pays her a monthly salary. She also sells eggs from her farm, among other personal businesses. She has been involved in farming for 20 years now.

Ruth has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Juhudi Kilimo, to construct a piggery and to purchase poultry and a water tank. These assets will improve the state of her farm, generate more income, and create convenience. 

Ruth plans on making full payments on the loan. The additional income will go to satisfying her family needs, paying for her children’s school fees, and re-investing in her business.

loans.use: to construct a piggery and to purchase poultry and a water tank.

loans.name: Toka Chini Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kadwidwi est une commerçante d’une expérience 5 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Toka Chini» âgée de 28 ans et mère de 6 enfants dont 4 étudient et 2 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse de la tomate. Elle étale ses marchandises à domicile dans une avenue de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 1panier de tomates. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un menuisier. Elle souhaite  accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Kadwidwi is a client who has five years' experience as a saleswoman and is a member of the Toka Chini group. She is 28 years old and has six children. Four of them go to school, the other two are too small. She sells tomatoes. She sets out her merchandise in front of her home on an avenue in the town. She requests a loan from Hekima to enlarge her business. She will purchase one basket of tomatoes. She started her business with funds that her husband gave to her. Her husband is a carpenter. She hopes to enlarge her capital, send her children to school and ensure their well-being.  She thanks Hekima for their support for businesswomen by offering them micro-credit without material guarantee when they are excluded from the classic banking system, especially at this time following the unrest in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy one basket of tomatoes.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un señor de 56 años de edad,  no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar como otros.  Sin embargo,  manifiesta que lo poco que él aprendido a sido gracias a el esfuerzo que él mismo hace día con día,  nunca quiso formar un hogar,  ya que cuando tenía planeado hacerlo las cosas no se dieron,  por lo cual decidió mejor quedarse con su madre,  en la actualidad vive con su madre y una sobrina, así que él tiene que trabajar para llevar el sustento a su familia,  ya que de lo que él gana viven los tres.


Gonzalo es un señor mayor de edad que a pesar de los años,  aun se siente con las ganas de seguir trabajando para mantener su  familia, se siente orgulloso de decir que genera ingresos de los cuales su familia está muy agradecida, ya que es una bendición de Dios para ellos. ya tiene 38 años de dedicarse a la agricultura siente que ya es una experiencia buena para él, desde hace mucho tiempo recuerda que fue su madre quien le enseño a sembrar maíz y frijoles, ahora en día el cultiva 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz junto con frijol. 

Aparte de esto también en sus tiempos libres va a halar leña para  luego venderla y hacer otros dolaritos extras. El lugar donde él va cultivar le queda a poca distancia de su casa ya que se traslada caminando y lo más que hace son 15 minutos, nadie más le ayuda, ya que su madre esta mayorcita de edad y aunque quisiera no puede ayudarle. Los horarios que él se pone son de 6 de la mañana a las 11am.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar un saco de abono, 2 botellas de veneno, folidol, 2 litros de paracuac y otros, dice que ya  inicio la siembra pero que lamentablemente él no tiene los recursos por los cuales no a podido avanzar,  está a la espera que el crédito le sea otorgado, ya que sería de gran utilidad para él.

Los sueños de Gonzalo siempre han sido tener su propia familia,  dice que ya iniciara a ahorrar para de poquito en poquito ir construyendo su casa y seguir siempre cultivando maíz y frijol mientras Dios así se lo permita.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 56 years old. He did not have the opportunity to go to school like others.

However, he says that what he has learned is thanks to the effort he puts in every day. He never started his own home, because when he was planning on doing it, things didn't turn out that way, so he decided it was better to live with his mother. Now he lives with his mother and a niece. He works to provide for the three of them, since they all live off of what he earns.

Despite his years, Gonzalo still wants to work to support his family. He feels proud to say he earns income for which his family is grateful, which is a blessing for them from God. Gonzalo has worked in agriculture for 38 years, which he feels has been a good experience for him. For a long time he has recalled that it was his mother who taught him to grow corn and beans. Currently he cultivates 10,500 square meters of corn and beans.
In addition to his crops, in his free time he hauls firewood to then sell it and make some extra money.

The land where he grows his crops is not far from his home, about a 15-minute walk. No one helps him, because his mother is elderly, and even if she wanted to help him, she would not be able to.

He works from 6 a.m. to 11 a.m.

Gonzalo is requesting this loan from CrediCampo to buy a sack of manure and insecticides, among others. He says he has already started his crops, but unfortunately he does not have the resources he needs, which is why he has not been able to make progress. He is waiting for the loan to be granted, which would be a great help to him.

Gonzalo has always dreamed of having his own family. He says that now he will start to save money so that little by little he can build his own house and continue growing corn and beans, if that is God's wish.

loans.use: to buy a sack of manure and insecticides for his corn and bean crop.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes was born and raised in Makueni, a county in Kenya, but later moved to Nairobi the capital city where she settled. She runs a salon business and owns residential property at the expansive Mukuru informal settlements. The area however has a few sanitation facilities which cannot be relied upon by the large population. 

Agnes learnt about the Fresh Life Initiative and was impressed by the standards of sanitation and the simplicity provided by the model. She seeks a loan to help her purchase and run one Fresh Life toilet. The facility will be set up for her tenants with the aim of improving sanitation as well as adding value to her property. She plans to use the extra income to repay her loan and put up more structures in order to improve sanitation for the whole community.

loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Nakinja est une commerçante d’une expérience de 10 ans, âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 6 étudient et les 2 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Tuliya». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché animée de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son salaire, comme elle fut enseignante. Son conjoit est un mâcon. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment de post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé au dos.
texts.en: Nakinja is a client who is a saleswoman with ten years' experience. She is 39 years old and is married with eight children. Six of them attend school and the other two are still small. This client is a member of the business group named Tuliya. She sells secondhand clothes. She sets out her merchandise in the busy town market. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She hopes to buy one bundle of secondhand clothes. She started her business with money from her salary, as she was a teacher. Her spouse is a stonemason. In the future she hopes to increase her credit, and feed her children and send them to school. She thanks Hekima for their support for non-bankable businesswomen by giving them a micro-credit, especially at this time following the conflict in the eastern region of the country. It should be noted that the client is carrying her baby on her back.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Winstar

texts.en:
Winstar, a progressive farmer originating from Litein has been doing dairy farming for the last three years. He is particularly passionate about dairy farming. His main sources of income are milk and crop produce from his farm. 

Like any serious entrepreneur, Winstar takes customer satisfaction very seriously. His most enjoyable moment occurs when he is supplying happy buyers with his farm produce. However, from time to time, the payments are delayed especially when dealing with institutions.

Winstar is seeking a loan to purchase a great quality dairy cow.  This cow produces 15 to 20 litres of milk daily on average. This will provide Winstar with a regular source of income that will cushion him at times when he is waiting for delayed payments.

Winstar has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo, smallholder farmers’ microfinance, has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want his farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds.

Winstar says the extra income he will generate will go to his sibling’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and poultry.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Kisii village, located in Lake Region of Kenya, is a famous rain fed area. Despite the area having no drought, crop failure is a common occurrence. Poverty is a permanent companion of the farmers. Rocky soils, underfed cattle, poor farming techniques and a poor road network are the natural scenes of the area.  However, Mr Albert is determined to make a fortune in such a situation.

Albert is seeking a loan to purchase a hybrid dairy cow. For the past ten years, Albert has been keeping traditional breed dairy cattle on his farm just like most of the farmers in the region. He has also been growing tea and tomatoes. But still, he was not making enough money to meet his needs. He was pushed to engaging in other personal businesses to make a decent income. 

With your loan, Albert will acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce adequate litres of milk a day to enable him generate enough income to repay the loan and save some extra money. 

Investing in Albert will enable him to improve his living standard in preparation for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba es madre soltera de sus 3 hijos de 2, 7 y 10 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores se encuentras estudiando, Alba es una señora colombiana que vive en Ecuador desde hace 10 años, comenta que dejo Colombia ya que ahí existe mucha delincuencia y enfrentamientos que afectan a las personas de los alrededores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos ya que mientras se dedica este negocio  también cuida a sus  hijos, y comenta que también se dedica al jornal de trabajo en el campo, su aspiración es terminar de pagar de un lote que adquirió y ahí le gustaría construir una casita para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en: Alba is a single mother of three children, ages 2, 7, and 10 years. The older two are in school. Alba is a Colombian woman who has lived in Ecuador for about ten years. She says she left Colombia because there was a lot of crime and confrontation that affected nearby people. She plans to use the loan to buy chickens, since she can run this business and care for her children at the same time. She also does day labor in the countryside. Her dream is to pay for a plot of land that she acquired where she'd like to one day build a little home for herself and her children.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
El esfuerzo y la dedicación son cualidades principales de Alba, una señora que con el pasar del tiempo ha superado dificultades y ha logrado progresar. Ella tiene 61 años, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, todos mayores e independientes. Hace siete años decidió establecer una pequeña tienda, donde día a día,  brinda una excelente atención a sus clientes, quienes salen satisfechos por la compra realizada. De esta manera invierte en un futuro seguro y tranquilo, recibe apoyo incondicional de su esposo.
Ella solicita el crédito, para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, requiere comprar ropa para niños, jóvenes y adultos; asimismo bolsos, peluches, productos de bellezas, entre otros. Su meta es tener  una tienda más grande e invertir en otros negocios, sin duda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Hard work and dedication are the main qualities that distinguish Alba, a woman who has overcome difficulties and managed to succeed.

She is 61 years old, married, and has 7 children, all grown and independent. Seven years ago, she decided to open a small store, where she provides her customers with excellent attention every day. They always leave happy with their purchases. This business is how she is investing in a secure and sound future, and she has the unconditional support of her husband.

She is requesting this loan to expand the merchandise she has in stock. She plans to buy clothing for children, youth, and adults, as well as purses, stuffed animals, beauty products, and more. Her goal is to have a larger store and invest in other business. She is undoubtedly a hard-working, enterprising woman.

loans.use: buy clothing, purses, beauty supplies, and more for her store.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Goris town with her parents and nine-year-old son. Her parents are elderly pensioners and Armine is the only breadwinner in the family. She works in local kindergarten. Also, she's been providing designing services for the past five years. In particular, she regularly receives orders from the residents of her town for organizing different events (birthday parties, weddings, etc.).

Armine has requested this loan to pay for supplies to help her designing service. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for supplies needed for her design service.

loans.name: Doris Rosalia

texts.es: Doris es una mujer casada, tiene 4 hijos de 11, 14, 16 y 17 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y Doris le ayuda en los gastos del hogar mediante su negocio de crianza de ganado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de terneros para incrementar su negocio, Doris comenta que gasta mucho dinero en la educación y mantención de sus hijos ya que viven en el campo que esta muy alejado de la cuidad de donde estudian los chicos, la aspiración de Doris es que crezca su negocio y mediante este no hacerles faltar nada a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doris is married and has four children, ages 11, 14, 16 and 17 who are going to school. Her husband is a farmer and she helps with the household expenses through her cattle-raising business. She is going to invest in the purchase of calves in order to expand her business.

Doris says she spends a great deal  of money on the education and support of her children, as they live in the country, very far away from where the liittle ones go to school. Doris' ambition is for her business to grow and through this for her children to lack for nothing.

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Fanny Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 50 años de edad, ella tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella, sus 2 hijos menores están estudiando y la de 19 años estuvo inscrita a la universidad pero por motivo de que Lucia estuvo enferma ya no tuvieron el dinero suficiente para que la joven se vaya a la universidad, Lucia va a invertir el crédito en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio al que se dedica 15 años, su aspiración es lograr que su hija entre a la universidad y saque su título profesional.
texts.en: Lucia is 50 years old. She has 6 children, three of whom live with her. Her two youngest children are in school, and her 19 year old was enrolled at the university. But when Lucia got sick, she no longer had the money to send the girl to university. Lucia plans to invest the money in buying pigs so that she can expand the business that she's run for fifteen years. Her goal is to send her daughter to university so that she can earn her professional degree.

loans.use: buy pigs so that she can send her daughter to college.

loans.name: Carlos Patricio

texts.es:
Carlos esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, sobre todo porque han ocurrido muchos movimientos sísmicos y las paredes presentan rajaduras, asimismo realizará el pintado, mejora de ventanas, entre otros; de esta manera podrá brindarle a su familia un mejor ambiente para vivir.

Carlos es muy trabajador, el labora como auxiliar de conexiones de tuberías, en una empresa de su ciudad, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su familia, sobre todo porque tiene un hijo pequeño y su más grand sueño es “ Ser un ingeniero de sistemas y darle un mejor futuro a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help, he will be able to make some repairs in his home, especially because there have been many earthquakes and his walls are cracked. He will also do some painting and improve the windows, among other things. He hopes to be able to give his family a better living environment.

Carlos is very hardworking. He works as an assistant pipe fitter in a company in his city. He earns income to support his family, especially because he has a young son. His greatest dream is to become a systems engineer and give his son a better future.

loans.use: to make some improvements in his home, including repairing the walls and paint and improving the windows.

loans.name: Shamma 2 (2) Group

texts.en:
Giscard is a member of the community bank group SHAMMA 2 (2) and leads a sub-group of eight other micro-entrepreneurs in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. A new father, Giscard lives with his 12-month old daughter and his wife. In order to support his family, Giscard has run his own men’s clothing business for the last five years. Giscard would like to take out a small loan through his group at HOPE Congo of 350,000 CFA to invest in his business. With this money, Giscard will purchase additional men’s shirts, ties and pants to sell.

In the future, Giscard hopes to open his own small store instead of just selling clothing on the side of the street. Eventually, Giscard dreams of being able to travel to other countries in Europe and China to purchase clothing there to sell back in Brazzaville. For Giscard, though, everything he does goes back to his family. His business is a means of supporting them financially, and he hopes that in the future, his daughter will be able to live well and go to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional men’s shirts, ties and pants to sell

loans.name: La Fidelite 3 (1) Group

texts.en:
Fannie is a member of the community bank group LA FIDELITÉ 3 (1) in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. For the last several years, Fannie has supported herself and her daughter by selling diverse items in one of Brazzaville’s largest markets. Selling manioc (cassava), various food items and whatever else she can find, Fannie has been able to grow her activities by taking out small loans with HOPE Congo as a part of LA FIDELITÉ 3 (1).

Within LA FIDELITÉ 3 (1), Fannie helps lead a sub-group of seven other micro-entrepreneurs. Now on her fifth loan cycle, Fannie wants to branch out and begin to sell fish and drinks as well. In order to do so, Fannie would like to take out a loan of 300,000 CFA to travel to Pointe Noire, the Republic of Congo’s economic capital on the coast. There, she will be able to buy fresh fish and drinks in bulk to sell back in Brazzaville.

Through expanding her business activities, Fannie hopes that one day, she will be able to buy a piece of land to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and drinks in bulk from the coast

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 34 años de edad y vive en Huanuco con su esposos y sus 2 hijos por quienes ha luchado constantemente para sacarlos adelante.
Desde hace más de 12 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, teniendo mucho éxito porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, entusiasta y siempre atendiendo con una gran sonrisa a todos sus clientes.
Delia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio e incrementar sus ventas, de esta manera tendrá mayores ingresos y en poco tiempo podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Ampliar su negocio".
texts.en:
Delia is a very enterprising person. She is 34 years old and lives in Huanuco with her husband and two children. She constantly works to provide for her children.

For more than 12 years, she has worked selling groceries. She has been very successful, because she is a hardworking, responsible and enthusiastic person, and because she always waits on her customers with a big smile.

Delia is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their help she will be able to buy merchandise to stock her store and increase her sales. She hopes to increase her income, and in a short time, fulfill her greatest dream, which is to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store.

loans.name: Enny

texts.es: La Señora  Enny  tiene 32 años, es casada tiene un hijito de la edad de tres años , ella se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo en su puesto de venta en la zona de La Mutualista de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución. La Señora  Enny  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como abarrotes y verduras para la elaboración de sus riquísimos platillos  , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  la Señora  Enny  necesita el efectivo ya que comprando por mayor sale más baratos los insumos y así poder ahorrar algo, la Señora  Enny    enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para preparar su comida,  y transportar la misma hasta su puesto de venta,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida donde pueda elaborar y vender sus riquísimos platillos y poder superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Enny, age 32, is married and has a three year old little boy. Her primary work is selling food and fixed lunches at a sales stand in the La Mutualista neighborhood in the city of Santa Cruz. This will be her first loan from the institution. She plans to use it to buy ingredients, including groceries and vegetables so that she can make her delicious dishes.She is requesting the loan because she needs the cash up front to buy the ingredients at wholesale, where they are cheaper, thus saving her a little something over time.  Some of the challenges she faces are needing to get up very early while it's still cold to make the food and then transporting it to her sales stand.

She hopes to use the benefits to continue buying ingredients and providing her customers with excellent service. She hopes to run a small restaurant where she can make and sell her delicious dishes, thus allowing her to better herself in life.

loans.use: buy the ingredients she needs to make and sell food

loans.name: Shamma 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Simone is a single mother of four living and working in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. Since being separated from her husband several years ago, Simone has been working to provide for her four children, two of whom are still in school. In addition to Simone’s four children, Simone’s two younger sisters, a younger brother and two orphans live with her. For years, Simone has thus been running a small businesses selling diverse items from food to small containers, and decided to join a small group of 17 other micro-entrepreneurs with HOPE Congo.

Since joining HOPE Congo in 2011, Simone is now on her fifth loan cycle and heads up a subgroup of seven within the community bank group SHAMMA 2 (1). Simone is eager to keep growing her business activities, and has since expanded to have a small drinks business out of her home and a used clothing business. She would like to use her loan of 400,000 CFA to purchase a small shop where she can combine her cold drinks business with her other diverse goods business. 

Simone dreams of one day being able to buy a piece of land and build her own home there. As a mother, Simone also hopes that all of her children will be able to grow and succeed in the future after finishing school.

loans.use: to purchase a small shop for her cold drinks and diverse goods business

loans.name: Hernando Guilberto

texts.es: Hernando es un joven soltero que nació en Colombia y que sus padres le trajeron a Ecuador desde que era niño debido a los enfrentamientos y conflictos con la guerrilla  y  comenta que le gusta mucho vivir en Ecuador ya que es un país donde hay tranquilidad y es más bien pagado el salario, Hernando comenta que estuvo buscando trabajo y que encontró un puesto para recolectar basura en el carro recolector de basura de una ciudad cercana a donde vive, él también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y que el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar su negocio y que su espiración es que no le falte el trabajo y quedarse para siempre en Ecuador.
texts.en: Hernando is a single young man who was born in Colombia, but brought to Ecuador by his parents when he was just a little boy, due to all the fighting and conflicts with the guerrillas. He says that he likes living in Ecuador very much, since it's a peaceful country and the wages are higher here. Hernando said that he's been looking for work and he just found a job as a garbage collector on the garbage truck in a city near where he lives. He also raises young animals, and this loan will be used to buy chickens and expand his business. His goals are to always have work and to stay in Ecuador forever.

loans.use: buy chickens

loans.name: La Fidelite 3 (2) Group

texts.en:
A single woman in her 20s, May is bursting with plans for the future. At present, May lives and works in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo, and is a member of the community bank group LA FIDELITÉ 3 (2). May is the group’s treasurer and leads a sub-group of seven other micro-entrepreneurs at HOPE Congo. Since she was 16, May has been working hard at her own market stand selling fruits and vegetables such as bananas, plantains, mangos, pineapples and peanuts. 

Getting up before 5 am every morning to travel to a distant market where the freshest fruits are found, May brings her produce to Brazzaville to sell. May calls out to potential clients, drawing them in with samples of her fruit. Now on her second loan cycle with HOPE Congo, May would like to take out a loan of 250,000 CFA to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. With the increased profits from this business, May hopes to be able to travel to China to begin purchasing items there to sell back in Congo. One day, May hopes to have her own clothing shop, and dreams of eventually working in the civil service. The first step down this road is growing her current business with a new loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Krobor Bukum Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Krobor Bukum and are beginning their seventh loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of four members and led by Patience who is the leader of the group. The members of the group run a variety of businesses including a plastic items, silver bowls, fish, ceramic plates and cups, and water.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro businesses like Patience's. She states that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, her business is the sale of plastic tables, chairs, and silver bowls. She explains that she learned this business previously because it was a family business.

She is 38 years and single with two school-going children. The loan that she will take now is to increase her capital for the purchase of plastic tables, chairs, and silver bowls at wholesale and sell them at retail. She will acquire the items from the market and sell. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the institution's health-related offerings.

loans.use: To purchase plastic tables, chairs, and silver bowls to sell

loans.name: Susana Melissa

texts.es:
Susana esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como cervezas y gaseosas al por mayor, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio, atender a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y las de sus pequeño hijo de 3 años.

Susana es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que inicio su negocio con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro, ya que su más grande sueño es”  Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y poder  tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Susana is grateful to the Kiva lenders; with their help she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as beer and soft drinks in bulk, which will supply her business, and allow her to serve her customers’ needs and improve her income. This way she can improve her and her three year-old son’s life.

Susana is a woman eager to get ahead, which is why she started her business with hard work and savings. Her biggest dream is to give her children a good education and to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business (beer and soft drinks at wholesale).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some repairs to her home

loans.name: Montagne De Sion (1) Group

texts.en:
Désiré runs a small diverse grocery stand in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo and is the president of the community bank group MONTAGNE DE SION (1). Now on his sixth loan cycle with HOPE Congo, Désiré would like to take out a small loan of 300,000 CFA in order to continue to grow his business. With this money, Désiré will be able to purchase additional bread, milk, hair extensions, notebooks, pens and phone credit cards to sell.

Leading a subgroup of 12 other micro-entrepreneurs in MONTAGNE DE SION (1), Désiré has overcome quite a few difficulties to continue his market stand. One of the most disastrous was when his business partner stole part of his profits and ran off with it. Since then, Désiré has been working hard to grow his business again, and hopes that once he is able to stabilize his income, he can change his business to selling phone credits in bulk. Having realized that buying phone credit is one of the main daily activities of Brazzaville’s population, Désiré hopes to use his business savvy to grow his profits and dreams of one day being able to travel to Ghana or the United States.

loans.use: to purchase additional bread, milk, hair extensions, notebooks, pens and phone credit cards to sell

loans.name: Yeny Aracely

texts.es:
Yeny, es una joven soltera, vive con sus padres y una sobrina de 11 años de edad, debido a la necesidad de tener recursos económicos para cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con los gastos familiares y  por motivación de sus vecinos hace cinco años fundo una tienda en su vivienda, ofrece productos de la canasta básica, trabaja todos los días de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche. Le colabora su familia en atender a los clientes.
Invertirá en la compra de azúcar, arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, dulces, aceite, galletas, pan y otro tipo de mercadería que le permitan tener un negocio mucho más surtido, espera aumentar sus ventas e ingresos con los que podrá cancelar la deuda adquirida y hacer mejoras en la vivienda.
Su sueño es tener recursos económicos suficientes para construir una casa de ladrillo y tener un negocio autosuficiente.
texts.en: Yeny, a young single woman, lives with her parents and her niece of 11 years old, due to the need for financial resources to cover her personal expenses and to help her parents with the family costs.  Five years ago, thanks to the motivation of her neighbors, she started a store in her home, offering basic needs products.  She works every day from six in the morning until eight in the evening.  Her family helps her to serve the customers.  She will use the loan to purchase sugar, rice, beans, sodas, juices, sandwiches, sweets, oil, cookies, bread and other types of merchandise that would allow her to have a better stocked store.  She hopes to increase her sales and earnings with which she can pay off her acquired debt and make improvements in the home.  Her dream is to have sufficient economic resources to build a brick home and have a self sufficient business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, sodas, juices, sandwiches, sweets, oil, cookies, bread and other types of merchandise.

loans.name: Montagne De Sion (2) Group

texts.en:
Judicaël is a young father of three living and working in Brazzaville, the Republic of Congo. In order to support his three young children and his wife, Judicaël runs his own hot food stand and broom-selling business. In order to have a stable income for his family, Judicaël recently joined HOPE Congo and became a member of the community bank group MONTAGNE DE SION (2), where he leads a subgroup of 11 other micro-entrepreneurs.

As a member of MONTAGNE DE SION (2), Judicaël would like to take out a small loan of 250,000 CFA to invest in his various business activities.  With it, he hopes to purchase more brooms to sell in bulk to local hardware stores. In the future, Judicaël aspires to purchase a motorcycle to transport his goods more quickly and increase his revenue. Judicaël dreams of being able to save his money little by little so that he can one day build his family their own home.

loans.use: to purchase more brooms

loans.name: Jenny Delicia

texts.es:
Jenny Delicia tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el Distrito de Oyotún, una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, cerdos, desde hace10 años en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de animales que le permitirá ampliar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jenny Delicia is 36 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the District of Oyotún, which is a rural area with a lot of agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. This district is located in the Province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Jenny has worked for over 10 years raising and selling animals such as roosters, chicks, chickens, ducks, turkeys and pigs. She is requesting this loan of 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a variety of animals that will allow her to increase the size of her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Yancis Carolina

texts.es:
Yancis, se decidió por solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la venta de mariscos, realizará la compra de pescado, camarones, cangrejos, conchas y otros moluscos, que los clientes día con día buscan en su negocio.
Con el financiamiento anterior ella surtió de mariscos frescos su inventario, permitiéndole atraer más clientes, sus ventas y ganancias han mejorado un poco con las que ha cancelado sus deudas y ha hecho mejoras  al local.
texts.en: Yancis has decided to take a new loan to invest in her seafood business.  She will use the loan to buy fish, shrimp, crab, scallops, and other mollusks that her customers demand each day.   With her previous loan, she stocked up her business with fresh seafood.  This enabled her to attract more customers, and her sales and earnings increased a bit so she was able to pay off her debts and make some improvements to her sales site.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, crab, scallops, and other mollusks

loans.name: Maria Yobely

texts.es:
Maria es madre de una niña de 2 años y tiene la convicción de sacarla adelante a costa de muchas cosas.
Ella inicio con un negocio de fotocopias con un capital que le facilito su padre para montar el negocio, gracias a su trabajo duro, esfuerzo y buena administración, hoy en día tiene un negocio dinámico en el que ofrece servicio de fotocopias y transcripción de trabajos que combina con una tienda de abarrotes y miscelánea en el mismo establecimiento.
Es un negocio versátil el cual atiende varias personas al día gracias a su excelente ubicación al frente del Centro De Salud.
Ella desea darle un gran impulso a su negocio y poder capitalizarlo, por eta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar un congelador, estantería y surtirá su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar aumentando así su inventario.
Ella tiene la esperanza de poder mantener su negocio vigente y competitivo para obtener buenos ingresos y mantener siempre una sonrisa en el rostro de su hija.
texts.en: Maria is mother to a 2 year old girl and she has the convinction of wanting to get her ahead in many things.  She began with a small photocopy business with a capital that her father facilitiated to start her business.  Thanks to her hard work, efforts, and good administration, today she has a dynamic business that offers photocopy service and transcription work, combined with a grocery store and miscellaneous items in the same establishment.  It's a versatile business in which she attends to various people everyday thanks to her excellent location in front of the Health Center.  She desires to give her business a boost and capitalize on it.  For this reason she requests a loan to buy a freezer, stand, and will stock her store with various basic needs and home products, increasing her inventory.  She hopes to be able to maintain her active and competitive business to obtain good earnings and to always maintain a smile on the face of her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, a shelf and an assortment of various products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and ceramic tile to finish building his home.

loans.name: Fancy

texts.en:
Fancy, a mother of four, has been a mixed farmer for 10 years. She lives together with her family in Kericho, Kenya. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, vegetables and tea produced at her farm. Two things she enjoys are poultry farming and making profits from selling her yields. However, her biggest challenge is outbreak of disease.
 
Fancy has been to various financial and agricultural trainings. She came to appreciate loans as stepping stones to success.  Fancy looks for loan providers with favourable interest terms such as Juhudi Kilimo that will not strain her: She is already encountering high farm input expenses.
 
Fancy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will expand the poultry operation she has going and generate more income to repay the loan. The family will enjoy increased income once the loan is fully serviced.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María Julia tiene 63 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como leche, aceite, arroz, azúcar, gaseosa, art. de aseo, desde hace 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una moto, con lo que podrá realizar el traslado de su mercadería a caseríos aledaños que le permitirán crecer en ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Julia is 63 years old, married, and lives with her family in the district of Oyotun.  The population in Oyotun dedicates themselves to agriculture, trade, and livestock.  Oyotun is located in the Province of Chiclayo that belongs to the Lambayeque Region in the north coast of Peru.  

Maria dedicates herself to selling groceries such as milk, oil, rice, sugar, soda, and toiletries.  She has 10 years experience in her business.  She has made a request to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 soles to purchase a moto with which she hopes to realize the transport of her merchandise to surrounding villages.  This will allow her to increase her sales and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a moto to transport her goods to surrounding villages.

loans.name: Katherine Patricia

texts.es: Katherine esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya qwu gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, como mejorar las paredes, piso, compra de enseres, entre otros, lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida. Katherine tiene su pequeño negocio de alquiler de mototaxi, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos y poder apoyara a su familia, ya que su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa de mototaxis”
texts.en:
Katherine is grateful to the kiva money lenders because, thanks to the help that they have provided her with she will be able to make improvements in the house she lives in - such as improve the walls and floor, and purchase basic tools, amongst other things. This willl allow her to improve her quality of life.  

Katherine has a small business, renting out motor-taxis, from which she is able to have an income to be able to meet her expenses and support her family . Her biggest dream is  "To have a motor-taxi company.”

loans.use: make improvements to her house ( improve  the walls, floor, purchase of basic tools, amongst other things.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Group Lwanda

texts.en:
The Tukolerewamu Group is located in a rural setting and comprises nine members, both men amd women. They are involved in different activities, like farming, animal rearing, alcohol brewing, and retail business.

Jude is a married man, aged 30 years, with three children, all attending school. He also takes care of a nephew. He is a farmer, growing coffee, maize, beans, and matooke and he is doing poultry as a side business. He has been in business since 1998 and he started the business since it was profitable.  

Jude acquired the loan to boost the agricultural business through mulching his banana plantation, such that he can boost his yields. His clients are traders within his village.

His hope for the future is to buy land and to educate his children and the challenge he faces is the poor weather conditions, like too much drought and too much rainfall. He describes himself as a hard-working man and he is optimistic the loan will help him take his business to another level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to mulch his plantation.

loans.name: Maridadi Group

texts.en:
Iddy is a businessman in his late twenties. He is single and, for three years now, he has supported his living by running a shop, selling clothes. He operates his business from 7am to 8:30pm daily and he is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first loan request. He is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Maridadi Group, a five-member group. His group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Iddy will use his portion of loan to replenish his shop with new, fashionable clothes. He dreams of managing a company.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with new, fashionable clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas stove and a television.

loans.name: Abariki Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nkaka est une commerçante depuis 22 ans et membré de la banque communautaire «Abariki», senior entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 12 enfants, qui tous  étudient. Elle est vendeuse  des  poissons frais. Elle étale sa marchandise  dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 250 poissons. Son conjoint est un enseignant.  Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu d’un ami. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
This client, Nkaka, has been a merchant for 22 years. She is a member of the communal bank “Abariki”. A senior entrepreneur and an energetic woman, she is 46 years old, married, and the mother of twelve children, who are all students. She is a vendor of fresh fish. She displays her merchandise at the town’s central market. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 250 fish. Her husband is a teacher. She started her business with funds from a friend. For the future, she would like to provide education and food for her children . 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 250 fish

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto es un hombre trabajador, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero, tiene un hijo y vive en Ucayali con su familia.
Desde hace más de 8 meses trabaja en la Municipalidad de la Ciudad donde vive y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y muy trabajadora y sobre todo porque siempre ha luchado por sacar adelante a su familia y a su hijo quien es su mayor orgullo y su motivación en la vida.
Roberto está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá arreglar su mototaxi para poder obtener otro ingreso adicional y pueda más adelante remodelar su vivienda, comprar algunos muebles para mayor comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is hardworking. He is 43 years old, single, and has one son. He lives in Ucayali with his family.

For more than eight years, he has worked for the municipality of the city where he lives. This work is going well for him, because he is a responsible person, very hardworking, and especially because he has always worked to provide for his family and for his son, who is his greatest pride and motivation in life.

Roberto is grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their support he will be able to repair his mototaxi and earn some extra income. He hopes to make some improvements to his home and buy some furniture to improve his family's comfort and quality and life.

loans.use: to repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: La Patience Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Muhindo est une commerçante  d’une expérience de 13 ans, âgée de 43 ans, veuve et mère de 2 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «La Patience». Elle est vendeuse divers habillements usagés. Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de la place. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 5 ballons de friperie. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de microcrédit, pendant, ce moment post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Muhindo, is a merchant with 13 years of experience. She is 43 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children, who are both students. This client is a member of the business collective “La Patience”. She is a vendor of a variety of secondhand clothing. She sets up her merchandise at the local central market.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 5 bales of used clothing. She started off her business with funds from her husband when he was alive. For the future, she would like to increase her loan and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs by according them micro-loans during this period post-conflict in the country’s east.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bales of used clothing

loans.name: Azizi Group

texts.en:
Asha is a businesswoman who is in her 30s and has two school-aged kids. She is married and has been supporting her family with a mamalishe business. She has been in this project since 2011 and makes a good profit each month. 

This will be Asha's 11th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy the out-of-stock items in her food stock and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to replenish her business with cooking ingredients.

She dreams of owning a hotel.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group "Azizi", which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Exauce Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mbugheki est une commerçante depuis 29 ans, présidente et membre de la banque communautaire «Exauce», senior entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 49 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont 4 étudient, 2 ont fini les études et 2 autres sont déjà mariés. Elle est vendeuse des poissons salés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 350 poissons. Son conjoint est un meunier. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son ami comme crédit et qu’elle remboursa plus tard. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et  nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable.
texts.en:
This client, Mbugheki, has been a merchant for 29 years. She is the president and a member of the communal bank “Exauce”. A senior entrepreneur and energetic woman, she is 49 years old, married, and a mother of eight children, of whom four are students, two have finished school, and two others are already married. 

Mbugheki is a vendor of salted fish. She displays her merchandise at the central market in town. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 350 fish. Her husband is a miller. She started her business with funds from her friend as a loan, which she paid back later. In the future, she would like to increase her capital and provide education and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for the support it lends to unbanked women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 350 fish

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun is jewelry designer from Thailand. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver beads, pearls and gemstones, as well as bring on more artisans to expand her workshop.

Khun has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is her story:

Khun's love for art is a life-long passion. "I was exposed to the traditional art and customs of Southeast Asia. My love for art is ingrained in my personality and in the details of my designs."

"This microcredit will make it possible for me to purchase components at a lower cost so that I can sell my products at competitive prices. I pay for everything in cash, including the daily wages of the artisans who work at my workshop. This will really help me and allow me to add new designs, too. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Khun's work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/6487

loans.use: to purchase silver beads, pearls and gemstones in bulk

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is 49 years old and single without any dependents. Patience works hard by selling wax prints, jerseys and underwear. She sells at an open space at her residence in Teshie and requested a loan of GHS 1,700 through ID-Ghana to purchase more wax prints, jerseys and underwear to sell to her customers.

Patience has borrowed and repaid seven loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. She successfully paid back her previous loans and now requested an additional loan to further build her business. Patience aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more wax prints, jerseys and underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Amani Kwanza Group

texts.en:
Maryciana, a married mother of two boys and two girls who attend school, is in her late thirties. For four years now, she has made her living by selling fruits, dagaa (small dry fishes) and fabrics. 

This will be Maryciana's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all repaid, to buy more business stock, and her profits paid school fees and household expenses. Maryciana will use this loan to buy more fruits and dagaa to resell.  She dreams of building her own house.

Maryciana will share this loan with her loan group "AMANI KWANZA" which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and dagaa to resell.

loans.name: Carmen Josefina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de secretaria,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un televisor para su casa.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member remains dedicated to being a secretary.  She has been doing that work for a number of years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a clothing store.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a television for her home. 

This member is grateful to those who are taking part in her dream by offering her a loan, and she promises to comply with her established repayment plan.

loans.use: to purchase a television for her home.

loans.name: Candelaria De Jesus

texts.es:
Candelaria, tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene 41 años de edad, ambos viven junto a sus dos hijos de 12 y 15 años de edad, con el fin de tener más ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia, instalo una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, la cual atiende todos los días de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, en ocasiones le colabora su esposo.
Con el financiamiento espera tener más productos para ofrecer mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes, tener mejores ventas y ganancias, comprara aceite, azúcar, cerillos, arroz, golosinas, dulces, bebidas, papel higiénico, especias, etc.
Su visión es ir fortaleciendo poco a poco su negocio con ayuda de créditos para tener una mejor situación económica y brindar apoyo incondicional a sus hijos para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 35 years old and married. Her husband is 41 years old. They live together with their two children, ages 15 and 12. Candelaria started a small grocery store that sells basic necessities. Her goal was to earn more income to help her husband with family expenses. She works in her grocery store every day from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Sometimes her husband helps her.

Candelaria would like to use this loan to buy more products so that she can offer a greater variety of items to her customers. She hopes to improve her sales and profit. She will buy oil, sugar, matches, rice, sweets and candies, soft drinks, bathroom tissue, spices, etc.

Her plan is to gradually strengthen her business with the help of loans so that she can improve her family's financial situation and support her children as much as they need to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, matches, rice, sweets and candies, soft drinks, bathroom tissue, spices, etc.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es una humilde campesina, trabajadora y honesta, madre de 4 hijos a los cuales ha dedicado gran parte de su vida para su protección y cuidado.
Ella obtiene ingresos para su hogar a través del trabajo duro en el cuidado de un galpón de pollos construido a un costado de su casa, animales que posteriormente vende en el municipio de Valencia, Córdoba.
Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos y es por esto que le dedica tiempo e invierte sus esfuerzos en él.
Hoy en día desea trabajar más cómoda y eficientemente por eso solicita un auxilio monetario para realizar algunas adecuaciones a su galpón, de esta forma podrá tener sus animales en mejores condiciones; adicional a esto desea compra alimento y concentrado para sus pollos, logrando así que crezcan más sanos.
Con el dinero prestado podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio del trabajo que toda su vida ha realizado.
Tiene plena fe en el buen corazón de las personas solidarias que apoyan los proyectos productivos de la gente humilde y menos favorecida.
texts.en:
Luz is a humble, hardworking, and honest mother of 4 children who has devoted much of her life to their care and protection. She works hard to earn income for her household caring for a chicken shed built on the side of her house; she then sells the chickens in the town of Valencia, Córdoba. This is her main source of income and this is why she devotes her time and effort towards it. 

She is requesting a loan to make some adjustments to her barn and to work more comfortably and efficiently so her animals can be in top condition. She will purchase food for her chickens to help them grow healthier as well. 

With the loan she can improve the lives of her family by working as she has done her whole life. She has full faith in the hearts of the caring people who support productive projects for humble and disadvantaged people.

loans.use: to make improvements to her chicken shed and buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
Blema Tesaa is a group of five persons whose members reside in the same neighbourhood. The representative of the group, Patience (who is on the far right in the photo), is 39, single and has no dependent children.

Patience was not able to attend school. She lives alone in Teshie where she was born. For almost three years, Patience has been selling firewood in Teshie community. She buys firewood from suppliers to sell to customers. 

This is the third time that Patience and the other members of the group have requested a loan from ID-Ghana with the intention of growing their working capital and their businesses in order to better respond to the needs of their clients. Their prior loan has been correctly repaid.

loans.use: To buy firewood from suppliers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Iris Yamileth

texts.es:
Iris de 22 años de edad, soltera, vive con su madre y una hermana en la casa de su madre, estudio hasta bachillerato en la ciudad, por motivos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando en la universidad, ya que tiene que trabajar todos los días para ayudar a su familia económicamente. 

Iris actualmente se dedica a trabajar cuidando una casa de una prima en un municipio del departamento, tiene que viajar los lunes y quedarse donde ella para minimizar los gastos mensuales, sale de su casa a las cinco y media de la mañana, porque entra a trabajar desde las seis y media de lunes a sábado.

Antes ella trabajo por tres años luego que salio de estudiar en una electrónica, donde ya no pudo continuar debido a que sus ingresos económicos eran pocos y tenia que viajar todos los días y no le quedaba mucho para ayudar a su madre y a su hermana.

Iris también ayuda a su madre a elaborar hamacas de seda, las cuales venden en la comunidad, y es de donde también obtiene pequeños ingresos económicos.


Iris, solicita un crédito en credicampo, para mejorar su vivienda donde vive, ya que es bastante insegura y esta amenazada a sufrir daños ante cualquier fenómeno natural o de la delincuencia.

Con el crédito, comprara, arena, cemento, hierro y bloque para mejorar su vivienda y así ayudar a su madre y su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Iris sueña con seguir estudiando en la universidad y tener una profesión en la cual se pueda desempeñar, para obtener ingresos que le permitan ayudar mas a su madre, quien la creció.
texts.en:
Iris is 22, single, and lives with her mother and a sister in her mother's house. She studied up to high school in the city. She was not able to continue her studies at university for economic reasons, as she has to work every day to help her family economically.

Iris currently works looking after a cousin's house in a city within the department. She has to travel on Mondays and stay at the cousin's house to minimise her monthly costs. She leaves the house at 5.30 in the morning as she has to be at work by 6.30 and works from Monday to Saturday. Before that, she received training at an electronics shop. where she worked for three years, but she could not continue this because of low earnings and because she had to travel every day and she did not have much left to help her mother and sister.

Iris also helps her mother to make silk hammocks, which they sell in the community, and this way they also earn a little money.

Iris is asking for a loan through CrediCampo in order to improve the house where she lives, because it is rather unsafe and is threatened with natural damage or damage through delinquency. With the loan she will buy sand, cement, iron and bricks to improve the house, and thus help her mother and family to have a better quality of life.

Iris dreams of being able to continue studying at university and holding down a profession so she can earn money to allow her to help even more the mother who raised her.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, iron and bricks to improve her house and in this way help her mother and family to have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell such as sacks of water, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as bags of sugar, batteries, cartons etc.

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Glenda, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, por las tardes elabora y vende pupusas, con estas actividades obtiene ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; Glenda es jefa de su hogar, sola enfrenta la responsabilidad de salir adelante con sus dos hijos, un niño de 2 años de edad y una niña de un año de edad.
Realizara la compra de güisquiles, repollos, tomates zanahoria, ejotes, harina, quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, etc., con la inversión espera fortalecer su negocio y tener mejores ingresos, los cuales serán el respaldo del pago de las cuotas.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para asegurarles a sus hijos un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Glenda sells fruits and vegetables from place to place. In the afternoons she makes and sells pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans]. She pays for her family's necessities with the income she earns from these activities. Glenda is the head of her household, and she is solely responsible for getting ahead with her two children -- a two-year-old boy and a one-year-old girl.

She will buy güisquiles [an edible gourd], cabbages, tomatoes, carrots, green beans, flour, cheese curd, chicharrones [fried pork rinds], oil, etc. With this loan she hopes to strengthen her business and improve her income, which she will use to make the installment payments on the loan.

Her dream is to stay working so that she can ensure her children a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy güisquiles [an edible gourd], cabbages, tomatoes, carrots, green beans, flour, cheese curd, chicharrones [fried pork rinds], oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Leidy Solange

texts.es:
Leidy es una joven emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad, soltera, tiene un pequeño hijo y vive en Nazca junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación es su hijo, es por ello que trabaja incansablemente para brindarle un futuro mejor,
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en un Minimarket de la zona donde vive. También se dedica al negocio de venta de cervezas y bebidas gaseosas en su domicilio y venta de chocotejas que son preparadas por ella misma. Ser amdre soltera no fue impedimento para salir adelante.
Leidy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque gracias a la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder suministrar su negocio de venta de cervezas y así pueda obtener más ingresos y más adelante poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Ser una gran empresaria".
texts.en: Leidy is an enterprising young woman. She is 24 years old and single. She has one small child, and she lives in Nazca with her family. Her greatest motivation is her son. She works tirelessly to give him a better future. For more than a year, Leidy has worked in a Minimarket in the area where she lives. She also sells beer and soft drinks in her home, as well as chocotejas, chocolate candies that she makes herself. Being a single mother has not been an impediment to Leidy getting ahead. Leidy is thankful for the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise to be able to stock her business selling beers. That way she can make more income and be able to achieve her greatest dream: "to be a great businesswoman."

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Etelvina De Jesus

texts.es:
Etelvina, sigue buscando la forma de mantener su negocio funcionando y aprovechar la temporada indicada para sembrar maíz, ella opta por solicitar más capital que le ayudara a comprar semilla, abono, plaguicidas, pesticidas, insecticidas y pagará mozos, así no tendrá ningún problema para iniciar a preparar el terreno. 
Con el crédito anterior tuvo los insumos necesarios para mejorar su productividad, evitar problemas de plagas y optimizar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en: Etelvina continues seeking ways to keep her business functioning and to take advantage of the season for growing corn. She decided to apply for another loan that will help her to buy seeds, manure, pesticides, and insecticides and to pay hired help. That way, she will not have any problems starting to prepare the land. With the previous loan, Etelvina had the necessary supplies to increase her productivity, avoid plague problems, and optimize her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, pesticides, and insecticides and to pay hired help.

loans.name: Mary July

texts.es:
Mary es una joven trabajadora con 29 años de edad, soltera y vive en Nazca con su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja en una Constructora desempeñándose como personal Administrativo y de Logística, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable y emprendedora y porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia. Con el dinero que ella obtiene por su trabajo está remodelando su vivienda para poder brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad, comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Mary está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá pagar su curso de Titulación para que obtenga su Título Profesional, de esta manera seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y más adelante podrá cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su propia empresa".
texts.en:
Mary is hardworking. She is 29 years old, single, and lives with her family in Nazca.

For several years she has worked for a construction company in administration and logistics. Her work is going well for her because she is very responsible and enterprising, and because she wants to provide for her family.

She is using the money she makes from her work to make some improvements to her home. She wants to improve her family's security, comfort and quality of life.

Mary is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their support, she will be able to pay for a university course and complete her university degree. She hopes to continue working with a lot of determination and effort so that later on she can realize her dream of having her own company.

loans.use: to pay for a university course and complete her university degree.

loans.name: Noong Luong 10 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Panh is a 48-year-old Thai woman living with her other six family members in a small old Thai traditional house. Her family members include her husband, her mother-in-law, a son and his wife, a daughter and a grandchild. Her grandchild is in grade 5 while her daughter is studying in college. Her husband works for local construction employers and her son and his wife work at agricultural production with her to provide for the whole family. Their main activities are cultivating paddy rice fields, breeding fish, pigs, chickens, musk ducks and planting vegetables for the family's use. 

Panh has always wanted to develop and expand her business to cover living expenses for her family better, but she didn't know how, because she had neither much capital nor understanding about new techniques for efficient farming. This situation changed since the day she met Anh Chi Em Program and took out the first loan from here. Indeed, Panh used the loans to buy piglets, and with some training sessions, she gained much profit from raising pigs and selling them. This is the fourth time she has had a loan in the program and she intends to buy small fish because the fish she raised caught a disease and they all died. She hopes that with the guidance of an agricultural worker in Anh Chi Em, these situations will never occur again. 

Panh dreams her son will find a better job, her daughter will be successful in her career after graduation, and she will have enough money to build a new house for her family because the current house is too old and small for her big family. In the picture, Panh is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy small fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as soap cartoons, chloride gallons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
