loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for workers to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy different kinds of hair for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea and other fertilizers for her pineapple and pitaya (also known as dragonfruit) fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chairs, cutlery, and improvements to his business, among others.

loans.name: Elena Arely

texts.es:
Elena, se esfuerza por brindar en su comedor diferentes menús a precios accesibles para tener la preferencia de sus clientes, nuevamente solicita  capital para comprar verduras, carnes, pollo, embutidos, bebidas, gas propano, condimentos, arroz, frijoles, platos, sevillistas, tenedores, etc.
El préstamo anterior le dio buenos beneficios en su negocio atrajo más clientes, mejoro la calidad de la comida, sus situación económica le ha permitido tener un buen record crediticio y dar a su hijo un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Elena works hard to offer different menus at affordable prices in her diner so that customers will prefer to come to her establishment.  She is again requesting capital to purchase vegetables, red meat, chicken, cold cuts, beverages, propane gas, condiments, rice, beans, plates, napkins, forks etc.
The previous loan gave her business a good profit and allowed her to attract more customers and improve the quality of her food.  Her financial situation gave her a good credit record and gave her son a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, red meat, chicken, cold cuts, beverages, propane gas, condiments, rice, beans, plates, napkins, forks etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to refurbish her walls, paint the walls, install a secure door, install a floor and purchase a bedroom set.

loans.name: Luz Nelcy

texts.es:
Luz Nelcy es una experimentada mesera la cual a causa del fallecimiento de su pareja se ideo la forma para poder mantener a su pequeña hija de 4 años edad,
Su trabajo como mesero lo realizaba los fines de semana pero por motivos anteriormente mencionados busco una manera de generar recursos y poder estar cerca de su hija lo cual es muy importante en el crecimiento del niño. 
Con ayuda de los microcréditos logro montar una pequeña tienda ubicada en la casa donde paga arriendo, gracias a este negocio ha podido subsistir estos difíciles días pero manifiesta que los ingresos solo el alcanza para lo esencial como comida y arrendamiento por tal motivo solicita un crédito con el ánimo de incrementar sus ventas ya que quiere que su hija reciba buena educación  y tenga una mejor condición de vida, el crédito lo invertirá todo en compra de surtido desde abarrotes, grano, bebidas, snacks.
texts.en:
Luz Nelcy is an experienced waitress which, because her husband passed away, she thought of as a way to support her young, 4-year old daughter. 
Luz Nelcy worked as a waitress on the weekends.  For previously mentioned reasons, she decided to look for a way to generate income and be able to be close to her daughter, which is very important for her daughter's growth. 
With the help of the micro-loans, Luz Nelcy was able to open a small store in her home, which she rents.  Thanks to this business, she has been able to survive these difficult days.  However, she says that her income is only enough to pay for the essentials, like food and rent.  That is why she is requesting a loan; her intention is to increase her sales, as she wants her daughter to have a good education and a better standard of living.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of stock, like groceries, grains, beverages and snacks.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grains, groceries, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Isidoro Benito

texts.en: Isidoro Benito has been extremely happy with his 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester (pictured),  purchased with support from Kiva. His family is buying significantly less propane and the system is producing about 400 L of biofertilizer per day - enough for about 12 to 14 hectares of crops per year. He has started to see the positive results from the biofertilizer but needs a pump to help him more easily apply it; 400 L/day is too great a production to efficiently apply to crops without using a pump. This loan will help him purchase a solids pump, hoses, and quick-release clamps allowing him to more easily an effectively apply the biofertilizer to his fields.

loans.use: to purchase a pump for his biofertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine, a table and fabric.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo started working for the restaurant in 1993 as a bartender.  At the same time, he was working as a sub-contractor, managing and operating six parking lots in Chinatown Los Angeles. He transferred his business operating skills and experience to Domenico’s in 2005 when he became owner of the restaurant.  He streamlined the food ordering and tracking process by bringing in an electronic POS system; enhanced the security of the restaurant by installing a 24-hour surveillance system; and most importantly, increased the quality and freshness of food products. 

His 22 years’ experience managing small businesses gave him the confidence and expertise necessary to ensure success at the new location in Old Town Pasadena. Domenico’s has maintained the same location for over 30 years. However, the facility and parking lot was in need of renovation and continued disagreement over the lease agreement also contributed to the decision to leave said location to seek one that would better serve the customers and continue the reputation and tradition of Domenico’s. 

This KIVA loan will help Ricardo transition back into Pasadena and prepare the restaurant for re-opening.

loans.use: To pay for tenant improvements at his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine, a sewing machine, a generator and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones, accessories and a generator.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, no cuenta con el capital que necesita para surtir su negocio de manera inmediata y se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar gaseosas, jugos, calzado, agua, canastas, abono (orgánico y químico), plantas y hará mejorarás en su local.
Su negocio es de subsistencia y con el crédito anterior ella logro tener mercadería para seguir trabajando en la venta de plantas y a incorporado la venta de otros productos en su negocio, sus ingresos extras los utiliza para cancelar la deuda y cubrir necesidades primordiales de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa does not have the capital that she needs to supply her business immediately and she decided to request a new loan to buy soft drinks, juices, footwear, water, baskets, fertilizer (organic and chemical), plants and to make improvements to her shop. 

Her business operates at a subsistence level, and with the previous loan, she managed to obtain merchandise to continue working selling plants and has incorporated other products into her business. She uses her extra income to pay off the debt and to cover essential necessities for her family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juices, footwear, water, baskets, fertilizer (organic and chemical), plants and make improvements to her shop.

loans.name: Maria Margoth

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en el negocio, por el aumento que ha tenido de nuevos clientes y requiere de más capital para comprar leña, maíz, cal y bolsas, así continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar su inventario con los materiales necesarios para elaborar la venta de tortillas, mejorar la productividad, cuenta con estilo de vida más digno y mantiene un buen record crediticio.
texts.en: María now sees the need to invest once again in her business as the number of customers has grown. She needs money to buy firewood, maize, cal, and bags so she can continue to grow the business. Her previous loan helped her increase stock with the items necessary to make tortillas and improve productivity so María can have a better lifestyle and maintain her good credit rating.

loans.use: Buy firewood, maize, cal, and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins, antibiotics, analgesics, ointments, etc.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 33-year-old married man with five children of whom four attend different schools. He is an agriculturalist specializing in the growing of coffee, beans, and maize, and he has been a farmer since 2012. He was motivated by the fact that farming required less capital, his expertise lay in farming, and farming was an easy source of living. 

Godfrey works five days a week and seven hours a day. He also owns a retail business in Kyotera town from which he gets an extra income for his family. He hopes to use the money to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm and to plant more coffee trees. 

Godfrey's hopes and dreams are to expand his tomato garden. He usually sells his products to fellow traders from Kampala city. However, he faces a challenge of limited capital which affects his operations.

He is described as a hard-working and honest man in business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm and to plant more coffee trees

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia, es casada, vive junto a sus siete hijos, ella administra una venta de tortillas y pupusas, lo hace con ayuda de una hija, trabaja de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde, el negocio nace como una solución para tener ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su familia.
Realizara la compra de maíz por mayor para elaborar la venta de totillas y pupusas, de esta manera aprovechara el bajo precio que tiene en el mercado y estará abastecida con la materia prima para trabajar por mucho tiempo.
Su sueño es mantener su negocio funcionando y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación y salud.
texts.en: Silvia is married and lives with her seven children. She runs a stall selling tortillas and pupusas which she makes with help from her daughter. She starts work at 6 am and finishes at 1 pm. Silvia started the business as a way of earning the money she needed to pay for family expenses. She wants to buy maize wholesale to make tortillas and pupusas and thus benefit from the low market price. She will be able to store the maize and use it for a long time. Her dream is to maintain a strong business and provide her family with better food, education, and health.

loans.use: Buy maize wholesale

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en:
Imeleta is a 43 year old unwed woman with 3 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Imeleta has requested a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. With her profits, Imeleta hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller and gloves

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en una zona rural, desde muy joven aprendió de su padre a  sembrar granos básicos, actualmente lo hace de manera independiente, como una manera de tener ingresos extras desde hace seis años ha incorporado la crianza de cerdos. Por el momento no representa riesgos en su negocio.
Con el capital comprará abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas, semilla, dos cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, espera aumentar el capital de trabajo y tener más ganancias que utilizara para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
Su sueño es brindar a sus hijos un futuro lleno de oportunidades para que puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.
texts.en: Lucio lives with his wife and two children in a rural area. As a young man he learned from his father how to sow grain, and now he has his own fields. Six years ago, as a way of earning extra income, he started raising pigs. For the time being, he doesn't see any risks associated witht his business. With the loan money, Lucio will buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, seeds, two pigs, and special animal feed. He hopes to increase working capital and also profits that he will use to pay for financial commitments. His dream is to offer his children a future full of opportunities so they can study hard and get good jobs.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, seeds, two pigs and special animal feed

loans.name: Tautua Levei

texts.en: Tautua is a 28 year old unwed woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling ice-cakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Tautua has requested a loan to buy cordials, a small chest freezer, sugar, a cooler, Chinese candy and foam cups. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tautua will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy cordials, a small chest freezer, sugar, a cooler, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Alida is one member of the 15-person group, La Alternativa 1, 2, 3. Her group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry. Alida, like all in this group, decided to do business with Esperanza because she needed to bring extra income to her house. She is a divorced mother of three children. She is running a miscellaneous products business where she sells different products like cosmetics, shoes, accessories, and clothing.

Alida started her business with her first loan from Esperanza, and this activity allows her to support her family. With this loan she will invest in her business to increase her inventory. Her future plans are to have a wholesale store and provide her children a great education and all they need.

Alida joined Esperanza almost ten years ago and this is her 18th loan. All previous loans have been repaid and invested in her business. She thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics, clothes etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria ha tenido que pasar por varias situaciones para poder mantener su negocio en pie y seguir trabajando.
Ella tiene un pequeño kiosco ubicado al sur del Valle De Aburra, más exactamente en Itagüí, Antioquia. En este kiosco ofrece alimentos fritos que ella misma prepara, vende tinto, frituras y bebidas gaseosas.
Es un negocio muy visitado por los usuarios y trabajadores de un hospital que está ubicado al frente del establecimiento.
Hace mucho tiempo tuvo un conflicto con el hospital ya que quería cerrar su negocio por motivos estéticos, pero ella con mucho coraje monto una tutela que el final salió favoreciéndola y le permitió continuar con la posesión de su negocio.
Adicional a esto su esposo sufrió un accidente que hizo que ella tuviera que abandonar el negocio dejando a cargo a uno de sus hijos.
En conclusión es una mujer guerrera, y siempre dispuesta a proteger su patrimonio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de una greca para tinto nueva, un vitrina para exhibir sus fritos, un microondas nuevo y comprar surtido de frituras y bebidas.
Con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar la oferta y variedad de productos a sus clientes, aumentando así sus ingresos y mejorando su condición de vida y trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria has had to get through several situations to keep her business open and continue working. She has a small stand located south of Valle De Aburra, to be precise, in Itagüí, Antioquia. At this stand, she offers fried foods that she prepares herself. She sells coffee, fried snacks and soft drinks. 

The business is much visited by the clients and workers of a hospital that is located across the street from her establishment. A long time ago, she had a conflict with the hospital because they wanted to close her business down for esthetic reasons. But, with great courage, she initiated a protective action, that in the end came out in her favor and allowed her to continue in possession of her business. On top of that, her husband was in an accident and that forced her to abandon the business, leaving one of her children in charge. In conclusion, she is a fighter and is always willing to protect her property.
 
She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a new coffee urn, a case to display her fried foods, a new microwave oven and to buy an assortment of fried snacks and drinks. With this loan, she will have the opportunity to improve the supply and variety of products for her customers, and so increase her income and improve her living and working conditions.

loans.use: To buy a coffee urn, a display case, a microwave oven and a variety of fried snacks and drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing machine ,embroidery machine and iron.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El deseo de un hombre solo se puede medir con la determinación y ganas que este emplee para hacerlo realidad, es una frase con la que el señor Ricardo formo su idea de negocio pues ha sido un vendedor gran parte de su vida e impulsado por su ultimo jefe decide montar su propio negocio, un almacén de tenis que viene operando hace 2 meses en el cual ha logrado emplear una persona con vísperas y deseos de siempre mejorar de no conformarse de tratar de soñar en grande para esforzarse y trabajar en grande Ricardo solicita un crédito que invertirá en 2 exhibidores giratorios redondos y el resto lo invertirá en mercancía básicamente línea de ropa de hombre y dama, trazándose un reto de acreditar y expandir su negocio pues tiene un hijo por quien luchar
texts.en: The desire of a man can only be measured with the determination and will that he employs to make dreams reality is a phrase by which Ricardo formed his business idea as a businessman. For the majority of his life he has been inspired to be his own boss and open his own business, a sports shoe store that he has been operating for 2 months where he has employed one person and he has desires to always improve and not be satisfied with only dreaming but rather acting upon his dream and working. Ricardo seeks a loan to buy 2 round display racks and the rest he will use to buy clothing for men and women with the goal of expanding his business. He has one son for whom he works hard every day.

loans.use: to buy 2 round clothing display racks and clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Faaea Paauli

texts.en:
Faaea is a 45-year-old divorced woman with nine children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Faaea has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, sprayers, crops and new gum boots. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development since 2011. 

With her profits, she hopes to help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, sprayers, crops and new gum boots

loans.name: Fotoi

texts.en:
Fotoi is 33 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Fotoi has requested a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce and pots. She joined South Pacific Business Development in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fotoi will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya sauce and pots

loans.name: Milena Andrea

texts.es: Milena es una trabajadora mujer la cual formo una idea de negocios a través de ideas y microcréditos los cuales fueron fundamentales para montar su negocio pues por la difícil situación económica que atraviesa el país se le dificultad conseguir un empleo. Con base a conocimientos y estudios realizados en peluquería manicure y pedicura monto un salón de belleza en el sector con la gran ventaja de que es el único formalmente montado en la zona lo que supondría mucha clientela la cual ha venido fidelizando hace 4 años que lleva operando, hoy en día su negocio se ve amenazado pues no cumple con una de las normas que impone la  secretaria de salud para operar por ende solicita un crédito para la compra de un esterilizador para seguir operando e insumos como esmaltes, tinturas, shampoos, botox entre otros, conviertiendo su negocio en un gran salón de belleza bien dotado pues aspira a que esta forma de vida sea suficiente para cumplir su sueño de comprar una casa propia para vivir junto a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Milena is a hardworking woman who came up with a business idea through the use of micro loans, which were fundamental for starting her business due to the difficult economic situation that her country is experiencing, which makes it difficult to obtain employment. Based on her knowledge and studies in hairdressing, manicure and pedicure, she opened a beauty salon in a sector that had the great advantage of being the only such business formally established in the area. This would mean a broad customer base, which she has been cultivating for the four years she has been operating.

Today, her business is threatened because it does not comply with one of the health regulations required by the secretary of health. Consequently she is requesting a loan in order to purchase a sterilizer so that she can continue to operate as well as supplies, such as nail polish, dyes, shampoos and botox, among other items. This would convert her business into a great, well stocked beauty shop since she aspires to the kind of life sufficient to fulfill her dream of buying her own house to live in with her two children.

loans.use: to purchase a sterilizer to continue operating in accordance with health regulations required by the secretary of health.

loans.name: Luis Martin

texts.es:
Luis tiene un negocio de trapiche ubicado en el municipio de San Rafael, Antioquia. Ha trabajado allí desde hace 7 años elaborando productos a base de la caña de azúcar.
El ofrece empleo a una persona y tiene buen reconocimiento en el sector.
Prepara alrededor de 5 productos en los que se pueden destacar algunas mieles, dulces de caña, jugos y una bebida muy conocida en la región llamada guarapo.
Es un hombre con mucha experiencia y un carisma sin igual, factores que han hecho de é un excelente microempresario con gran capacidad para trabajar y progresar.
Hoy en día solicita un préstamo para pagar algunas deudas financieras y realizar mejoras a su local.
De este modo podrá atraer más clientes y turistas a su negocio al tener un establecimiento mucho más organizado y llamativo.
Esto impactara positivamente sus ventas y se verá obligado a aumentar satisfactoriamente su producción.
texts.en: Luis has a mill business located in San Rafael, Antioquia. He has worked there for 7 years making products from sugar cane. He employs one person and has a good knowledge of this business sector. He prepares about 5 products including sweetners, sugar syrups, juices, and a well-known regional drink called guarapo. He is a very experienced, charismatic man, which have made him a successful businessman with great capacity to work and grow. Today he seeks a loan to pay some loan debts and make improvements to his locale. In this way he will be able to attract new customers and tourists to his business as he will have a more organized and attractive locale. This will positively impact his sales and he will be able to increase his production.

loans.use: to pay debts and make improvements to his business locale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies that will help her to care for and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a flat-bed sewing machine, thread, nylon, elastic and cloth to fulfill her contract and allow her to employ a female head of household

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 26-year-old mother of 7 children. Her husband helps her in expanding their plantation so that they are able to earn more income from it. Amelia joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance as she is not able to get it from any traditional banks. She has been in the SPBD program for more than 3 years. 

Amelia plans to use this loan to purchase fertilizers, tools and equipment for her plantation, and timber, cement, nails, iron roofing and bricks for her home improvement. Being a member of the SPBD program has enabled Amelia to move forward from the tragic tsunami which hit her village in 2009.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, tools & equipment for her plantation, and timber, cement, nails, iron roofing and bricks for her home improvement

loans.name: Tele

texts.en: Tele is a 57-year-old married mother of 3 children. She decided to help out in earning some extra income to assist in taking care of her family and has thus decided to join the SPBD program in order to get financial assistance. Tele plans to use this loan to purchase a gas stove, gas bottle, cooking oil, sacks of flour and sugar, baking powder, cooking pots and plastic bags. By joining the SPBD program, Tele believes that there will be a great improvement in her family's livings standards as she had witnessed in the other women of her village who are also SPBD members.

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove, gas bottle, cooking oil, sacks of flour and sugar, baking powder, cooking pots and plastic bags.

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is a 51-year-old mother of 3 children. She has had a plantation business for more than four years, and her husband and children help her with the harvesting and selling of the crops. Koreti plans to use this loan to purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, shovels, spades, bush knives, a mist blower and vegetable seeds. She also sells vegetables as another means of making more money. Koreti joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial assistance. With the profits she was able to make from selling her produce, Koreti was able to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, a wheelbarrow, fertilizers, shovels, spades, bush knives, a mist blower and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en:
Taloa is a 47 year old married mother of 9 children. 

She has been in the SPBD program for more than 3 years. Not only does she operate a small shop at her village, but she also has her plantation to help out as another means of earning income for her family. 

Taloa plans to use this loan amount to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizers, and busknives for her plantation, and cement, and timber to renovate her home. 

By joining the SPBD program, Taloa has managed to use her profits wisely, not only reinvesting it back into her business, but also to cater for the everyday needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizers, busknives, cement, and timber

loans.name: Jhonatam Teofilo

texts.es:
Jhonatam es un joven con 22 años de edad, soltero, y vive en Chincha en la casa de sus padres.
Desde hace 2 años trabaja de manera independiente Formateando e Instalando Programas de Cómputo a los diversos clientes que solicitan sus servicios, teniendo un buen ingreso que es utilizado para apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante por eso más adelante quiere estudiar una Carrera universitaria.
Jhonatam está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar un Disco Duro para poder realizar mejores trabajos y que sus clientes se sientan más contentos, de esta manera ahorrando su dinero más adelante podría cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Estudiar una Carrera".
texts.en:
Jhonatam is a 22 year old single man.  He lives in Chincha in his parents' home.  For the past two years, he has worked independently formatting and installing computer programs for various clients that seek his services.  He earns a good income that he uses to help his family with their household expenses.  He is a person with a drive to get ahead, which is why in the future he wants to pursue a college education.

Jhonatam is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have given him, he will be able to purchase a hard drive that will allow him to do better work and please his clients.  Through this and saving his money, he will be able to reach one of his largest goals, to go to college.

loans.use: purchase a hard drive for his work.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 35 años de edad se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ana solicita un credito para comprar maiz por quintales para seguir elaborando las tortillas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica con su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 35 years old.  She has worked selling tortillas for many years.  She works from Monday to Sunday.  She has many customers because she is a hardworking and caring person.  With her earnings and the help of her husband, she is able to cover their household expenses.  She lives with her husband and their two children in a home that they own.  She is seeking a loan to purchase bushels of corn to continue making tortillas so that she can generate greater earnings to have more stability in their family finances.

loans.use: purchase bushels of corn.

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is a 48-year-old married mother of five children, two of whom are in school. A very hardworking entrepreneur, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for nine years. 

Rosella has requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more ingredients for her enterprise. She would like to save enough money to expand it and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital. She lives in a town with her family.

A $600 loan has been offered to Agusta to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store, like coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, water and noodles. 

Agusta is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking about running a big business after years of involving herself in business.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes, water and noodles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 38 years old, is single and she works very hard. Jocelyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jocelyn  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jocelyn  has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Jocelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 59 years old, married, and has five children.

Eva works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like bread, sardines, medicines, and other grocery items.

She has been running a general store for twenty years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Eva aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, sardines, medicines, and other grocery items

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 49 years old and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail business selling gasoline in the Philippines, and requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Emily has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the retail of gasoline for 3 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Paiana

texts.en:
Paiana is a 27 year old unwed woman and has 2 children. 

She runs a small canteen business in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Paiana has requested a loan to buy sandwiches, soft drinks, donuts, potato chips, plastic bags, and foam cups. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Paiana will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, soft drinks, donuts, potato chips, plastic bags, and foam cups

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 27 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, frijoles, leche entre otros, últimamente se ha hecho mucha clientela, pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con productos de excelente calidad a precios realmente accesibles y con un servicio inigualable; ella es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante, quiere sentirse ganadora y para lograr el éxito sus mayores secretos son la constancia y la dedicación, esta dispuesta a hacer crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, embutidos, golosinas, bebidas etc. ella tiene la confianza que con su dedicación podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The borrower is 27 years old and lives with her partner and son. She has a shop where she sells day-to-day items such as rice, beans, and milk, among other products. Lately, her number of customers has grown, as she always has products that people need, and they are of high quality and reasonably priced. She also offers excellent service. 

The borrower is an enterprising woman who really wants to do well. She wants to feel like a winner, and her secrets for success are perseverance and dedication. She would like to grow her business, and for this reason is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to help her to buy basic grains, instant foods, meats, snacks, drinks, etc. She is confident that through dedication, she can offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant foods, meats, snacks, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Emmanilyn

texts.en:
Emmanilyn, has been earning money from her transportation services business for more than six years. As one of the sources of income that helps her supplement her earning, she wants to improve her transportation business to gain more costumers and serve them better. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used in obtaining another motorcycle. 

Recently, she took a new loan to cover maintenance costs and purchase tires and spare parts. She is always hoping to earn more revenue to improve the general living of her family as well as to expand her business.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs & purchase tires & spare parts

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 38 years old, married, and has four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Loida has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Merlyn has been farming rice for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 24 years old, single and works hard to support her parents. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income by  buying and selling rice.  

Sherlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 15000 to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her future children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is married and she works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Carmencita has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business. In the future, Carmencita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport and seaweed culture. Delia is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing nets for her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie works hard to support her family. Ritchie is married and has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Ritchie has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Phoert's Group

texts.en:
Phoert is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area located in the Sangke district, Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice and raises chickens. She and her husband have been in this business for 10 years. The current business earns her family about 42,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day.
This is the second loan for Phoert with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phoert wants to use her portion to buy seed and the labor costs to plow the field. She hopes to increase her yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seed and the labor cost to plow the field

loans.name: Regeline

texts.en:
Regeline is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Regeline is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Regeline has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en:
Ritchie is 31 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, cream, shampoo, etc.

Ritchie has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, cream, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase an assorted merchandise, fix up the restaurant and improve their public image because the competition is very fierce and they can't stay behind.

loans.name: Thoerb's Group

texts.en:
Thoerb is aged 46 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Sangke district, Thoerb has been raising pigs and farming rice. Having been in business for 11 years, she manages to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to feed her family. 
This is the tenth loan for Thoerb with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Moey's Group

texts.en:
Moey, 47, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Sangke district. She has six children. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and raising chicken for 11 years and the current business earns her family about 50,000 KHR per day. 
There are three members in Moey’s group and Moey has been with VisionFund for nine cycles. She is now leading her group to ask for another loan to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Anina

texts.en:
Anina, 26 years old, is married and has one child. She is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. Anina opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $150. She earns a good income from her business.

Anna will use her loan to buy some stock, such as body lotion, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, books, pencils, soft drinks, beer, noodles, slippers, shampoo and bread, to keep in her store. Anina is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, books, pencils, soft drinks, beer, noodles, slippers, shampoo and bread

loans.name: Margarida

texts.en:
An 800 USD loan is offered to Margarida to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own capital. 

She will use the loan to buy inventory to sell in her store like eggs, noodles, cigarettes, bread, and oil.  

She  is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of running this business.

loans.use: to buy eggs, noodles, cigarettes, bread, and oil

loans.name: Laura Beatriz

texts.es:
Laura Beatriz
Laura es cliente nuevo de Fape, Tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos de belleza, empezó hace dos años y debido a no tener mucho capital no ha podido surtir mas su negocio, ella sueña con algún día abrir su propio local y surtir mucho mas de productos. Espera que Fape le ayude a cumplir algún día su sueño. No tiene créditos en ninguna otra institución y solicita el crédito para comprar cremas corporales, shampoo, lociones, esmaltes para uñas, y tratamientos para el cabello.
texts.en:
Laura Beatriz is a new Fape client. She has a business selling beauty products. She started two years ago and because she did not have much capital, she has not been able to stock up her business. She dreams of one day opening her own store and stocking many more products. 

She hopes that Fape will help her fulfill her dream. She has no loans out with any other institution, and she is requesting the loan to buy body cream, shampoo, lotion, nail polish and hair treatments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in order to sell them

loans.name: Nuval

texts.en:
Nuval is a 32-year-old man and lives with his two children and spouse in the Philippines. 

Nuval has been saving for many days to buy tires and spare parts, but most of his savings are spent on basic household expenses. Now he wants to buy tires and spare parts for his motorcycle but he does not have enough money to make those purchases.

Therefore, Nuval has requested a loan from GDMPC and this loan will contribute to his savings and allow him to purchase tires and spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Puavai

texts.en: Puavai is a 23-year-old single woman with 2 children. For the past 3 years, she has run a small business selling pancakes in her community. Puavai has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, a new oven, a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, spatulas and sugar. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Puavai will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a new oven, a large frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, spatulas and sugar

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en: Ellen, 45 years old, is married and has seven children. With two children in school, Ellen works very hard to provide for them. For the past 3 years, Ellen has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell. In the future, Ellen would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ermedita

texts.en: Ermedita, 39 years old, is married and has two children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ermedita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seeds and fertilizers. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Victor Anibal

texts.es:
Víctor, ha realizado mejoras en su vivienda, ofrece a su familia mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud, esto es posible a la buena inversión del crédito anterior.
Nuevamente se decide por un nuevo crédito para seguir teniendo mercadería para vender y tener clientes satisfechos, comprara agua, jugos, gaseosas, refrescos y bolsas por mayor.
texts.en:
Víctor has made improvements to his home, provides his family with a better diet, clothing and health. This is possible thanks to his good investment of the previous loan. 

He was again decided to request a new loan to continue to have merchandise to sell and have satisfied customers. He will buy water, juices, sodas, soft drinks and bags wholesale.

loans.use: To buy water, juices, sodas, soft drinks and bags.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, ha comprobado que los créditos son una buena herramienta para progresar con el negocio y opta por un nuevo crédito para comprar faldas, camisas, blusas, pantalones y otras prendas que le sean de utilidad para mantenerse en el mercado y no perder la preferencia de sus clientes.
Con la inversión de los créditos ha mejorado las circunstancias familiares, tiene  un buen record crediticio y su negocio se mantiene bien surtido para lo que sus clientes demanden.
texts.en: María has seen for herself that loans are a good way for her to succeed in her business, and is requesting a new loan to buy skirts, shirts, blouses, trousers, and other items of clothing which will help her to remain in the market and maintain her customers' business. By investing her loans, she has improved her family situation. She has a good credit record and her business is well-stocked to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy skirts, shirts, blouses, trousers, and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy urea, 12-24-12 fertilizer, Gramoxone, and nitrate to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sokhorn, age 48, is from a rural village located in the Sangke district of Battambang province of Cambodia. She is widowed with three children. She has earned a living for the past four years by growing rice. The current business earns her family about 26,000 KHR per day.
Sokhorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and she completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Файзулло жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 52 лет. Он женат и имеет 4-х детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Файзулло живёт со своей семьёй в небольшом доме маленького посёлка. Жена Файзулло является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь постоянный хороший доход на пропитание, Файзулло занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Файзулло в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Файзулло купить ещё несколько голов скота, чтобы увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Файзулло очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Fayzullo is a cheerful and hardworking 52-year-old man. He is married and has four children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support. Fayzullo lives with his family in a small home in a tiny village. Fayzullo's wife is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have a steady income to live on, Fayzullo has his own business. He fattens up and sells cattle. He receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with his business. She sells the milk which she gets from the cows. Now Fayzullo wants to buy several heads of cattle to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Fayzullo really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Moert's Group

texts.en:
Moert, 44, is married and has six dependent children who are all still in school. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in the Battambang province Sangke district.  The main sources of her family’s income are from raising pigs, distilling alcohol, and her husband also earns additional income  from fishing. 

She has been running her business for 11 years, earning about 70,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day. 

Moert received her first loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. Moert wants to use her portion to buy pig feed. 

She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to make a good profit and a living better.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for many years and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her three children. The couple had to work hard, with determination, to make a better income to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Editha would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With an amount of 20,000 PHP, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely wants to express her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Editha hopes to become successful and live fairly with her neighbors and her regular customers. She dreams of a happy family.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Floserfeda

texts.en:
Floserfeda is 59 years old, married, and has eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Floserfeda has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.  

Leonora has been in this business for 3 years now.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Hace más de 6 años, Walter de 44 años, inició su negocio vendiendo licor con tan solo un espacio libre con unas cuantas láminas de zinc. A medida que iba creciendo, fue invirtiendo en su negocio, remodelándolo y agregando productos para la familia en general y para el hogar. Este bombero, antes albañil y padre de 2 hijos de 18 y 10 años de edad, uno de ellos asiste al colegio, siempre ha sido trabajador, a pesar de solo haber ido a la secundaria, pues quiere llevar adelante a su familia y darles lo mejor, en especial a su hijo con síndrome de down.  
Walter cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, quien a diario lo ayuda cuando le toca asistir alguna emergencia como bombero. Este hombre multifacético tiene buena demanda en su negocio, sin embargo, no posee una buena higiene en el baño, pues tiene una letrina. Por esta razón, solicita de un préstamo de saneamiento para poder construir un inodoro, de manera que pueda mejorar su nivel de vida y ofrecerles una mejor prestación higiénica a sus clientes, quienes constantemente hacen uso de ese servicio. En estos momentos piensa seguir ahorrando pues desea que en un futuro pueda remodelar su vivienda y seguir ampliando el negocio.
texts.en:
More than six years ago, Walter, 44, started a business selling alcohol in a small open space surrounded by a few sheets of zinc metal. As the business grew, he invested in it by renovating and adding products for families and households. 

Walter is a fireman who used to be a construction worker, and is the father of two children who are 18 and 10 years old, one of whom attends school. Walter has always been hard-working despite having ended his education in middle school. He wants to help his family get ahead and give them the best, especially to his son, who has Downs syndrome. Walter has the support of his wife who helps him daily when he has to go to an emergency as a fireman. 

This multifaceted man's business is popular. However, his bathroom isn't very hygienic, as there is only a latrine. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to improve sanitation and put in a toilet, so that he can improve his quality of life and provide a more hygienic environment for his customers, who regularly make use of the bathroom. Walter wishes to continue saving money so that in the future he can renovate his home and continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to install a toilet.

loans.name: Roeng's Group

texts.en:
Roeng is a 51-year-old mother of three children living in a rural village of the Sangke district of Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 11 years and her husband supplements the family’s income by growing cassava. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the seventh microloan for Roeng with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Roeng wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her rice and cassava. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for rice and cassava.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Rowena runs a general loan in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  She has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle has been earning good income from her swine fattening business for more than six years. She successfully repaid her previous loan which was used to purchase feed and vitamins. The main source of income for the family is their coconut farm. She plans to cultivate the farm and fertilize it in order to gain more returns. 

She is taking a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She wants to improve her business as well as her farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use on her coconut farm.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
For more than seven years Luzminda has been selling grocery items in their village to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business. Her husband works abroad and it helps a lot in sustaining their business and the general expenditures of the family. To improve sales she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

 She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to finance her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business since 1998 and she has repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by adding sacks of rice and by maintaining her apartment which she also manages for business purposes.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for additional stock. She is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

Flocerfida only hopes that her income will never fail so that it can sustain their daily needs.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Lani has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  NWTF is re-listing Lani's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming flowers.  Teresa is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell in her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested additional loan to further build her business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Ratha is aged 44 years and is married with three children. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming for the last two years. The current business earns her about 48,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Ratha is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to have a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for her farmland.

loans.name: Gennefe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Gennefe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from making nipa roofing.  Gennefe is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Gennefe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita owns and operates a transportation services business. She has done this work for more than eight years, earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for motorcycle repair. With her loan, the services provided were safe and secure.

Recently, she took a new loan. She will use this loan to purchase spare parts and accessories. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Mila Mar

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mila Mar works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from tailoring. Mila Mar is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mila Mar has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Jerica

texts.en:
Jerica is 33 years old. She has two children, who are in school, and she works hard to support her family. She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Jerica is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy meat to sell at her butcher shop. Jerica has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She successfully paid back her previous loans, and now she is requesting an additional loan, to further build her business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan, aged 44 years, is a married mother of four children. She lives in a rural village of the Sangke district, Battambang province, Cambodia. Raising chickens and buying recyclables are the main sources of her family’s income, and her husband supplements the income by working as a paid laborer.

Chan has been with VisionFund for two previous loan cycles, and she completely paid back the previous loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Chan wants to use her portion of this loan to buy chicken feed and more chickens to raise. She hopes to earn more income from her poultry-raising business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to raise and chicken feed

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district of Cambodia where farming is a common way to make a living, Sambath is a 35-year-old mother of four dependent children, three of whom are still in school while another one is too young for school. 

Rice farming is the main source of the family’s income. She and her husband have been in this business for 15 years and her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. 

This is the tenth microloan for Sambath with Kiva’s partner and she has completely paid back her previous loans. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of income so as to increase her family's income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sandwiches, donuts, pies, twisties, plastic bags and foam cups

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

She earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and native products. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

"Carla has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  and save money to expand her business in the future."

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 49 years old and married with one child.

Rubina is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rubina requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rubina has been farming rice for 14 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sandra Nohemy

texts.es:
Sandra, con el propósito de ampliar la variedad los diferentes diseños que actualmente tiene, comprara alambre, tenazas, piedras, cuarzos, dijes, hilos, broches, etc., para elaborar collares, anillos, pulseras y otros, así como también seguirá abasteciendo a sus clientes de los materiales para elaborar sus propias piezas. Serán de ayuda para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias con las que cancelara su deuda.
Su negocio ha sido fortalecido con el financiamiento anterior, hoy en día tienen mejores ventas y ganancias, con las que ha respaldado sus pagos y aportado a los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sandra, in order to expand the variety of the different designs that she currently offers, will buy wire, pliers, stones, quartz, charms, thread, clasps, etc. to make necklaces, rings, bracelets, and others. She will also continue to supply her customers with the materials to make their own pieces. This will help her increase her sales and her income, with which she will pay off her debt. 

Her business has been strengthened by the previous loan. Today, she has better sales and profits, with which she has made her payments and helped with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wire, pliers, stones, quartz, charms, thread, clasps, etc.

loans.name: Sreynak's Group

texts.en:
Sreynak is 26 years old and lives with her husband and one daughter in a rural village of the Srey Snom district. Rice farming is the only main source of her family’s income. She has been farming rice for about eight years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 20,000 KHR, but she is able to save 10,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Sreynak with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreynak wants to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Na

texts.en:
Na, who is 24 years old and a lovely mother of two kids, lives in a remote area of Peam Ro District, Prey Veng Province. To make money to support her family, she and her husband have been working as farmers for nearly 10 years. Na and her husband are able to earn USD 3 in one day.

Recently, Na has applied for a loan, which is the third loan for her, to pay for building a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Na is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to pay for building a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en:
Chhuon, 64, is a hard-working woman and lives in a rural area of Prey Veng Province. She has ten Children of which five of her children are already married. From being a farmer for more than ten years, she is able to make a net profit of USD 3.5 per day and her husband is also a farmer who can make the same profit.

Chhuon would like to improve her living conditions and make life more comfortable by having clean energy like solar to use in her household. Due to insufficient funds, she has applied for a loan of USD 500 to buy a system for a solar home. This purchase will enable them to gain access to electricity, which will provide power to home devices such as lights, TV, and radio. She thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to pay for solar system

loans.name: Tausala

texts.en: Tausala is 19 years old and single with no children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Tausala has requested a loan to buy cordials, a chest freezer, sugar, a cooler, plastic bags and rubber gloves. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tausala will pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy cordials, a chest freezer, sugar, a cooler, plastic bags and rubber gloves

loans.name: Lunn

texts.en:
Lunn, who is 52-year-old and a lovely mother of five school children, lives in a remote area of Doun Dei Village, Chrey Vien Commune, Prey Chhor District, Kompong Cham Province. To make money to support her family, she and her husband have been working as farmers for nearly thirty years. Lunn and her husband are able to earn USD 4 a day.

During this time, Lunn has applied for a loan, which is the second loan for her, to pay for building a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Lunn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment

loans.use: to pay for a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena has been operating her own tailoring business for five years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her two children. Together with her husband,  she works hard, with the determination to have a  better income to provide their children with better education. 

To improve profits, Magdalena would like to apply for a new loan of 12,000 PHP,  that she will use to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials, needed in her business. She sincerely wishes to express her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Magdalena hopes to grow her business and desires nothing more than a simple and harmonious life for her family.

She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also she draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is a 58-year-old mother, who was blessed with three children. To support her husband in generating income, she runs a small retail store within her community. Despite the hardship of living, she has the determination to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. She aims to further improve her store and increase her income but has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy sugar, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, snack foods and canned goods to sell. Through this loan, she believes that someday she will increase her product offerings and income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soft drinks, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, snack foods and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a very hard working entrepreneur from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school and three who are now working. Lando, her husband, works as a driver. She manages a mini-canteen and a variety store business and her income from the businesses is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Gloria is taking a PHP 10,000 loan to buy grocery items and orders for her customers. She will be using the loan to buy products and other raw materials that are necessary to increase her inventory.

In the future, she wants to make improvements to her business and to help her sons complete their studies.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Jovita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of cashew and peanuts business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Jovita is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy cashews and peanuts to sell for her business. .

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew and peanuts to sell for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Delia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee and spices for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, coffee and spices

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Milagros is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
