Marcos de 55 años de edad, vive con sus 3 hijos, quienes le ayudan a realizar sus labores agrícolas y con su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios del hogar, Marcos solo estudio hasta 8 grado, luego se dedicó totalmente a la agricultura.

Marcos se dedica a la agricultura, a 1 km de su casa siembra 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz, y en agosto siembra 30 libras de frijol,  para luego tener las dos cosechas en noviembre y diciembre. Este grandioso oficio lo aprendió de su padre cuando tenía 12 años de edad, ya que eran tiempos difíciles y había que ayudar con ingresos de alguna forma.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar 2 quintales de urea, 2 quintales de sulfato y una caneca de gramoxone, para fertilizar y limpiar el maíz. Con estos productos podrá darle un buen manejo al cultivo mejorando su producción y así poder tener más ingresos y también poder sacar sus granos básicos para darles una buena alimentación a sus hijos. 

Marcos quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos, ya que son la principal fuente de alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is 55 years old. He lives with his 3 children, who help him carry out his agricultural labor, and his wife, who performs household chores. Marcos only studied until grade 8. He then devoted himself completely to agriculture.

Marcos makes a living as a farmer. 1 km away from his house, he plants 3,500 square meters of corn, and in August he plants 30 pounds of beans. He then has both crops in November and December. He learned this great job from his father when he was 12 years old, since it was a difficult time and he had to help with the income in some way.

This loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy 2 quintals of urea, 2 quintals of sulfate, and one unit of gramoxone to fertilize and clean the corn. With these products he will be able to handle his crop well, improving his production. That way he will have more earnings, and he will also have basic grains in order to give good nourishment to his children. Marcos wishes to continue producing basic grains, since they are the primary source of nourishment for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2 quintals of urea, 2 quintals of sulfate, and one unit of gramoxone to fertilize and clean the corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulls.

loans.name: Jerevic

texts.en: Jerevic plans to improve her house by renovating it but her savings are not yet enough to finance the renovation. She joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services. Farming is the main source of income for her family and she helped her parents working their farm for a living. She is requesting a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer to boost her farm. She is happy to know that in the near future, she will be able to gain more harvest from her farm.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost her farm.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda and her family lives in a rural community and makes their living through farming. They were gifted with three children and they want them to earn a degree so that they will found a good job someday. Despite financial hardship, they want to continue sending their children to school. They help each other in cultivating their farm land by planting various vegetables for sale. They aimed to expand their vegetable planting, but they lack sufficient capital. For this reason Imelda is requesting an additional of PHP 32,000.00 loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in growing their vegetables. She is hoping that the loan will allow them to expand their vegetable planting and ensure a higher yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in growing vegetables

location.town: Brgy. Bone South, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mary Irene

texts.en:
Lourdes is a very hard working entrepreneur from Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is 29 years old and manages a canteen and offers direct catering service for many different events or occasions. Her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

(When most people refer to a "caterer", they are referring to an event caterer who serves food with waiting staff at dining tables or sets up a self-serve buffet. The food may be prepared on site, i.e., made completely at the event, or the caterer may choose to bring prepared food and put the finishing touches on once it arrives.)  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy raw ingredients and products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Lourdes hopes to be able to expand her catering business in order to serve more people.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyiransabimana est une brave commerçante, trésorière et membre d’une plateforme d’affaires  «Karibu», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe sa marchandise au marché central de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  5 sacs de pommes de terre. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique. Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
This client, Nyiransabimana, is a good and honest merchant and the treasurer, as well as a member, of the business platform “Karibu”. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 42 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children, who are all students. This client is a vendor of grocery items. She sets up her merchandise at the town’s central market. 

She started her business with initial capital from her husband when he was alive. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for five years. This new loan will be used to purchase 5 sacks of potatoes. Thus, she would like to provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be noted that one client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: La cliente Meso est une commerçante depuis 12 ans, secrétaire et membre de la banque communautaire «Neema», entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des poissons fumés. Elle étale sa marchandise dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 180 poissons. Son conjoint est un militaire de la force loyaliste. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu d’un mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite augmenter son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien, qu’elle apporte aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancable. Il sied de signaler q'une cliente porte son bébé dans ses mains.
texts.en:
This client, Meso, has been a merchant for 12 years. She is the secretary and a member of the communal bank “Neema”. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all students. She is a vendor of smoked fish. She displays her merchandise at the town’s central market. 

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to purchase 180 fish. Her husband is a soldier in the loyalist forces. She started her business with funds from her husband. For the future, she would like to increase her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked women entrepreneurs. It should be noted that one client is hold her baby.

loans.use: to purchase 180 fish

loans.name: Afya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia  est une commerçante, présidente et membre d’un collectif  d’affaires «Afya», entrepreneur, âgée de 56 ans, mariée  et mère de 9 enfants qui  tous, étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse de braises et huile de palme. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un marché de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu  de son ami. Son conjoint est un  pasteur dans une église locale. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs de braises et 70 litres d’huile de palme. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de  l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Vumilia, is a merchant and the president, as well as a member, of the business collective “Afya”. An entrepreneur, she is 56 years old, married, and the mother of nine children, all students. This client is a vendor of charcoal and palm oil. She displays her merchandise at a market in town. She has been in this business for fifteen years. She started her business with funds from her friend. Her husband is a pastor in a local church. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal and 70 liters of palm oil. Thus, she would like to  increase her capital and provide schooling, clothing, and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical period post-conflict in the country’s east.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal and 70 liters of palm oil
